Reviews.Title: “Ignore the bad reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Hjones2403
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a room which sleeps 4 people and after reading the bad reviews we were all a bit apprehensive! The room was spacious, the beds were really comfortable and clean and the hotel was well equipped (with a nightclub and 24 hour food to eat in/take away) the staff were polite, friendly and helpful also! The hotel was quite far from the city centre but the tram service is so efficient it wasn't a problem at all!

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: accura_sg
Reviews.Content: The reception staff was unfriendly and rude. Didnt manage to retrieve our booking and have to wait 2 hours for all our three rooms. Rooms were quite old and it smell. Bed sheets were not very clean and some stains on it. No breakfast but has a small eatery serving food 24/7 at reasonable prices. Free wifi in the hotel. The hotel is located at a residential neighborhood and if you take the tram, you need to walk about 10 to 15 mins to reach the hotel. Saw some shady characters ard the hotel neighborhood and dont feel safe going out at nite.

Reviews.Title: “Rudeness and mice...”
Reviews.Author: GuidoS811 Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My title says all. In order to avoid complaints (maybe for the mice nite walks), the reservationists are rude and refuse simple helps like printing a travel paper or ... giving a correct receipt of your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Big space, quiet and restful.”
Reviews.Author: Kristie H
Reviews.Content: My partner and I arrived late on a Monday night to find our hotel friendly and still serving food and drinks at 10pm (which made us very happy). We were on the 4th floor in a quiet area and were not disrupted at anytime during out three night stay. We had the Superior Double Room which gave us alot of space and a spa bath which we enjoyed very much. Everything was in order and clean. All the employee we saw around the hotel were friendly. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sueo60 Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay. We did have some issues with our room the first night, no main light in bathroom, shower leaked so we had a flooded bathroom and the air con was blowing out hot air but went to reception and when we came back to hotel, later in day all fixed! So then we had great showers with dry floors! Although the hotel is a good 25 minutes from the centre of Amsterdam by tram, we found it to be an easy journey and never waited long for a tram to come along. This was my second stay at the Hem Hotel and I would return again if the price was right!

Reviews.Title: “Animals in the roof and room !!”
Reviews.Author: Kirsty H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Hem Hotel Amsterdam at the beginning of April 2012. At first we were put in room 400 (the top floor), throughout the first afternoon we could here scratching in the ceiling, we were then woken up at 2.30 am to the sound of an animal moving around in the ceiling, which strangely sounded like a rabbit. We called someone up from reception who promised to change our rooms the next day. We later realised they have wild rabbits around the area so assumed the noise we heard was a rabbit(s) living in the roof. We then tried to go back to sleep to then be woken up by another scratching noise, to then discover this noise was not in the ceiling but in our room inside the dressing table (between the wall and table), I then saw a mouse through a cable hole in the table! We got into our second room at 2 o'clock the next day (you are not allowed into your room before this time under any circumstances). This room was fine, we didn't hear anymore noises, it was clean and tidy, despite looking out onto the motorway it was surprisingly quiet. We found most of the staff to be polite and helpful. The hotel is in a residential area which we had read many complaints about prior to staying there, however we didn't have any issues. The hotel is a short tram ride away from the city and other restaurants and attractions. Due to our experience in the first room we would not advise anyone to eat in the hotel as we don't know whether they have a problem with mice and other animals. Overall the hotel is very basic and good value for money, ideal if you are going to Amsterdam for a short break and just need somewhere to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “clean and fine”
Reviews.Author: burtie144
Reviews.Content: Big bed, own bathroom, perfect breakfast. Parking in the price, you have to go by tram to the centre, but thats fine

Reviews.Title: “quite ok budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brita F
Reviews.Content: We were 2 couples staying 4 nights the weekend before easter. We wanted to spend as little as possible on the hotel, but still have some comforts. We got a really good rate, and to be honest, didn't expect too much. The staff was helpfull and friendly troughout the stay. The beds a bit torn and worn, but very good. And the rooms were in general quiet, no traffic/city noise. But, next door was 2 inches from our door, and the noise from the inhabitants coming/talking/leaving were bad.Especially the creaking door. Every time they opened the door it sounded as our door creaked open, quite annoying when you're in bed... The rooms were otherwise clean and ok.

Reviews.Title: “not so bad”
Reviews.Author: jetl1965
Reviews.Content: just basic but cheap.. long away from central...not recommended in short trips if you not like to be in tram half of your trip.little delay when coming but not so bad

Reviews.Title: “Clean and spacious but rude unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Katie T Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I am used to the Dutch way of being blunt with what they say but we were given a replacement room after they had 'overbooked' and left at reception for half an hour at midnight while they spoke to each other in Dutch trying to sort it out after only telling us 'There is a problem' at this point. This was not an unusual problem as I heard other people being told the same thing and being moved to other hotels, whereas we were given a different room. I also heard someone trying to book a room directly at reception to be told "We don't take bookings here, you have to do it online". Seriously. We eventually received a key card but found this didn't work and had to go back down 2 flights of stairs to reception and wait again so they could fix this. Then the room we were given and the whole corridor was freezing cold and the temperature control stuck on air conditioning and we had not been given a remote control to change this. Another long wait at reception and this was sorted by about 1am. The fire escape at the end of the corridor was wedged open, which was why it was freezing. The room was clean apart from the shower which had some mould in it and towels, shower gel, liquid soap and a TV were provided. A snack bar in reception provided a decent-sized breakfast called 'breakfast-to-go' although actually on a plate for 3,75 which is quite a bargain. So no more problems until my dad who was staying with my mum in a nearby hotel fell and broke his front tooth. I queued for about 10 mins to speak to someone at reception - even though what looked like the manager was standing supervising a trainee receptionist and not doing anything else. I eventually got his attention and asked for the number of a local emergency dentist to which I received the reply "We are busy, you can google it yourself". The hotel did have free wi-fi but no computer and my crappy phone did not want to connect to this without me turning on my data services and I was worried about roaming charges. In the end we gave up and my dad had to wait til we got back to the UK. Am I asking too much for a hotel to have written down some emergency contacts? It would take them about 10 mins on a one-off occasion. Overall I would recommend this hotel for its spaciousness (wide open reception and stairs not like typical Amsterdam buildings) and cleanliness but definitely not for its service. The reception staff and manager(?) were rude and did not seem to have basic customer service skills.

Reviews.Title: “friendly but not equipped”
Reviews.Author: Nima M Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the staff were very nice and behave friendly but the rooms eere not suitable at all. they did not even have a refrigratot which is a basic necessities.

Reviews.Title: “mice in amsterdam ... and not with clogs on!”
Reviews.Author: Gillian S
Reviews.Content: Just back from 2 nights at the Hem Hotel. First night we overheard a couple complaining of a mouse in their room, the next morning I woke up to see one in our room, on the table at the bottom of my bed. On complaining someone was sent up with a plastic cup and plastic bag but by that the mouse had scarpered. Turns out it had been eating my Bounty bar and I was told that I should not have left food out?? They apparently have a problem with mice in their kitchen and have cats down there. the room itself appeared to be clean and was warm but having a rodent infestation in a hotel is not good and not something I have ever encountered before. I didnt feel they took the problem seriously, although moved us to another room when I complained. I would definitely not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “short stay”
Reviews.Author: stephen d Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Hem 4 times now. Happy with the accommodation once again. Easy to get to from Town. Decent size rooms. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “very good with good connectivity from the city center”
Reviews.Author: Jayashree C Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay very much!!!! it was absolutely comfortable. It is worth paying for this hotel. we stayed in a four bed private en suite and we were very much satisfied with the facilities. I recommend this place. wish u all a comfortable stay in amsterdam.have fun:):):)

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs/veggedyr”
Reviews.Author: Family o
Reviews.Content: This hotel is full og Bed bugs/veggedyr. A few days after we came home, we got painful/itching rashes, with characteristic 3-4 bites in "a row" fro bedbugs/veggedyr. We saw a couple in the room, but didnÂ´t realise what it was, as the insects werenÂ´t known to us. Nor did we know that they invade your luggage and invade your home, so we have spend a little fortune on a pestcontrole firm. So a short stay in a cheap hotel, turned out to be an expensive and painful experience...

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for such a great stay :)”
Reviews.Author: Sara D Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the service was fantastic everyone was very polite and more than happ y to help, the room was fantastic for the money we paid and the fact that a cleaner came round every morning was great! the location wasnt the best as it was far to travel to Amsterdam Central but we felt it was value for moeny as it was fairly cheap for the hotel, the snack bar that is open until late was great as you could get drinks & snacks. i liked that the room was nice and it was really good value for money, i didnt like how we didnt have a kettle in the room but that was the only thing i didnt like!

Reviews.Title: “No nonsense value for money”
Reviews.Author: dhorse
Reviews.Content: Less than 10 mins walk to no 2 tram. 20 mins walk from airport train (Lelylaan). whatever about other rooms, number 243 certainly has no issues with hot water , noise or cleanliness. Didn't eat there but selection looked fine and plenty of people seemed to be eating there, useful if you arrive late as it is 15 mins walk to nearest eataries/bars.Probably a bit out of centre for all night party animals.

Reviews.Title: “Why all the bad reviews?”
Reviews.Author: Daniel F
Reviews.Content: I've been to this hotel 4 times. Every time the staff have been completely courteous and helpful. We have at no point felt intimidated or scared. The 'Budget' section of the hotel could be a shock if you weren't aware that it was in cabins at the bottom of the car park but these rooms are more than reasonable for the price. They are old and tired but clean and cosy. These rooms are great if all you want is a room bed and shower for the weekend staying with mate.As for the rest for the hotel, it is excellent! Clean warm and friendly rooms. We go back to this hotel every year due to the ease of travel, only 10 mins on a tram straight to central station. Would recomend this hotel to couples and friends alike.

Reviews.Title: “get what you pay for?”
Reviews.Author: Linnetey
Reviews.Content: After seeing previous reviews we were not expecting a palace. the reception area was nice, the one member of staff very busy with lots of people trying to check in. When we got into the block we were staying in and it was already obvious what we had got ourselves into, it smelt, the was a brick being used to hold the door open. when we got into our room we found the beds to have fresh sheets, the bathroom- unusable the floor of the shower was cracking and had sharp bits on. The toilet was dirty with hair on it, also hair in the sink, toilet smelt VERY bad. One plug socket was broken- and the wires left exposed, mould on sealing. photos to prove all. Poor location - walked around outside the hotel for a bit felt quite unsafe.

Reviews.Title: “Far from the center”
Reviews.Author: Rattaman
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite far from the center of Amsterdam, but it can be easily reached - close to highway, good tram connection from Central Station - ca. 20min. Neighborhood after dark seems not to be very safe, but maybe it's just an impression. Rooms in the main building, rather clean and comfortable. I have heard some complains related to rooms in the small building opposite to reception desk. Check-in and check-out hours are highly respected. Overall, it is a good place to stay, just far from heart of the city. On the short trip to Amsterdam I rather recommend hotels in the center.

Reviews.Title: “Poor”
Reviews.Author: Monika S
Reviews.Content: I have spent only one night here when travelling to Argentina. For one night it's quite OK. Still the location is poor. It's neither in the city center, nor near the airport. The showe was broken. The staff was not too friendly..

Reviews.Title: “delicious but expensive breakfast”
Reviews.Author: kobriatko
Reviews.Content: we stayed 3 nights here. hotel is very easily reached by tram 2 from Central station, reception staff tryed to charge us higher amount that we have confirmed ( confirmation was made directly from their site!!! ) be carefull while paying, they dont tell you, that you have no breakfast and VAT included ( no mather you have it in reservation)!! hotel is noisy, you hear everything.. cleaning was made every day. room was big enough, just one bed was broken. there were towels, but no cosmetic issues. breakfast great, but if you pay it directly in the hotel, it costs 12,50 â‚¬ p/p.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS”
Reviews.Author: J S
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the HEM Hotel from Feb 13th - 16th. I was about to write a review when I got back but then got lazy. I WAS going to say that it was convenient, cheap, and an overall decent place for the cost we paid. The beds were comfortable, the bathroom was plain, outdated and needed repairs but for the cost of the room, I didn't care. I left thinking that I would stay there again if every in Amsterdam. HOWEVER, it had been almost a week since I got back and have found over 60 bed bug bites all over my body. My doctor said the bites were from Amsterdam and that it only reacted in my body now. I have been in so much pain and discomfort because of this and ABSOLUTELY REGRET staying there. I am also happy that I decided not to write a review earlier since it clearly took a week for my full experience with the hotel to become apparent to me. BE WARNED: DO NOT STAY IN THIS HOTEL, ESPECIALLY ROOM 101.

Reviews.Title: “2 night stay in mid feb 2012”
Reviews.Author: m d Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: good hotel, much better than it looks like outside, only peice of key informtion is that it is located out of town (15 euros in a cab) and in a very urban area with some sort of alocoholic/drug rehab a couple of hundred yards away. Staff were friendly and rooms very clean. Great value

Reviews.Title: “Not sure what the bad reviews are about”
Reviews.Author: 086bagofcats
Reviews.Content: Ok, This is going to be a long review to tackle some issues other reviewers had.... My BF and I stayed here Feb 12th-15th. We initially paid â‚¬25 a night for both of us but we asked for the room with the jacuzzi if it was available.(This was an extra â‚¬20 a night but still damn cheap!) They were able to give us room 402 and the room was HUGE!! It was very clean, very plain, just a bed, a desk, 2 chairs, a TV, open wardrobe and luggage holder thingy by the door!! I think there was originally balcony access but the door had been screwed shut.. It had these huge picture windows overlooking the motorway (?) but we didnt notice any noise at all. The room was warm and comfortable, the bed was comfortable and clean, and the bathroom had the jacuzzi bath, separate glassed in shower stall, loo and sink. The jacuzzi was a fab way to chill at the end of the day, and was large enough for two ;-P The hotel itself seemed to be OK although we really didn't spend any time in it, only our room. But It looked clean, the staff seemed pleasant enough and there was a lift to the 4th floor. It is approx 5-10 mins walk from the tram stop, and a 3 min walk away is an estate shopping area where we got drinks etc from Lidl and a rather nice kebab on the second night. I didn't notice any funny smells, the cleaner came in and cleaned every day and didn't touch any of our things. Maybe we just struck lucky getting the room we did, so maybe fork out the extra few pound and also request room 402! Because of previous reviews I did actually go down the stairs one of the days and nosied down the corridors but it all looked (and smelled!) OK! Overall we had a great stay, we wanted somewhere comfy and clean to sleep and that's what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed after theft”
Reviews.Author: Rubeng03
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights, room was decent for the value, smelled a bit funny and had a few suspicious stains on the wall and floors. The toilet was bellow standard, the shower was missing the shower curtain so it ment that the toilet was soaked after a shower. Outside during the nite there seems to be a lot of traffic passing in the early hours of the morning. After an evening out came back to the room to discover that the room had been trashed and an ipod had been stollen, there was no forced entry which ment it had to have been the staff who had been cleaning earlyer. The manager said there was nothing the hotel could do. I will not be returning, nor would i advise anyone to stay there. For the money it cost it was good, thats it

Reviews.Title: “I'm not good with smells”
Reviews.Author: JasmineJMK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just for one night as the picture looks ok, and the price was good. It has an average rating on here so I thought why not? It's only for one night. I think I just got a bad room. The main thing for me was smell. I'm not good with smells and this room smelled of cheap stale cigarettes. The bathroom smelled of stale urine. As we walked in though it was basic but what we expected. My main problem was the bathroom, there was the worst shower I have ever seen in my life, it looked like an outside tap and it sprayed in any direction but the shower which resulted in a flooded bathroom as there was no door. The toilet didn't flush but my boyfriend fixed it. The bedside lamp didn't work and my bed dipped in the middle. Good TV though with BBC 1 and 2, however the 'free wifi' wouldn't work. Also a little tricky to find at first and I don't think I'd bother staying again...

Reviews.Title: “Got exactly what I asked for”
Reviews.Author: DarrenN3
Reviews.Content: Askex for a cheap room within tram distance of central square. Hotel was cheap as Chips for booking early and no problem throughout my stay although it was a little cold

Reviews.Title: “FOUND RATS AND POWER CUT OFF!”
Reviews.Author: simonhoang
Reviews.Content: I checked in the Hem Hotel at 10pm. 10minutes after packing, The power cut off. We then went down to complain and the staff were rude. A male member said they cant do anything beside we have to wait. it's been over 2 hours stilling in a dark room with no tv no light or nothing! Again, we went downstairs and asked a different member of staff and he said they will give us a free pizza for the inconvenience so we waited downstairs. Whilst waiting, we NOTICED A RAT IN THE FOOD AREA. again we told the staff and his respone was "Oh, is that all?" and walked away. This is our first 3hours in the Hem Hotel and all i can say is this is possibly the worst ive ever been in. Im not much of a complainer but I feel this is unaceptable. Hopefully if you stay you wont recieve the service we have. Thanks for reading.

Reviews.Title: “Hem Hotel Never Again.”
Reviews.Author: georgepp
Reviews.Content: Well i have stayed at the Hem hotel on 5 different occasions in the last 4-5 years. However i am never to stay at this place again!! On the first few visits on several occasions i and a freind were sleeping in our room when we woke to find a member of the hotel staff opening our room door with no real reason. The staff did not seem to be as friendly as you would of hoped and were not helpful at all. On my 5th stay a number of items got stolen from our room, clothes, aftershave, and a rucksack had been stolen with no sign of a break in. We were told by THE MANAGER of the hotel that no1 had a key apart from us and her. We found a english maintenance man strollinou want safe andg the corridors the next day with a master key to every room.!!! If you want a place to stay that you can FEEL SAFE IN. . . . DONT STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “I paid for what i got........But i love Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: blitz18
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Hem hotel on Saturday the 14th January 2012. Paid Â£200.00 for the hotel and flights for two people. Arrived at the airport and never really looked in to how to get to the hotel, which is really unlike me, ended up gettng a cab!!..... Got well and truly KNOCKED!!... my own fault i know but 42 Euro's for not even a 15 minute drive was shocking!!. I thought i would expect this in London!!. Arrived at the hotel which looked like it was in the middle of a council estate. The staff were friendly and we had arrived early and was unable to check in to our room, but we were able to leave our luggage in the luggage room which was locked!. The Tram is literally a 10 minute walk from the hotel which takes you right in to the town centre you are able to get a tram ticket which last's an hour which was 2.60 euro. you are also available to get a 24 hour pass for which was seven euro. The trams come literally every ten minute's and takes about 18 minute's to get to the central station. We stayed in room 152 which was freezing cold.... the shower was really hot which was a huge bonus. Could have moved and moaned but literally only slept there. The room was basic with two single beds and was in the first floor had a bar area which i never used but did get hotchocolate at 3 am one morning and the staff were really friendly and helpful. The bathroom was cold and old but the shower was really hot..... which was lovely coz the room was so cold, the telly worked not that i watched it and the lights worked!!. The hotel corridor's were dirty and stunk of weed, it was a non smoking hotel but stunk of weed. on the saturday walked around the city centre and was making myself aware of the city centre and having been my first time in Amsterdam i was SHOCKED at the Red Light District and i thought i actually aint a prude!!... 12pm lunch time and they are in the booths waiting for punters, by the third day of being in the city it felt "Normal" to see the girls in the window and not looking as sleazy as i had thought!!.... Majority of the girls had breast implants and hair extensions so they must be earning a bit lol. I actually felt quite sorry for the girls as some looked young and in there early twenty's especially when u see the amount of men that think they come out and throw thier hands up in victory!!..... Sad Sad Men!!...... Amsterdam was truly amazing from the canals to the coffee shops to the shopping and it is a truly beautiful city that i cant wait to return to in the summer it was freezing there. The staurday night got the Tram and went to The Supper Club which is a wicked experience YOU have to do this... after reading the people's reviews i was thinking hmm have i made the right choice!!, my friends had been previously and said i have to go!!. The trip was for my husbands 32nd birthday, and we went as a couple i think if you have an open mind and are able to enjoy it and hvave fun you are able to fuly experience Amsterdam at its best. Arrived at the club which is on Joeng Rostenburg not sure if thats the right spelling and it literally is a door which looks like a flat, we arrived inside and met by the host who was friendly and told us to goto the barwhich was downstairs, we put our coats in the cloakroom and then got drinks from the bar and went and sat on a double bed which was in a black padded leather room which had television's above the beds, here we waited to be called in to the restaurant. Once in the restaurant and showed to the huge sofa beds which had a small silver tray... this place was very chic and had an amazing experience. Our waitress Felic looked like Lady Gaga at the begining of thenight by the end of the night she had done several strip teas acts and looked like she was on a brazillian beach by the end of the night. The dinner per person is 70 eiro's each and that gives you entry to the club, we stayed here till 2am and was tired and very full after. Was given five courses and they were all cooked well and was hot. Really enjoyed the food but u go there for the experience it was truly amazing and strange but in a good way!... one to see i thought! got the night bus home which was 4.20 euro each and was right on the bridge at central station. Visited the Prix coffe shop which is a lot nicer than the other's that are about, leather sofas and seperate smoking rooms upstairs. Le place is great for lunch and was 12 euro's for two large rolls and real freshly squeezed juices..... excellent food and loads to choose from alot of locals were using this place to! Anne Frank's house was a really good experience and gave you an insight on how she must have felt is much better if you read the book as you can remember quotes from the book that are in the museum. 9 euro each. The bag museum i thought was good looking at the bags was more interesting than the actual information but was worth a visit. The flower market is beautiful and was really pretty to see. A visit to Casa Rosso a live sex show is a must it was not as bad as i thought very strange watching people have sex dont get me wrong but a funny night!... they do get people up from the audience it lasts an hour and a half and then just rotates back around. Get your tickets from the ticket and tour shop near the main square and the robabank and the rolex shop 47 euro per ticket which included four drinks. My whloe experience was truly amazing and i loved ebery minute of it.... i thought it was an amazing place and really funny people walking around stoned an thinking its normal with huge joints lol...... well funny to watch, everyone was happy there was no trouble in the town centre and had an amazing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly disappointing hotel”
Reviews.Author: VxM_12
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend booked this hotel for a surprise visit to Amsterdam for us both and another couple in January 2012. Upon arrival we were told we could safely store our luggage until check-in in the luggage room. We were given a code to enter the room and told to leave our luggage there, however we all refused to do so as every individual who was either leaving or entering the hotel had access to this room. The room was unmanned and full of suitcases/bags. I did not relish the thought of some backpacker making off with my suitcase full of our clothes for the week, so refused to do this. The room the other couple stayed in was nice, however our room was horrendous. It felt seedy and unclean. There was a dirty mans handprint on the wall which is very off putting. Yet I do have to admit after going round the room with a handy wipe, it was clean in there. The carpet was full of dodgy looking stains and I actually refused to let my bare feet touch the carpet. The throw on the bed also had very suspicious stains on it. The Hem Hotel website is throughly misleading, my or there other couples room did not look anything like the pictures they have on there. It also states that most rooms have hairdryers, my room did intact have a hairdryer, the other couples did not. My hairdryer did not work however, and when we went downstairs to tell the receptionist it did not work, we were told in no uncertain terms that none of the hairdryers in the hotel worked and that we would have to pay a fee to rent one, but when we could rent one was unknown as all of them were taken and had no return time. Fabulous if you have long wet hair and have to walk round windy and rainy Amsterdam for 5 days! Luckily we managed to buy a hairdryer from a nearby 'Blokker' store. The hotel was fine for a few days stay where you only need somewhere to put your head, and it did just that. The website does not accurately represent what the hotel looks like, the standards, or the proximity. The hotel has also charged an unknown fee of 12 euros onto his bank card since we left. Upon check out we were told there we no outstanding charges, so why this charge has popped up now we are unsure. This hotel is fine if you just need somewhere to sleep. Some tips: leave your luggage at the central station luggage store (a lot safer and easier), take your own hair dryer, do not stay in room 107, and take some slippers for the dodgy carpet.

Reviews.Title: “thank you Hem, you have made our trip memorable!”
Reviews.Author: nasosasos
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days not willing to spend so much time in the hotel, although it was so accommodating. We were wandering all day long around the city centre, so all we needed after an exhausting day full of museums visits and coffeeshops, was a clean, spacious and comfortable room that wouldn't cost a fortune. The Hem has met all our expectations. It is located very close to the highways that lead to other major cities of the Netherlands, providing a free car park as well, which is quite rare in Amsterdam. Most of the times we used the tram since the stop was roughly five minutes on foot and with a pretty frequent service. Staff is very professional, smiling and helpful giving us all detailed information that we needed. The price we paid was equal of the hostels, so we felt so lucky that we booked this valued hotel instead! We would definitely recommend it to all our friends plus to families with young children and people on business trips since it's very close to the airport and city centre. We are looking forward to going back to Amsterdam and book once again the Hem.

Reviews.Title: “lovely and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tracey R
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner on the ground floor, rooms are spacious, en suite bathroom, mini fridge etc. Outside it has a garden area with benches where we chilled out, i would recommend this hotel and will def be booking this hotel again in the future as the tram stop is only a few mins walk and easy to get to town centre

Reviews.Title: “Decent Enough Hotel”
Reviews.Author: monkeyman99
Reviews.Content: Although the location is perhaps not ideal being 20-30 minutes from the centre - its easy to get to from Schiphol by public transport, has a nearby tram stop to/from the centre within 3 minutes walk which also doubles up as a "nightbus" stop which runs until approx. 5am so its not as bad as you first think. The staff were friendly enough and there was a late bar and also a snacks / drinks kiosk which is open until approx. 4am, we had fresh towels, the bedding was clean and the room had a heater / air conditioning unit, tv and large bathroom. Overall, don't expect the earth, but if all you want is somewhere easy, clean and inexpensive then you could do far worse than staying in the Hem Hotel. Would highly recommend getting a GKN travel card which are available in 24, 48 and 72 hour versions as they represent great value for money offering unlimited travel by bus, tram, metro and nightbus.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs bit me to pieces”
Reviews.Author: Jar02
Reviews.Content: When i first turned up to the HEM hotel Amsterdam, I was surprised at the location. It is outside of the city center, and if you are on a leisure holiday i would reccomend going slightly further in as it is a ten minute walk then a twenty five minute tram ride into Central Station. This is not a massive deal to me usually, but i went to amsterdam for the nightlife and trams stop at 12.30 at night so need to get a taxi back to the hotel and taxi prices are EXTORTIONATE. The rooms have been newly refurbished, and at first glance looked very nice and clean. After a closer look I could see that it was really not very well kept, the TV had no remote, nor did the air conditioning, the shower was hanging off the wall and the toilet flush was broken, the electricity was dodgey and every few hours we would have a blackout for a minute or too. The cleaner came in at half 8 both mornings, did a light tap then burst in the room, ignoring the 'do not disturb sign' and only left after i would scream 'NO'. But worst of all - bed bugs. I am completely covered head to toe in bites. The first morning i woke up with one itchy bite on my leg, thought nothing of it and carried on. The second morning i woke up with loads of bites! I would guess over 50 and thats being generous. They are everywhere all over my body! And as I stood up and started to itch, I could actually see the bugs crawling around on the bed, I found 7. I did report it to reception before leaving the hotel, and the woman seemed like she didnt really care, I was leaving and they just wanted me out rather than listen to what i had to say. I would not stay at HEM hotel amsterdam again as you leave with more than a nights sleep - hundreds of bites!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: Brummie_Em
Reviews.Content: After reading the terrible reviews that the hotel had received I was prepared for the worst. Yes the hotel is a little way from the main areas - about 15mins by tram however for the price of about 40 Euros a night (and over the New Year) you could not really go wrong. The rooms were spacious and clean and although the hotel as a whole could do with a lick of paint, updating of facilities and some better storage for cleaners (seemed to be cupboards hanging off their runners etc!) it was absolutely fine. The beds (2 singles) were comfortable and although the location is right next to a ring road I had a quiet nights sleep. It seems to be popular with youngsters but had no problems with them whatsoever. Our TV didn't work but I wasn't too bothered about that and didn't bother telling the reception! A couple of the male receptionists were a bit unfriendly, however there was a very friendly lady working behind the bar and another on reception who were very friendly. I would recommend the hotel to those on a budget as it may be better than hostels etc.

Reviews.Title: “Decent location for a nice hotel with good prices.”
Reviews.Author: Femmelieneke
Reviews.Content: The HEM hotel is a bit out of the city center but with its own private parking. When using tram nÂ° 2 you go directly to the city center and central station. It is well worth the effort to go there first and buy a 24h ticket for the public transport. Using the public transport is the best way to get around the city and stops are at all the sight seeings. The hotel itself isn't good looking at the outside but once you go inside it all changes. The lobby is nice and the staff are very friendly and helpful. When booking you have to make sure that you decide how you want to stay because you have the option of hostel and hotel. We took a hotel room because we wanted some privacy and this was well worth the extra money. Rooms are clean and big enough. Breakfast was not included but there is a small shop at the entrance of the hotel where you can buy something small to eat. Definitely recommendable!

Reviews.Title: “dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: hashenton
Reviews.Content: run as fast as you can from this place i stay there before and found it not bad but that was in 2006 i stay there in 2011 and the place went down hill it was dirty no internet the 2 weeks we was there they keep say tommor so if you want a good place to stay in amsterdam this is not it

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay and friendly staff - well worth the money”
Reviews.Author: BudgetBusiness
Reviews.Content: HEM is a wonderful basic hotel and well worth the money. I highly recommend it. To put my stay in context: - I paid - Average of 40 Euros per night (including taxes) - Average of 7 Euros per night for Internet access (24 hours) - All comments below should be interpreted within the context above General impression: - Staff were very friendly - Guests were mostly young, but very quiet - Facilities were basic and worked well. You *will* get your money's worth!!! I liked the following: - The internet connection was OUTSTANDING! - Skype actually worked flawlessly! - I was able to download files at a constant rate of 200-300 kb/s - Toilet facilities were very good - Shower worked well, and had good pressure - Roomy - There was plenty of room for me, and it would have been easy to fit another person. - Bed was very comfortable - Temperature was easy to regulate - TV had English channels I disliked: - The front desk gave me an iron (20 Euro deposit to ensure I return it), but the iron did not work. They did not have a replacement. On the third night, they gave me a brand new iron (I took it out of the box). It was great... but I wish I had it earlier. - There was no ironing board - The internet connection didn't work on the last night (although I didn't confirm with the front desk). I didn't complain because the Internet connection was soooo good on the previous nights. Kudos to HEM! Transportation: - Hotel is only a 10 minute walk from the #50 metro. I used this every day. Public transportation is very good in Amsterdam, and there were plenty of ways to get to the hotel. - The area is very safe Possible "Gotchas" - This hotel has two distinct parts. I stayed in the newer (and more expensive) section (Note I only paid 40 Euros for my room). The older part is operated as a youth hostel. It is cheaper, but watch out. Those who complain about HEM must have stayed in the youth hostel, paid the lower price, and expected the higher service. I really recommend the "regular" hotel - where I stayed. - Breakfast is very expensive (15 Euros), so I never used it. However, remember this is a part of the hotel's operating model. So work accordingly. There is a grocery store within about 100 meters. - The hotel is right next to a very busy motorway (A10). My room actually faced the motorway. HOWEVER, the motorway has a sound barrier, and even with my window open, noise from the cars was very low. It worked out well for me, and I would easily take the same room again. - The hotel has good transportation, but it is somewhat far from the city center. Nevertheless, it is convenient. Here are my "transportation" times: - 10-minute walk to the Henk Sneevlietweg metro station. Some busses stop closer, but I just walked. - From Henk Sneevlietweg metro station, it takes about 20 minutes to get to Schiphol airport, or 15 minutes to Amsterdam Centraal. - I read the reviews on Trip Advisor and was somewhat worried, but all my doubts were quickly put to rest! - Most guests were tourists aged 18-35 years old. My stay was very quiet. Possibly others could have problems. I stayed for business, but I would happily stay as a tourist. Congratulations HEM hotel! I made the right choice, and would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean average room for a cheap price”
Reviews.Author: ladypeace84
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, beds were comfy and has all the necessities. Toilet was a in need of repair but still ok. We bought accommodation plus day travel pass as well, which was good since the hotel is about 15-20 mins away from central. There's a tram stop near the hotel and it's not easy to get from there to the hotel the first time because the hotel is is quite hidden among all the residential houses but just ask around for direction. Ours came with free breakfast and they served variety of foods, you will be spoilt for choice!

Reviews.Title: “I recommend, if your plan is just to sleep there!”
Reviews.Author: tahti13
Reviews.Content: Nice enough place, about 15min by tram from Dam Square. The area is a little shady, but we managed alright. The staff was helpfull, not "american" friendly, but ok. Breakfast was 12,50 and really worth it, allthouhg I highly recommend you go and have breakfast somewhere in the city (the atmosphere in the little breakfast cafes is blissfull!!!). Rooms were really basic, beds comfortable and shower worked ok. There was a slight aroma in the hotel corridors and in the garden, but hey, what do you expect...

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: zombiestar
Reviews.Content: Since we knew we are booking a hostel and not a hotel, we weren't expecting much. The room was basic, beds were clean and confy. The bathroom was very old, especially the shower but overall OK! By paying 15 euro for a twin bed room, I think we god what we paid for. The location is OK, maybe a little bit shady. The metro is very close, and there are also 2 supermarkets if you want to grab something to eat. The staff was also a little bit shady.

Reviews.Title: “Hem Hotel”
Reviews.Author: S S
Reviews.Content: Awful. If you like to score crack or any other Class A hard drug then this area is the place to go. Location was scary - enroute to the hotel once off the tram, we were hassled by toothless skagheads demanding money as well as having the misfortune to stumble across a bunch of hardnuts exchanging large sums of money for suspicious looking packages. Very scary indeed. Do not be fooled by the gallery on the official website as we were, it looks nothing like this. Room was extremely basic and very old, in desperate need of new beds and shower, etc. Didn't stay the 2nd night we booked as it was uncomfortable and just overall horrible. The only thing going for it was that it was quiet. Avoid!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 3 star.”
Reviews.Author: punitworld
Reviews.Content: Last week, I stayed in this hotel for two nights. The room was decent sized but very basic. The mattress were too old and needed replacement. The shower was well below the expectations of a basic shower. Having said so, room was quiet and no disturbances. Location wise it was just across the highway and well connected to public transport. Hotel charges for parking car. The lady at reception was helpful. Ambiance and environment in the hotel is not very encouraging. Pathways are shabby and it is no way a 3 star Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not so clean, personal could be more helpful”
Reviews.Author: Jsfn
Reviews.Content: Rooms are not clean, personal not to helpful but breakfast was okey.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chuzelbug
Reviews.Content: A group of 6 of us stayed at the Hem in October 2011 for 1 night. Check in was quick and easy. Rooms were clean and tidy, comparable to a Travel Lodge. Plenty of hot water for the showers and TV had a couple of English channels. Facilities adequate, bar and eating area downstairs but a little pricey. Main complaint is that the hotel is situated approx 15/20 mins by tram outside of the city center. Cant see the hotel from the tram stop, had to ask the way, which took us through the middle of a residential area of flats. I would have been nervous had I been on my own. Check in isnt until 2:00pm but when you arrive at Central Station there is a baggage drop where for Â£4 you can leave your case while you enjoy the city and pick it up when you are ready to head for the hotel. If you are driving there is adequate on site parking.

Reviews.Title: “dont believe all you read!”
Reviews.Author: MrEaton
Reviews.Content: i read some awful reviews on this hotel and was fearing the worst, however it was clean tidy and had very good facilities! complaints wise was the hotel was situated a little far out but thats being fineckety as i enjoyed the tram ride into dam square and such and a 3 day pass only cost around 15 eruos (10 gbp) and my other question mark was it was a little understaffed but the staff who were there were friendly helpful and accomadating, all round value for money however i would say short stay, as no view from windows etc but i wasnt there to look at views from windows so thats a some what pedantic quote

Reviews.Title: “Kinda far away”
Reviews.Author: Brandon S
Reviews.Content: The hotel was perfect except that it was quite a bit far away from all the attractions. The rooms were big and clean. Do make sure that your shower drain is functioning because you can easily flood your bathroom if you don't. There is a sandwich bar in the hotel lobby that is open until five in the morning. The staff was knowledgeable about where to go and what to see. There is a train stop that is just about a three minute walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't listen to the other reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Jeni A
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in this hotel from 16 October to 22 October 2011 and loved our experience there! I had read the reviews on this and other websites about the hotel and was expecting a horrible run down hotel but when we got there I was pleasantly surprised. We stayed in room 130, on the first floor for our entire stay which was in the main building and I'm assuming the same as the other rooms in the hotel. It included a large window which opened, a radiator which you could adjust the heat settings to, a TV (with free cable-we only discovered until the last few days of our holiday), multiple lamps around the room, four desks(including bedside tables), two leather chairs and two twin beds which were pushed together to create a double bed. In the bathroom there was a basin, a toilet, a shower, a hair-dryer and a plug for electrical razors. Everyday the water was hot in both the basin and the shower which was a relief as many reviews said there wasn't any hot water. We had paid for breakfast for everyday of our stay which consisted of an buffet of bread, jams, meats, cheese, beans, eggs, bacon, cereals, fruit, yoghurt and salad. Originally I was worried about this as I am a vegetarian and I know it is typical of Dutch breakfasts to have cold meats with bread but I helped myself to bread, beans, eggs and cereal which kept me full beyond lunchtime. Our room was cleaned daily; rubbish was removed from bins, the floor was hoovered,our bathroom was cleaned and our bedding was changed which made the room smell fresh again . There was a mix up at the beginning of our stay as Expedia had sent the hotel a receipt to say we had paid for 5 nights but we had actually paid for 6, I told the receptionist that night and I was told to come back in the morning to tell the manager. After thinking this was my fault I checked my emails on my phone and showed him my receipt and trip summary - after 9AM he called Expedia and everything was sorted. The only 'problem' with this hotel was that it was not in the centre but we had bought a 3 day travel pass for Â£15.50 that could be used on any of the trams, metro and buses for an unlimited amount and caught the tram to and from Dam Square. This was very quick but we ended up going past Vondelpark and lovely areas such as Prisengracht and Leidsplein which had shops and cafes to stop at and we felt less like British tourists travelling this way because we used a common method of transport without fiddling with maps. There are other passes available to buy on the tram, bus or at a metro station ranging from 1 to 100+ hours - this is cheaper than getting a taxi! Furthermore, you can rent bikes from the hotel if you have your credit card with you - however neither my boyfriend or I brought our cards with us so we could not do this although we would have loved to. Additionally, there is a map at the front of the hotel but I would bring one with you which shows the transport routes to help you. I used a miniature 'Eyewitness Travel' Amsterdam book which came with 3 foldaway maps including a transport route map for the trams - very useful I found. If you are stuck for things to do as you exit/enter the hotel you will find lots of leaflets such as the Van Gogh Museum, Rijksmuseum, Heineken Ice Bar etc. Lastly, as food in Amsterdam is very expensive I would advise going to Lidl which is nearby-google or ask reception for directions-or buy food from the large supermarket in Dam Square called Albert Heijn as this will make your money last longer! Overall, we loved Amsterdam and the Hem and will definitely be returning in the early Spring of 2012. I really hope this puts your mind at ease and you have as much as good stay as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Save your money”
Reviews.Author: Furumoen
Reviews.Content: If you can't afford any other hotel in Amsterdam then wait to go there until you can. This hotel was probably the worse we have stayed in and it seems to me that they are alive thanks to Expedia and other huge online sales channels that never have to face their customers when they return from their trip. The hotel is far from the city center which means you have to add daily travel expenses when you want to see the sights of the town. We got a room with no windows to open and a poor air condition so not only did we get sick but we felt miserable in the warm room with no air. They have around 260 rooms and very few staff so hard to get help if needed. And they don't know how to smile or to say yes. The published internet service did not work, there were no hair dryers in the room and never one available in the reception. It was perhaps cheap but got expensive as we regret the trip all together thanks to this poor hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected - compared to previous reviews”
Reviews.Author: whatsuptigerlily
Reviews.Content: From the online pictures we were not expecting much - we just wanted a cheap room to explore Amsterdam. We were surprised with the quality of the decor and the amenities considering they did not look that good in the pictures. The room was clean and presentable, no problems like other reviews, everything worked. I would have preferred to stay closer to the city, but I couldnt afford to. Staff were fine and no problems for our two night stay where we out most of the time and just saw the place as a bed.

Reviews.Title: “Not good”
Reviews.Author: Kolbeinn
Reviews.Content: Me and me collagues was on business trip and stayed there for 1 night. The hotel was cheap and the hotel was not good. Dirty and service level not good. Although the breakfast was good. Location is out of centrum. Unfortunately I do not recommend this hotel unless maybe for a very very short visit.

Reviews.Title: “room was robbed on budget site”
Reviews.Author: Hapix
Reviews.Content: I had a bad experience last June. I stayed first on budget site as long as my room was robbed on evening time. Lost a laptop, credit card and other minor things. Staff wasnt too much bothered, they gave me first another room on budget site which was also robbed and door broken, imagine that, and only after that they gave me more expensive room on hotel site. That was the only compensation they ever gave me. Police were very helpful and cooperative though.

Reviews.Title: “Not Very Good”
Reviews.Author: dustyfoot
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at Hem Budget Hotel in Amsterdam, we were put into the rooms which were not directly in the hotel but in a block opposite the hotel, as we were coming up to the hotel outside my friend noticed a rat, yes a rat! the room was not nice, it had mould on the ceiling above one of our beds. The bathroom was small and when you sat on the toilet and I am a short person, my knees were touching the wall, it was very uncomfortable to say the least, when I went to have a shower all I got was drips of water and not the flow you would expect and we had to call the maintenance person, the Hotel reception was not too bad, I'd rather have stayed in the lobby in reception than in the room as it was much cleaner than the room. We also noticed on the way in to the communal stairs to our room there was a bottle of water, when we left it was still in the same place, that says alot for their cleaning of the hotel! NOT! I would not stay there again, it was not a nice place to stay, so unless you are desparate, choose somewhere else! I have to say the staff were ok and helpful. The staff in the bar were especially nice.

Reviews.Title: “william efc”
Reviews.Author: bob k
Reviews.Content: we are currently staying here as we speak, and are in a state of shock. we read the reviews prior to arriving here an thought it can not be that bad, but it was far worse, you dont hve a window to open and with the musty smell it becomes unbearable, i suggest you have alot to drink and smoke if you want to sleep!!! dont bring your lady here or it will be over!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing like the description!”
Reviews.Author: sue p
Reviews.Content: Myself my daughter and 13 year old son stayed at the HEM hotel for 2 nights. We arrived @ about 22.00 when it was dark. The tram journey from Amsterdam Central took about 45 mins and the walk from the tram stop was another 10 minutes through a derelict run down building site and what looked like drug/alcohol rehab hostels! We felt frightened and unsafe and walked as quick as we could with our suitcases. The hotel/hovel fitted in well with the surrounding area. The receptionist looked like a gangster while the creepy staff who just seemed to hang around doing nothing except chatting to each other looked like on the run illegal immigrants! Whilst waiting to order some food from the little food bar, we watched a little mouse happily running around the kitchen floor! When I told the staff they just laughed! I wish now that we had done some more research before booking this 'communist east european detention centre'!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very bad experience”
Reviews.Author: sanne594
Reviews.Content: Forget the Hem Hotel/Hem Budget Hotel in Amsterdam â€“ Our room was disgusting â€“ it smelt of urine from the bathroom, was unclean and to top it off our room was broken into (No physical signs of break-in so an inside job...?) The Hem Hotel did absolutely nothing to help us â€“ they were not interested â€“ they would not call the Police, told us they did not even have their phone number and left us with no alternative but pay for a taxi to take us to the Police Station. We left the hotel as we did not feel safe â€“ this is a very bad hotel â€“ DO NOT stay here unless you want to get robbed and donâ€™t mind a room that smells like a dirty toilet.

Reviews.Title: “Flea Infested and Dirty”
Reviews.Author: Sakae M
Reviews.Content: 10 of our team stayed during IBC (Sept. 2011). 6 had severe flea bites. Complaints included unclean rooms, one person found a dead flea in his bed, air con broke/rooms humid/stuffy, dirty laundry carts in hallways 24/7, broken lifts (had to drag luggage up and down to 4th floor), mildew in bathrooms, inconsistent maid service, front desk unfriendly, has a sign posted to not leave anything in cars--leave empty glove compartment open--unsafe area, sheets and bedding stained (some look like blood?), and lighting in some rooms had issues. Wireless Internet works depending on where you are located per the hotels staff and costs to use. If it even works for one moment and not the rest, you still don't get a refund or credit. Good points: breakfast and non-smoking hotel.

Reviews.Title: “we got what we paid for”
Reviews.Author: Robin412
Reviews.Content: We wanted a hotel that provided free parking, since most hotels closer to the city center either don't have parking or they charge a lot if they do, as do the parking garages. We also wanted a fairly inexpensive no frills place, as we were planning to get up early every morning and ride our bikes into the old town (it was about a 20 minute ride to the Dam) and not return until late at night, so there was no need or desire to pay for anything elaborate. We also wanted in-house breakfast available. We got exactly what was advertised on all of these points, and the breakfast buffet was quite good. There were fairly extensive vending machines available for late night snacks and a bar. While our room and bathroom were sufficiently clean, other parts of the hotel had "issues": one elevator was out of order, the halls were in dire need of painting, and the carpet was stained in many areas. But I think we got what we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “There are so many better options”
Reviews.Author: Dan O
Reviews.Content: I've been to Amsterdam 10 times now and although I've stayed at worse places, this certainly ain't one of the better ones. +: Good and spacious rooms with aircon (in the main complex, not the cheapo building next to it). Breakfasts. Somewhat OK distances to the metro and trams. -: Heavy moisture damage. Dripping from (and inside) the walls. Restorations are ongoing now (sept. 2011). The location (surroundings). It feels like the middle of nowhere. Don't expect a cosy downtown Amsterdam setting with pretty canals and houses. WiFi is E10 extra per day(!).

Reviews.Title: “Hotal from hell!!”
Reviews.Author: james i
Reviews.Content: Well where to start ill start with the location, they claim in the hotel that its a 15 minute tram ride to the centre but they fail to tell you tram that offers this service has now been canceled and you will now have to take 3 seperate trams and travel for 40 minutes, granted this isnt the hotels fault but if you want to stay close to the centre dont stay here! Secondly the pure filth in the hotel, lets start with the bathroom: 1. The shower had toe nail clippings in it when we first entered the room 2. The toilet smelt very strongly of urine even though it had been flushed several times. 3. The airconditoning was stuck and would not blow cold air. 4. The lights in the room kept going out and resulted in myself going to reception to get it sorted on several occasions. 5. The sheets had blood stains on them, we were in a four bed room and they were all stained. 6. There was bed bugs wandering across the sheets (could not miss is as the sheet are white) 7. Despite asking everyday during our 5 days stay our sheets were never changed, the beds were remaid using the same sheets (this was obvious as the blood stains on the sheets were in the exact same spot) the bed wasnt even made well the cover was just straightened, upon lifting the cover the sheet was still folded and creased in the same position i left it. 8. There was four of us staying but we were refused aditional room cards and had to share the one card. Lets go onto the staff: Upon our arrival at 11pm at night we made our way to reception where we stood for 10 minutes while the gentleman on reception finished his private phone call on his mobile phone, once he had finished we were given our room key, i asked if we could have extra keys and was told there was no way we could have another card even after i offered to pay a deposit for card and assured it would be returned safley. The cleaners that turn down the beds and room entered our room without knocking, when we left the room i made a point of asking the cleaner if they could change the sheets (this was the third day) as they werent changed the previous day and after huffing and ignoring me, i asked again and he agreed, this carried on for the full 5 days we were there, reception was informed everyday and failed to take action. Good points: 1. The food was good in the hotal resteraunt, even if the bar man did make us wait for 20 minutes before he served us. 2. The shower always had good water pressure and was alway hot. Thats all the good points i have, all in all i wouldnt stay in this hotel again, its dirty, smelly, the staff are rude and very unhelpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing wrong with the hotel... perhaps poor reviees are for hostel.”
Reviews.Author: lexie_pa
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at HEM Hotel for four days in August. We weren't expecting too much, mostly due to the reviews we'd read, but were pleasantly surprised. The hotel isn't too far from the tram stop (route 2 from Centraal Station) although I would take a printed map with you as we did have to ask in a local take away that obviously has a number of people do the same! The hotel was clean and safe, if not basic. The only comment we had to make was that the water pressure in the shower wasn't great and the door didn't close entirely so there was the occasional leak. All in all, though, it was a perfectly reasonable hotel to stay in, and a lot more reasonably priced than others!

Reviews.Title: “HEM is mostly good”
Reviews.Author: labrujaha
Reviews.Content: I commend the HEM on its' triple which was roomier than expected. Clean linen including duvets, plenty of clean towels, good water pressure & plenty hot. Shallow stairs and a lift make things easy. A small problem at check in was dealt with politely and helpfully. Large landscaped garden for smokers. Small snack/coffee bar very covenient but (of course) expensive (nearby is an AH and a Lidl plus some shops) The drawbacks for the HEM are its location (a bit far out by tram) and the inner room windows don't open so the vibrating air con must be on all night or suffocate (usually I ask for a room with opening window but failed to do so this time, oops). Also, the HEM did not arrange the weather to cooperate!!

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as people think!!!”
Reviews.Author: sweetchuck
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the HEM for a long weekend in August 2011 and bearing in mind this place was given a lot of bad reviews, we were pleasantly surprised. Must say I would not like to be put in the Annex/hostel building because that DOES look really run down and basically needs demolishing but the hotel part is ok, clean and modern and does what it says on the tin. Room was a good size and was one of the better ones I've had, and considering we only paid â‚¬ 59.00 per night it was more than reasonable. Staff were professional and friendly and had no problems during our stay. Food is reasonably priced, we ordered fish and chips and we got a huge plate with 2 fish and a heap of chips and salad all for 11 Euros, bar and lounge areas are bright and clean. Must say there were a few "stoners" lounging around in the garden area but this is Amsterdam after all!!! Hotel is pretty easy to get to from the centre of Amsterdam, we paid â‚¬ 15.50 for a 72 hour tram and metro pass which was excellent value for money, taxi from centre came to approx â‚¬ 15.00 Euros which is a lot less than what we expected. Tram takes approx 15-20 minutes to get to the centre and comes every 10 minutes so you're not standing waiting about for long. The hotel is in a residential part of the city and this area, basically, could do with a good lick of paint and is rather run down, it's not somewhere I would like to be alone on a dark night due to several strange locals I encountered coming to and from the hotel...definitely recommend a taxi for late night trips... but that's the only negative thing I could really say, and considering what we paid, I think this hotel is great value for money and we will be going back there next year!! Give it a chance!!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Bad location, creepy staff, boring”
Reviews.Author: gavindavies1992
Reviews.Content: Very bad location. manager is really sad and has a really long finger nail. we got a completely different room then we expected. it was like a prison. Seaman on bed when we returned from a night out, wasn't us :-( don't go here. staff are like dealers and really unhelpful

Reviews.Title: “Avarage”
Reviews.Author: gironpilar
Reviews.Content: Good place to stay few days in Amsterdam but next time I will try another hotel

Reviews.Title: “does what it says on the tin!”
Reviews.Author: matandclare
Reviews.Content: After reading several recent poor reviews of this hotel before we went out to Amsterdam, we were pleasantly surprised that it wasn't as ghastly as some people made out. Granted that every person has different expectations and opinions, but it was actually okay. The accommodation was a little basic, but clean and modern. Staff seemed friendly. We didn't spend time in the bar area but it looked satisfactory and had a pool table and darts board. We stayed in the adjoining block which did not have air con, so you may wish to check if the room has it or not. There was no tea/coffee making facilities in the room, and breakfast was extra, but that didn't bother us as the hotel room was a base and not somewhere we spent too much time in. Tram ride into the main areas such as Leidseplein and Dam Square etc was about 20 minutes with a 5 minute walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: World_travelgirl8
Reviews.Content: 3 friends and I shared a room, for 4 days. upon arriving we had been given a key to an already occupied room, staff made up for their mistake. the room smelt a bit funny but bearable. My friends and I thought the best part of this hotel was the breakfast that you must pay for, also the ATM and grocery store around the corner, other than that this hotel seams to be unrecognized by any of the locals, it is in a run down neighborhood and I would not have stayed here alone. It is a good hotel for the price for a night or so, but if I didn't have the company of my friends this would not be my choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...value for money.”
Reviews.Author: WoleAwe
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed our stay. Our room 419 had a fairly good view, spacious and clean. We paid for the Internet access though. Save for the old and yet very slow lift we had a good experience. Accessing the city was easy Tramp 2 did the magic. Expect us back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Seriusly - not as bad as it sounds !!!! Have a read.....”
Reviews.Author: Boo101
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™ve just returned from this hotel - 5 night get away with my Girlfriend, we booked it expecting and 'interesting hotel' - 'this sounds like fun!' (It was the only one we could get at short notice!) The hotel staff are really kind, they ARE helpful (they will help with any directions/ bike hire ect...), and the tram (number 2) is only 5 mins walk away.. It takes around 15 - 25 mins to get into town, they are every 15mins and the last one leaves at around 12.15am. so it's not too bad if your happy to take public transport (2.60euros each way). If you want a taxi after a night out - 20Euros back to the hotel ;) not to bad considering you would pay that on a night out anyway (10mins taxi). Around the hotel there are a few â€˜coffee shopsâ€™ and some nice little cafeâ€™s to get food â€“ If youâ€™re not happy paying the hotel prices!! All within a 10min walk. It IS outside the main town, personally we were happy taking the tram everyday â€“ it takes me the same time to get into the city at home anyway.... The Hotel itself looks like a â€˜diveâ€™ on the outside when you turn up, the rooms themselves have everything you need -slightly dated but considering what you pay a night - it's cheaper than a private room in a hostel, the beds are clean (and changed every day â€“ by the most PERSISTANT cleaners! Ha ha) - no Tea/coffee facilities in the room but you can get downstairs (at a price) They have a restaurant and bar also â€“ Good atmosphere at the bar â€“ Chuffin expensive though!! If youâ€™re looking for a top class hotel - donâ€™t go here - it's not, if youâ€™re looking for a place to stay for the night thatâ€™s quiet basic, friendly and, seriously, an all around OK hotel then this is just what youâ€™re looking for. I travel with work a lot â€“ my girlfriend does too, we both agreed, weâ€™ve stayed in a lot worse places. NO RATS IN THIS HOTEL ;) I think the guys who own the hotel have seen all the bad reviews and are trying to change - you can tell it used to be a lot worse!!!!!!!!! Hope this helps Cheers

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel but a bargain”
Reviews.Author: m18mpa
Reviews.Content: As the title says ... very basic hotel but for the price well worth it Stayed here twice and the breakfast is world class!! 10-15minute tram ride into Dam Square!! ENJOY THE COFFEE SHOPS AND BEER!!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and trashy but at least honest about it”
Reviews.Author: defone
Reviews.Content: We had pretty good time in this hotel even though it wasn't anything special. It's far from city center so you should have good reason to be in this location. Internet wasn't free unfortunately but the down stair bar was good, at least they had beer there.

Reviews.Title: “Do not go there, it's terrible”
Reviews.Author: SasvdV
Reviews.Content: The quality of the rooms is terrible. Broken beds, damaged shower and uninterested staff. Even 1 star would be too much for this place.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad for the Price”
Reviews.Author: shay281
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was pretty basic and the building not exactly new, but the hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. It's very close to the tram line so getting to the city centre was a breeze. The neighborhood made me nervous late at nite, but there were usually other hotel guests making their way back from the tram stop at the same time. The only thing that might keep me from going again was that the shower was made of glass bricks and clearly visible from the room itself. That's fine if you are a couple, but since I was with one of my friends it was kind of embarrasing instead. Not far from the airport so the taxi was not expensive, unlike everything else in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Mosquitoes ate us alive in the Hem hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tamlin2011
Reviews.Content: We booked out hotel quite last minute and should have done more research. It is far out of the city center but is close to a tram stop. It is also close to the river and I'm not sure if this was the cause of the mosquito infestation in our room. The neighborhood of the hotel was quiet, but the noise of mosquitoes buzzing in our ears kept my husband and I awake. In the morning we were covered in bites and we did kill some of the insects but it is unpleasant to do when you don't know whose blood they are full of. I would not recommend this hotel as the price was similar to others in the city center, but this hotel was shabby, staff unhelpful and the neighborhood felt unsafe and abandoned. Also, for this price I would have expected an iron in the room, but when I asked for an iron, was told that there used to be one iron per floor but they had all been stolen, so there were no irons available at the hotel. This is the first time I have ever written a hotel review because I thought I should warn other tourists not to stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel ever !!!”
Reviews.Author: Guest1313
Reviews.Content: Dont even think about staying in this hotel!!! It is not hotel. This is stinky barack !!! It is hard to believe such a thing can be found in Europe. Rude staff, incredible smell, motorway behind hotel, dirty carpets, dirty bathroom, no bar (there was sonething like a bar but was closed), location far away from city centre etc. Place of this standard should cost from 5E to max10E per night.

Reviews.Title: “It's like a hotel in the middle of Beirut”
Reviews.Author: Codyboy76
Reviews.Content: I booked a last minute trip and choose this hotel as there wasn't much choice. This hotel is stuck in the middle of what looks like a scene from the Call of Duty game, deserted and tumbleweeds blowing around. We requested a triple room but only got two beds so I had to sleep on the floor. The shower was a dribble and not what we were expecting and we were only given two bath towels! I would say never stay in this hotel, it's not value for money and I would never go back

Reviews.Title: “Like a prison - prisons just have friendlier staff”
Reviews.Author: diederik82
Reviews.Content: Short version: pretty much any hotel in Amsterdam would be a better option. Slightly longer version: We needed a place to crash in Amsterdam with the three of us - so we booked a triple room for the three of us. In the end we ended up getting a double room which an extra bed cramped in with barely any space to move our leave the luggage. The condition of the room was horrible, brown spots on the curtains (which could barely force) - air conditioning devices which looked like they haven't been cleaned since I was born and mold everywhere in the bathroom. The beds seemed clean though. The staff was extremely rude (several people) to guests checking in - to me they were okay, as I spoke Dutch, but to some other people (who were not fluent in English or Dutch) they were plain rude - the front desk staff should just get fired. If you do not have patience or people skills a front desk job is not for you. Maybe try cleaning the rooms instead, it seems that they could quite use that. Location and building are quite horrible, requires a tram or taxi ride into center (approx 10-15minutes). Tram stop is quite close (few minutes walk). If you do like the whole prison experience and like to get shouted at by front desk - I would definitely recommend it. For all other people; avoid - and book any of the 100's of other hotels in Amsterdam. Plenty of choice and no reason to stay here - ever.

Reviews.Title: “1 * Hem Hotel”
Reviews.Author: looky83
Reviews.Content: We stayed there on 30 December 2010, the thing is I was receptionist in a 4* hotel, so I know how should be a 3* one....problem with: shower didn't work, the staff not so friendly(I requested 3 rooms on the same floor, but at the end we had one in a different building, nobody cared about that), old furniture in the rooms, smells like old.....anyway, if you really don't have other option for accommodation in Amsterdam, one night you will not die...if you plan to stay longer: GOOD LUCK!!!!;)

Reviews.Title: “It couldn't be worst”
Reviews.Author: MarinaSouza
Reviews.Content: In the website the pictures were great - including the room's pictures. We knew the hotel was not in the city center but as it was not badly connected with public transportation, we've decided to stay there anyway. We couldn't have had a worst decision! I don't need to say much: the pictures talk for themselves. In the very same moment we've complained they told us they couldn't do anything: the pictures in the website were taken from the rooms in the main building but we were put in the appendix building, which was actually a container in the yard basically. Never ever go there.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to Hell”
Reviews.Author: tgiggs
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was awful, that put us in teh middle of a building site, when one of our party opened their fridge there was a family of flies and insects living in it. As I moved my case a cockroache also liked the look of my room!! When we went to complain they did move us only after quite a long debate. One of my colleagues was told that there where no more rooms, yet the booked two people in who had come in off the street into a room. Another colleague they agreed to move in the morning, which they did, this room had no family of flies or insects but also not a lot of privacy when you needed the bathroom and had some terrible stains, they obviously refeused to take this room, and where not given another room until 7.00pm that evening,( think it may of been the threat of health & safety that prompted the room change), I would not advise any one to stay at this hotel, it was awful.

Reviews.Title: “A truly terrible place to stay in lovely Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Jiminthesuninlux
Reviews.Content: We had left it quite late to find a room in Amsterdam, and the HEM was the only place we could find, but they had massively increased their prices to 160 Euro per room+tax. This hotel is nothing more than a run down youth hostel, a check in system that failed to work, showers with blocked drains, which means the bathroom flooded every time you use them. (There is nobody there to tell that there is a problem). The layout of the hotel is hopeless, with narrow corridors and thin walls which mean you can hear everybody coming and going. I guess since they installed an auto check in / check out desks, they cut back on reception staff. So when it came to check out, the machine told me I had to pay an additional city tax charge on the bill of 7 Euro. OK, but suddenly on the next screen it asked me to pay for the entire room, when I knew that it had already been paid for. Meanwhile there was a queue of 20 people getting irate with th one reception desk employee. So I gave up and left. Only ever stay here if there is nowhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend this hotel ever.”
Reviews.Author: TDas1
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Amsterdam would have been even batter had we selected a better hotel. This was a dirty ...and I mean DIRTY ..hotel. The toilet was stinking...the lift was broken..the reception was also dirty... the hotel was dirty inside and outside....everywhere....The only good part was that it was close to a tram line. That's it. The general location was not that good.. it is way out side the city.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but cheap, and you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: DriftSK
Reviews.Content: I've been at HEM one week on business travel. The hotel is cheap and it shows. Upon my arrival the reception girl redirected me quite rudely to their "self service check-in" desk (pompous name for two PCs with lousy touch screens and crappy software), which repeatedly refused my data - had to try three times - despite having all set before my arrival with a travel agency. Right outside the elevator the way to my room was cluttered with several mattresses, bed bases and a vacuum cleaner, apparently neglected by the staff. While the bedroom was quite big, the bathroom was very small and cramped and lacked any effort to give some comfort feeling (e.g. white plastic board and a cheap mirror, and that was all besides soap and shampoo). The room was also quite cold inside and lacking any serious climate system, with only a tiny (and noisy) wall mounted electric heater to supply a modicum of warmth. Bed linen was always clean at least, and breakfast buffet was just basic. This hotel even managed to rip off money from my credit card, as they charged me at checkout for a prepaid stay: so be very careful if you hand them your card. A very cheap hotel that offers a very cheap experience. It's clean, but nothing more - be warned.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the prce you pay.”
Reviews.Author: ElisavetaNL
