Reviews.Content: It's not the best hotel in the world, but it is okay for the price paid. We paid â‚¬29 for a room for a night, which meant only â‚¬15 per person. That's cheaper than a hostel and you get your own ensuite room! If you need a cheap place to stay, this is a good choice. It was about ten minutes away from the city centre, with a direct tram line to the Leidseplein (Melkweg/Paradiso). Ideal for a night after a concert. However, print a map before you go, because the hotel is tucked away in a not-residential neighbourhood. The size of the room was fine, but there was no phone. When I needed assistance from the reception I had to go downstairs. And I did need the assistance, because the heat in the room wasn't working. However, the service was good, because they provided me with an electric heater so I didn't get cold. I would stay here again if I have no other place to sleep and if I am on a tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: lisarosemarie
Reviews.Content: for a minimum priced hotel and so many bad reviews I was really antisipating the worst!!! but i was pleasantly suprised once we got there, the hotel is a bit out of the way in a back street, but once you had your grounds it was easy to jump on a tram into the city, only 10-15mins away and the trams run ever so frequently and are good prices for tickets. Our room was clean and spacious, it was cold but we stuck the free to use air-con on at 30c and we were nice and toasty. the be linel and towels were changed daily, and the staff were pleasant. for the price i think it really good value. the hotel is a bit dated, but more than adequate for the price you pay. I would happily stay there again, and recomend it on the good value.

Reviews.Title: “REASONABLE VALUE”
Reviews.Author: perthcpl
Reviews.Content: Interesting how opinions vary, We stayed for 3 nights and our room was adequate, we didnt get charged for parking; breakfast and staff werent an issue. Location from centre allowed us to see alot on our way in by public transport. In all; you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected ....”
Reviews.Author: Tati_Luz
Reviews.Content: When I booked this hotel I was really affraid because I've read many bad reviews about it, but fortunatelly I had no problems with it. It was a nice hotel with a friendly staff and nice clean rooms. The room has space enough for me and my friend and our luggage. The bed was really comfortable . The shower was really good. From the hotel to the center of Amsterdam it takes about 15 minutes ... I think it was a really good option for staying at Amsterdam , specially for a weekend stay like mine.

Reviews.Title: “it's not a hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: justmiii
Reviews.Content: i stayed there for one night, it was horrible the lady behind the reception was very rude en not helpfull. the price-kwality ratio is not correct. we paid alsmost 60 euro for one night excl. breakfast. other better hotels in amsterdam (such as new slotania is 10 times better and 10 euro cheaper) the rooms in the hem hotel are dirty, small, smelly, noisy. The bathroom was so dirty and small and everything was wet after taking a shower. Just awfull and waste of money!

Reviews.Title: “Would NOT recommend”
Reviews.Author: shadowwolf1227
Reviews.Content: The staff was really rude. We had MOLD in our room and our friends power went out. There was a weird silver bug in our bathroom. On the website we were on it didnt say anything but when we got there it was 12.50 euro a night for parking. The hallways were really dirty and staind. Even though it says no smoking or drugs the whole place smells like weed. It was just horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Not professional”
Reviews.Author: sadnesss
Reviews.Content: We arrived to the hotel and we entered finding ayoung girl with glasses speaking loudly in her mobile phone in the reception and she dealt with us unfriendly even to the point of ignoring us.Is it our fault that we chosed this hotel?The rest were nice and the hotel was ok

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but Lousy Bed”
Reviews.Author: dhr78
Reviews.Content: This hotel is Good, Location i can't say bad. Easy access to city, as long as you can travel by tram for 20 minutes (for me is not a problem at all), not far from the Schipholl Airport. (30-45 minutes) When we arrive, it's snowing. it's lovely, all white, enter the hotel reception is nice and warm, but the staff (i forget the name, he's quite big) is not so friendly. The other guy after that guy shift is very nice and helpfull. The room is good, clean. But when we lying down on the bed, WOW... so soft, it make our back painfull when we sleep. I hope it's only our room. (Room 243 if im not wrong) Other than that, the restaurant is Awesome, the girl who served us is very funny, me and my wife laughing (in good way) enjoying the way she serve us. Maybe she's new, she forget to give us knife and fork. but the way she appologize, you won't be angry to her =) The Food... is fantastic, we love it. this is the first time we dine in on the hotel restaurant for 2nd in the row. (hope they keep up the good work)

Reviews.Title: “An experience we won't forget”
Reviews.Author: georgio070
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stepped off the tram at Westlandgracht, I thought we'd got off at the wrong stop and we'd come too far as it seemed to take a lifetime to get there. We had to ask someone where the hotel was as it wasn't signposted anywhere. as we rounded the corner near the fire station, we were harrassed by a homeless man who after relieving us of 10 euros kindly showed us where the hotel was, needless to say this wasn't the last time we saw him. The Hem Hotel on approach looked very grand although the surrounding buildings were obviously residential (very strange) and seemed to be located in a less affluent area, nay mind, in we go... So far , so good, checked in and was told to take the stairs as lift wasn't working. Got to the main corridor and Oh My God what have we done!!! It looked like a youth offenders institute with astroturf on th ground floor and we could see into all the rooms. Once we gotin the room it wasn't too bad, very basic but clean and tidy, toilet seat kept sliding off but the shower was quite good. KEEP THE CURTAINS SHUT though as the view isn't exactly a sea one and if you hear an explosion don't worry it's just the firemen practicing in their backyard.... Staff aren't too ready for the laughs but are approachable and more than willing to assist you in your midnight snacks, I'm sure I even saw one of them smile once. Overall a pleasant enough experience and you get what you pay for, don't think we'll go back but I wouldn't put anyone off going, try it, it's an experience you'll look back on and laugh about.

Reviews.Title: “Soooo worth it for the money!”
Reviews.Author: bamy1781
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam is amazing but stupidly expensive! That's why the HEM hotel was so good. we only paid Â£95 for 3 nights and even our taxi driver couldn't believe how cheap it was! Staff were all lovely and the room was really nicely decorated with loads of info on what to do in the city. One morning (we were slightly hungover) and when the maids came we sent them away , they came back an hour later and we said no thanks again. We went out at 12.30 and when we got back in the evening the maids had been and left us new towels etc. - I've never stayed anywhere that has given such good service. Only downside was it was freezing, but there was a cold snap and it snowed while we were there so it wasn't the hotels fault. when we spoke to reception they gave us an extra duvet each. A little bit out of the way in a slightly common residential area but the tram stop was round the corner and half the fun of staying in Amsterdam is jumping on and off the trams! would 100% recommend this hotel if you're looking for affordable accommodation and great service!

Reviews.Title: “HORROR HORROR HORROR PLEASE DONT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: MaximillianAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: HellHouse, this shelter was booked for me by a company that invited me, to be honoust I wouldn't offer this accomodation the Satan. It'so so dirty, stains, pubichair and molt all over the place. Normally I take a shower twice a day, this time I didn't even used the bathroom!!!!! I went to the toilet @ work, it's so dirty!! I would like to have a tete a tete with the manager!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay, but at least very cheap”
Reviews.Author: NNandCK
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in a triple room. As soon as we stepped in the room after check-in we had to call the Reception because the room was stinking of cigarette very very badly (I am a non-smoker, but my boyfriend and his brother are smokers and even they couldn't bear the smell), as if someone was smoking there day and night! We were told that the hotel is not fully but overbooked so there is no chance to get another room (perhaps maybe the next day) and that it's impossible that someone was smoking inside since it's a fully non-smoking hotel (which is theoretically true, it is written on the door within the house rules, that smoking inside will result a 150 euro fee added to the bill). I told the Receptionist that the smoke detector is tightly covered with a plastic bag (I guess by a previous guest) that Housekeeping should have noticed! They sent a houseman after 40 minutes because they were very busy, who kindly sprayed something all over the room, checked if the a/c was working properly (but left the smoke detector covered). We left for a few hours and when we returned the odor was just slightly better. We opened the a/c and took out the filter (thinking that if we clean it, it might make a difference), the sink where we rinsed it became so filthy that the dirt wouldn't come off it, not even with rubbing... We were not contacted by anyone the next day regarding change of room, nor have they apologised for the inconvenience... The hotel otherwise is not bad for the amount of money we paid and eventough it's not located in the centre, it's close to a tram station and only 10 mins ride to the centre. Overall, regardless that it was very cheap, it was a disappointing experience, the only reason we stayed there is because we already paid the full amount upon arrival (because we had to) but we would/will never go back!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “perfect for budget travelling”
Reviews.Author: DanielTudor
Reviews.Content: great access to city center by bus, tram or bike. i had a great "smokie" time there :)

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, but there's a reason for that...”
Reviews.Author: the-trojan-traveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my girlfriend and I wouldn't really recommend it. The rooms were incredibly hot during the summer, add to that the noise (despite it not being in the centre of Amsterdam) and sleep was often difficult to come by. Our room was also a bit dirty and pretty smelly. The obvious plus to this place is it's very cheap. I would say if you're a solo traveller, a hostel is better (and cheaper still) but for couples if you don't plan on spending much time in the room it may be bearable. I can't honestly advise you to go to this hotel though as I had an uncomfortable experience there.

Reviews.Title: “I got what I paid for - basic accommodation at low prices”
Reviews.Author: SoaPM
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel BEFORE reading some of the reviews here - after I read them I was worried that I had made a big mistake. I hadn't. I booked for a party of 11 going to run the Amsterdam Marathon. I booked in February for a stay in October. It worked out at the equivalent of â‚¬20 per person per night. You can't expect much for that, but the hotel was good value for money and everyone in my party - all experienced travellers - would be happy to stay there again. It is a fair distance out of the city centre - but it is close to tram and metro services The locaiity has no services and some of the nearby flats were being demolished so that is not ideal. It is withn walking distance of the Olympic stadium where the race started and finished - ideal considering the purpose of the trip The carpets in the public areas are worn/shabby but the rooms were clean, basic and comfortable The breakfast service was good and a wide range of food options available. The bathroom lacked comforts but it was clean and the shower was hot and powerful - ideal after 26 miles running When we stayed there were a lot of other runners there so maybe the clientele was a bit more respectable than usual ? I just think that a low priced hotel in any big city will have a contingent of shady charachters The staff were helpful and friendly

Reviews.Title: “Nowhere near as bad as reviews suggest - but were we just lucky?”
Reviews.Author: LukewarmCatastrophe
Reviews.Content: I always check Tripadvisor religiously before booking a hotel, and even though I'm open-minded enough to understand the phrase "one mans trash is another mans treasure", I still feel only a fool would ignore reviews which consistently refer to a hotel as "smelling of mildew" or "having rude staff" or being poorly located. In this instance, we were happy to run the risk of being fools, as we only paid Â£24.01 for our room for the night through the excellent eBookers website (first time I've used it!) and as we were only staying in Amsterdam for one night and had no time to explore the city centre and thus, didn't care about the location for sightseeing/drinking/eating etc, we felt it was a risk worth taking. Location: It is not in the city centre. This is made perfectly clear on the hotel's official website (where they also give excellent public transport information to assist you). Besides, most people in this day and age are perfectly capable of using Google maps, so anyone who complains about the location needs to research more. Service: We checked in at about 23.40 after a concert. We'd already called the hotel to discover what the latest possible time to check in was. It was midnight, so be careful if you have late flights or aren't able to get to the hotel during the day. Reception wasn't anything to write home about in terms of friendliness, it's true, but the guy certainly wasn't rude, just efficient and "no-frills". Fine by me, I didn't want a fireside chat with him! I did see a different receptionist be slightly condescending to some American arrivals shortly after we arrived but to be fair, they were being obnoxious and deserved it - I found it greatly entertaining ;) Food: Upon arriving to check in so close to midnight, we were worried there'd be no food available (and the area around the HEM has nothing in terms of nightlife/restaurants hell, there's barely a streetlight switched on!). I have to praise the EXCELLENT pizza we got from the food bar. It was really decent quality (looked hand-made with artichokes, sundried tomatoes, mushrooms etc) and very tasty. Just what we needed, and the guy that served it to us was really friendly and cheerful. There's also paninis and a fridge full of Ben and Jerry's, as well as a fully stocked bar for people who prefer a liquid supper! Rooms: There is apparently a "hostel" side to this establishment, and a "hotel" side. We were definitely in the hotel side. The two single beds, pushed together, were perfectly comfortable, the sheets were clean, the room was relatively spacious. We noticed a few odd things - like when we opened the curtains in the room, we were looking out into an internal part of the hotel, which can only be described as looking like a prison! Essentially, you had to keep your curtains closed to maintain your privacy in case anybody coming out of their "prison doors" happened to look up and see us in our room! This wasn't an issue, but it might have been if we'd planned on spending any length of time in the hotel and wanted to open the curtains to let in some light. I'll mention at this point that our bathroom did smell a little "funny" when we first arrived but really, this was nothing that a little bleach/toilet freshner wouldn't have fixed and it is a shame the hotel let itself down on this front. Everything else in the bathroom was fine. Clearly dated, but generally clean, with a properly flushing toilet, plenty of toilet paper, a powerful hot shower, etc To summarise - this hotel served our purposes perfectly fine. Bearing in mind the horror story reviews we had read, we were actually left feeling pleasantly surprised. I wouldn't stay here again if my stay in Amsterdam was for more than one night as it is too far out in the middle of nowhere to really enjoy and soak up the atmosphere of the city (and sadly, public transport after midnight is not good enough to take a risk on). However, if I was here for one night and found an excellent room rate like the one I took advantage of, I would strongly consider staying here again seeing as the rest of the hotels in Amsterdam were charging literally 3 times the price for something similar. A good budget option if you can use a map and are clever enough to visit the Tourist Information Office at Schiphol upon arrival and purchase one of the cheap, disposable public transport multi-use cards (Amsterdam's equivalent of London's "Oyster card" to make the metro/tram journeys which you'll need to make to get to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “And a good time was had by all”
Reviews.Author: welshlewis
Reviews.Content: Hem Hotel has basic amenities and is situated on the outskirts of the city but it has clean, warm rooms with comfortable beds and an excellent breakfast. The evening food service supplied decent enough pizza and chips as well as yummy apple cake for those of you with the munchies. The tram stop not too far, two minutes walk and 15 minute journey got you into the centre of Amsterdam. There was a Lidl local to the hotel to buy affordable supplies. We would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: catherineX7
Reviews.Content: It is a bit far from the centre but if using the trams you wont see the distance.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience - never going back”
Reviews.Author: BonyIsMe
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were looking at cheap hotel options as we had to spend from midnight till 9am only. I had stayed there for one night in Sep 2008 with wife, and found that the room was barely tolerable. But this time round, the experience was terrible. 1. we got a ground floor room, and on opening the window for some fresh air, we found white maggots/worms on the window sill. Some of them stuck to the curtain and fell inside. We had to scout around and get them removed from the room. On reporting this to the front desk, they were not too concerned - they just mentioned that they would make a note of it, and inform the maintenance staff sometime!! 2. The staff during checkin mentioned that it parking charges would not be necessary as we are coming in so late, and leaving early. But on checkout, the person in the morning shift insisted that we had to pay. On being told that communication was different by his colleague on night shift, he did not budge. 3. The room is VERY basic. The carpets feel like they haven't been cleaned. 4. The bathroom floor does not have any bath-mats, and the flooring is VERY cold tiles - sends a shock through the feet whenever using the bathroom 5. The location is very shady - a walk to the nearest tram/station after sundown does not feel safe. And it is a bit of a walk. 6. There's always shady people hanging around the hotel. While I don't blame the hotel directly, it is probably of a profile which attracts such people. 7. Getting cuising taxis from this location is impossible. 8. Using the Internet at the hotel is expensive - Eur 10 for a day. I do not know how this hotel gets a 3-star rating. It shouldn't be a single star. I would recommend avoiding it - especially if travelling with family.

Reviews.Title: “Motel not Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Euro_traveller_easy
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip to Amsterdam by are local travel agents. We decided to book the hotel as the picture of the rooms looked good. We have done this before when we went to Prague for a holiday and were very impressed with the hotel. I decided to look at some reviews on the internet about the hotel, to see some comments, bareing in mind that everyone is different. Comments regarding the bathroom was one of the things that popped up alot. On arrival, I found the reception staff not very help as they decided to book in a german couple while booking us in. Nothing was mentioned about the runnings of the hotel i.e breakfast hours, were the breakfast room was locationed or about housekeeping, we were given our room card (of the 4th floor) and there was a old lift which only went to the 4th floor. Our room was facing the main busy road and was very noisey with all the traffic. This might bother some people but we could sleep through anything due to all the walking about we did. The room was poorly lit, so we had to put on all the lights on including the bathroom light, and the it smelt of smoke, when it was banned. Reading the information booklet in the room, it did mention about the stuff the hotel offered including breakfast hours, checking in/out times etc. There is no tea or coffee making facilities in the room, which I knew about from the internet reviews, which was a negetive. The breakfast was good, it offered a choice of breakfast items. A place to sit and relax would it a nice idea as in the reception area and bar ,you did not feel able to sit there. This hotel was ok, having been to a smaller one in Paris and bigger one in Prague. It served it's purpose, it was a place to sleep and have breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel too far from centre expensive extras.”
Reviews.Author: Poorlywornboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for two nights in September 2010.They put us in an annexe room,my partner had a shower which flooded the bathroom because the shower tray was blocked so we asked for assistance to mop up and a new towel because we used one to soak up the water .Some one came came and put bleachdown thedrain and said he would be back to mop up ,but he did not.So we complained and fair enough ,they moved us to a nicer room in the main block. The breakfast is 14euros each per day ,parking is 12.50euros a day(we drove) and the tram fare is 5.20 for two each way,and its 20 minutes from the centre. I think with hind sight it would be better to pay a bit more and be more central. Desk staff were friendly enough, though, but overall I dont think I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Hem Hotel AKA Horror Hotel”
Reviews.Author: streetka
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as hotels were hard to come by during my dates as the big broadcast conference was in town at the RAI centre. It was a last minute booking and i was stung accordingly on the price, one night on my bill was charged at the incredibly unreasonable rate of 500 euros! So, the hotel. The HEM Hotel can only be best described as rundown and cheap. The room I was in was a triple and was very poorly maintained with a bathroom in need of not just TLC but ripping out. This brings me to the only good thing about the room, as opposed to other reviews, the shower was powerful and always hot, which after a long day was a blessing. However, once out of the shower you had to content with crap beds, not enough hangers, carpet that had a multitude of unmentionable stains, the symphony of door banging all through the night, and I mean all night, questionable characters hanging around in the hotel and the obvious drug deliveries and prostitutes turning up at all hours, day and night. The staff were colourful, some helpful and others with the attitude that would make the devil seem like a good chap. Getting a taxi was a battle every evening, partly due to the the conference in town but mostly due to the poor organisation from the hotel and the obvious taxi cartel that exists there. As mentioned in other reviews and also said by one of the taxi drivers I managed to get, after nearly getting beaten up by fellow guests attempting to steal it from me, was that the area was called the Bronx and was low class. Just walking around was enough to confirm this and the hookers, pimps and dealers at the local shopping centre would confirm this if you asked them. Cross over the canal and things improve very quickly fortunately. Would I return? In a word NO WAY. This hotel is somewhere you'd stay if desperate or mental.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel on the suburbs of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: PanZafir
Reviews.Content: Located on the outskirts of the city of Amsterdam within about 15 minutes by tram. The tram stop is about 500 meters from the hotel so it is good to have luggage with wheels. Generally, the distance is not a concern and walking is definitely pleasant. The hotel had a nice garden but had been quite the smoking room (marihouana. ..). The room was comfortable and the bathroom too. It was quiet and clean. The staff was helpful and smiling. The breakfast room and breakfast was excellent! Spacious with garden and nice furniture and decor. The breakfast was very rich and very diverse. If I was to go to Amsterdam another time I would prefer it again.

Reviews.Title: “girls travelling”
Reviews.Author: supergran0606
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my 18th year old grandaughter recently - hotel is located in a really bad area and we didnt feel safe walking about even during the day, we did ask directions from a local young lady who advised not to walk around at night and my grandaughter agreed that she wouldnt feel comfortable even with a group of her friends - hotel itself is about 20 minutes on the tram - a bit too far out of the city centre, shower was a trickle and staff were slightly abrupt except for one receptionist - she was extremely helpful

Reviews.Title: “A little out of the way, but a cheap place to stay”
Reviews.Author: nbansal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on two different occasions on the same trip. (July 14-16, July 29-30) The first time, our flight landed early and we arrived about 4 hours before we were allowed to check in. (took us about an hour to get to the hotel from the airport) They let us drop off our luggage in the luggage storage room. You needed a code to get in, and the same code to lock it, but often people forgot so the door was unlocked when we got there. We left our bags and took the more valuable stuff with us to explore the city. Front desk was helpful and told us how to get into the heart of the city. You can take the #2 tram (5 minute walk from the hotel), it takes about 20 minutes to reach Dam square where a lot of stuff goes on. The trams stop running around 1230am before the night buses start running (which we didn't quite figure out) If you miss the last tram, it will cost about 35 euros to get back to the hotel from Dam. (too far to walk) Kind of sucked that we couldn't stay out too late. There is nothing around the hotel, so when you go back, you will just stay at the hotel. We were three guys so got a triple room. In Europe, this means a normal double room with an added bed, so there was not much space to move around or for our luggge. It was not a big deal since we were really in the room at night and went straight to sleep. The room was air conditioned which was a plus...took a while for the room to cool down. The second time we stayed there, we were placed in a quadruple room (we paid the same price). This room actually had 4 beds and a lot of room to walk around, but we didn't see air conditiong in this room. The bathrooms were fairly clean, but we weren't given soap or anything until we asked. Towels were given to us, and they had a closet full just down the hall and were able to grab a couple more if needed. The hotel has a restaurant on the main floor but you will be looking to spend almost 10 euros for a coffee and a croissant. This room also has a pinball machine and a pool table. They have a computer on the main level as well. You can purchase an internet access code at the front desk. Cost was 2.5 euros for 15 minutes....5 euros for 45 minutes. Usually it allowed you to stay on for an extra couple of minutes. Overall, not a bad hotel for the price we paid. It was very easy to get to and from the heart of the city, and offered everything we needed for our stay. If you aren't looking to spend a night in Amsterdam in luxury, but want more security than a hostel, then this hotel should be an option for you.

Reviews.Title: “Really liked HEM hotel”
Reviews.Author: baotian
Reviews.Content: Me and my son stayed for one week in Hem hotel. It was a very pleseant visit. Just a five-minute walk to the tramstation, that takes you directly to the museum area, or the cityarea (about 15 min ride) The staff was very nice and serviceminded. Very comfortable beds, and sheets and towels changed every day. The brekfastbuffÃ© was very good. Maybe a little expensive (15 euro).... Thank you! See you next time!

Reviews.Title: “Hem Hotel almost a disaster!”
Reviews.Author: QuiggersClan
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Hotelclub.com and I have been stung by them before! The hotel is situated far away from the centre of Amsterdam but luckily 15 minutes journey on a tram. The hotel is scruffy and the service from the staff is poor. We had a triple room as I was travelling with my wife and 14 year old daughter. The room itself was of a reasonable standard but totally innappropriate as you could see people in the shower as the wall between the shower and the room was glass? The room was tidy and the bedding and sleeping arrangements were good. Breakfast was acceptable. The whole experience was ruined by poor customer service and very tired shabby looking interior to the hotel. We also got stung for a Â£35 car park charge on checking out which they did not tell us about on check-in.

Reviews.Title: “S'ALRIGHT..”
Reviews.Author: jaszep-ocelot
Reviews.Content: I read alot of reviews on here after booking this hotel over Christmas, and I must say this website must be full of people with pretty high standards, because for the price the HEM was perfect. We stayed in the annexe, unfortunately in a non-smoking room. It was a twin room which was clean and tidy. The bathroom had a habit of flooding though. Very good location in comparison to the tram stop, and it's only 5 minutes from a little greengrocers. The staff by and large were friendly, with the exception of the barwoman who answered my question about the location of the local supermarket with "it's closed.".. Overall, a very good budget option, and I shall probably be returning there in September.

Reviews.Title: “I would not recommend this so called hotel to my enemies!”
Reviews.Author: Cecilia_Alex
Reviews.Content: To be fair there are two good things about this hotel; they serve good breakfasts and the trams are within easy access, but that is pretty much it. We were a party of five people travelling together and had booked three rooms for a weekend. They were all quite shabby, with mouldy patches on the walls/ceiling and with showers that flooded the bathroom floor, when used. The sleep quality was poor as people were running and talking loudly in the corridor during the night, using the fire escape to go out and smoke and slamming the door shut behind them. The staff in the reception was extremely unprofessional and rude. The overall impression is that of a poor youth hostel rather than a hotel and therefor extremely overpriced! I am an experienced traveller and have stayed in hotels and hostels all over the world and rarely have I come across a place of a poorer standard. I would never go back to this place or recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced Motel 6”
Reviews.Author: ctjbush
Reviews.Content: It is amazing that Americans like myself are willing to travel 1000's of miles to spend our hard-earned dollars on average motel rooms. It was clean, but there was no breakfast included and the hotel itself is hard to find and out of the way. The price was too much.

Reviews.Title: “It's all right”
Reviews.Author: Ruby_Dooby53
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend in March and had a really good time. Upon arrival we were greeted by a very helpful Dutch lady. When checking in we paid for parking which was quite expensive. We were also given our room number and details which we said were wrong. The lady tried her best to get us into the room we wanted but couldn't so we were happy with the room we had. When getting to the room I wasn't sure what to think. I looked all right but it was rather shabby. I thought there is room for improvement. I though the bathroom could do with some doing up. the shower wasn't very good went from cold to hot, the floor needed something as the water came through the shower door and I slipped not expecting it to be wet before I put the towel down. I thought the hotel was very far out from the city centre but the tram was only a few mins walk from the hotel. The nights sleep was disturbed as I have no idea what was going on and I don't want to know what was going on but nothing was done by staff even with complaints. In the morning we went down for breakfast and it was the nicest hotel breakfast ever. No complaints about that at all. I do think something needs to be done with the lobby as it looks crowded and not welcoming. I'd say if anyone wanted a cheap hotel away from all the hustle and bustle of the city. This would be perfect for them.

Reviews.Title: “too far from centre of the town, even tram and underground aren't in the neighbourhood.”
Reviews.Author: VedranaiBoris
Reviews.Content: Considering the price of 250 euros for 5 x B&B for two people, you can't ask for more. But accomodation is a bit below average, and too far from everything.

Reviews.Title: “Attention to detail needed, but overall not too bad”
Reviews.Author: Tulippen
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the unfavourable reviews on various sites about this hotel, we were slightly anxious about our stay. The hotel in general could do with a little spruce-up and some attention to detail, but overall it's not too bad and the staff we came across were friendly. The buffet breakfast was particularly good with a variety of hot food, cereal, bread and fruit. We stayed in the main hotel building, and the room was clean and adequate. A few gripes though: apart from the dull main light, our room only had one bedside lamp, which made the room quite dark and difficult to read in. In spite of reporting this several times, the problem was not rectified during our stay; not enough towels were replaced each day, we had to keep requesting more; there was no bath-mat so the bathroom floor got soaked after a shower. There is a Lidl and Albert Heijn supermarket just up the road from the hotel which is very useful for buying water/snacks, especially when the hotel charges â‚¬3 for a small bottle!

Reviews.Title: “Quick way to get from Schipol airport”
Reviews.Author: surreyLoneranger
Reviews.Content: Hotel fair way out but can walk through Vondelpark - allow 45 minutes-1 hour To reach the hotel from the airport you can take the number 2 tram from Central Station but the queue for 48 hour ticket on a Friday night is very long. You can buy single ticket on tram. Get off at Westlandstraacht, then walk through to hotel. Quickest way from airport is to get train to Leylaan Station. Take bus number 62 outside and then get off at bottom of road by hotel. 2 minute walk to hotel. [avoids city centre when very busy] Trams run till midnight then the 358 night bus from city centre. Good venue - VERY quiet - hotel providesd food till 4am - useful!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Have your own experience”
Reviews.Author: IsleofManJooles
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews we were quite worried. But we couldn't have had a better stay. I must admit finding the hotel proved a nightmere, but once we did the tram is only 5 mins walk and are so often there is no need to use any other transport. We found all the staff to be polite and helpful. The rooms were clean apart from the shower turned into a bath when used so had to be careful that both me and my partner had showers at different times of the day. We had the bed & breakfast package and the food was lovely with lots to choose from, but the prices at the bar was expensive. However there is a newsagents by the tram stop which sold everything and was quite cheap, so we used that for our little bits we kept in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Hem Hotel, The Good, the Bad and the Ugly.”
Reviews.Author: damsqu
Reviews.Content: I reviewed this hotel once before back in 2007, after a 5 night Christmas stay. I was impressed then so when the HEM came up on bookings.com as the cheapest option for my latest 2 night stay I was happy to book once again. The Good! For 49 euros a night you are going to find it hard to beat the Hem hotel on price. The room was huge, with large fully opening windows. I requested a room with a window when I booked as this hotel does have some internal rooms. TV, comfy twin beds, large shower room, saw me perfectly catered for. Check in was fast and efficient. The Bad... I returned to the hotel on my second day (Wednesday) late afternoon and was parched. I headed straight for the bar for a long cold beer. I waited. After about 5 mins a gentlemen arrived, and acknowledged me. He looked around and told me someone would be with me shortly. 10 mins later and after lots of member's of staff had passed the door behind the bar and no-one entered to serve me, I decided to get a cold beer from the snack bar. Again no-one to serve me. I waited patiently for at least 5 mins, looking at two members of staff, intently in conversation, just a few feet away. Again I gave up, walked back to the tram stop (spitting feathers by now!) and made my way back into town for a drink. Great opportunity for Hem to make some extra money from me, wasted. And the Ugly... The area. This is a safe area but there is a particular building around the corner from the hotel (on route to the tram line) that does have groups of scary looking characters outside. In the two days I visited there was a group gathered most of the time. This does not seem to bother the locals (a local primary school had their children playing on a small open park, a few feet from this group, who were openly guzzling strong larger) so I tried to not let it bother me. I did however feel intimidated by one of them that took to following me back to the hotel, asking me for some money. He was clearly a junkie in the troughs of cold turkey, and became more desperate as he realised I was not interested. I was glad to be so close to the hotel entrance, but not a pleasant experience. Just for context, I grew up in Manchester city and I am not easily intimidated. Conclusion. The HEM hotel is a great value hotel, if you get if for the right price and follow the advice on Trip advisor. 1. Make sure when you book, you are booking the 3* Hem hotel and NOT its 2* Annex. 2. Ask for a room with a window (unless you don't mind an internal room) 3. If visiting for the first time, get on Google maps and check out the route from the tram to the hotel. Saves you wondering around looking lost.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest of hotel staff and no complaints at all”
Reviews.Author: polkadot-frills88
Reviews.Content: Before leaving to go to Amsterdam, I read the reviews that others had posted on here about the hotel. Both my partner and I were a bit worried until we got to the hotel. The hotel was immaculate and the staff were genuinely kind and friendly. The food in the hotel restaurant for lunch and evening meals is not only great value for money, but is also lovely and did not have one complaint whatsoever. The lady behind the bar-who was also the waitress was extremely helpful. We had a bed and breakfast package and the breakfast was to die for!! There was so much selection that I didn't know where to begin. The food was all fresh and there was plenty of choices for those who may not fancy a cooked breakfast. The rooms were immaculate and exactly what was needed for a 3 day break to Amsterdam, although the hotel is situated 20 minutes out of Amsterdam city, we have never found it easier to get around than on the trams which is a 5 minute walk away from the hotel. As for the comments about the traffic noise I can't disagree more, we were situated on the 4th floor and could see the roads from our window, but there was no traffic noise to be heard at all!!. The rooms were cleaned every day and to a high standard. A brilliant hotel for short breaks to this lovely city!! Thank You very much to the staff at the HEM hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Take the Tram not the bikes!”
Reviews.Author: rushmandives
Reviews.Content: This is a budget hotel don't buy the extra budget rooms unless you want to sit sideways on the toiletbowl...For the regular rooms no problem comparable let's say to a French F1 hotel or to an american Motel fitted with a restaurant! Take the tram ... bike are both expesive and riding in Amsterdam requires skills that us foreigners sometimes lack! And finally this is a message to all the foreigners in visit in the magnificent city of Amsterdam please be respectfull of the locals smoke and drink responsibly and read the user manual before using legal hard drugs idiots it's full of stuff you should know... Dial the 9 for an external line don't do the same mistake and try calling call girls fron reception... ;)

Reviews.Title: “Bureaucratic arrogance and mediocre accomodation”
Reviews.Author: whybother034
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the HEM hotel to spend the weekend in Amsterdam. First of all they bungled our reservation, booking one room for 175 euro instead of two rooms for 198 euro (there was a 99 a piece promo). The error was probably due to problem between their system and the booking engine on the official tourism site of the city, but how is that my problem? After some back-and-forth discussions with hotel staff - they supposedly didn't have any rooms available, but fortunately I had a e-mail copy of the reservation confirmation - they managed to produce a key for the second room. At this point I reminded them that not only the number of rooms was wrong but also the price. The next day however they still decided to charge us 175 euro per room, pointing out that we didn't have any written proof that we were entitled to the promo. But the price was simply not mentioned on the reservation confirmation I received by mail, so how could I prove anything? After another annoying discussion hotel staff agreed to call management and ask permission to not charge us for the second room until they had the chance to contact the booking agency on Monday. This bureaucratic attitude where the customer is guilty until he can prove himself innocent - despite clear proof that there were problems with their booking engine/partners - caused a big waste of time in a short weekend trip. On top of that, the rooms are mediocre (the bathrooms just smelled) and it's not exactly conveniently located. So my advice, if you want to save some money and there's another promotion, you can take the risk. But there is NO WAY that this hotel is worth the 175 euro they claim for a standard room. For that price you can find a lot better in a much better location!

Reviews.Title: “Twenty minutes from the central amsterdam by tram”
Reviews.Author: gsandeepdas271187
Reviews.Content: Visited amsterdam during 7th April. It was a great experience. We stayed in a four bed room. Compared to paris pratic hotel this was expensive for four nights. Better to get a hotel somewhere near the center.

Reviews.Title: “How not to enjoy Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: markkibble
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam is a great city to be in offering a multitude of activities and culture. The same cannot be said for this hotel. I was on business and as most of the mainstream hotel were fully booked the travel agent booked me into this one. The Hem Hotel is situated in a run down suburb several miles from the centre - certainly not within walking distance. It has a very unimposing aspect as you enter, being slap bang next door to the elevated expressway which is noisy. The hotel itself appears to be prefabricated - like a row of portacabins stuck together. The lobby is crowded and centred around the main lift, which was out of order when I stayed. The rooms are cheaply constructed and fitted out. I would expect more than a bar of soap in the bathroom! The TV is old and most stations not available. No mini-bar or tea/coffee making facilities. The mattresses were foam and the pillows unforgiving. Although mine was a 'non-smoking' room, smoke pervades the place. Luckily I did not experience a view of the expressway -m just an internal area comprising old air-conditioning units. The cheapness of the construction means you can hear everything going on in the adjoining rooms and the hallway. So you get woken by revelers returning late into the night. For drinks and snacks there is a guy with what looks like a market stall in the lobby selling bottles of beer and crisps. At 3 Euro for a small bottle of water they are exploiting the fact that there are no shops in the vicinity. Not even sure if my rate included breakfast but I did not even try to go into what looked like a cafeteria. I just paid and left. 136 Euro a night (142 with tax) is a far too high a price to pay for this very basic hotel. Other guests shuffled about â€“ Iâ€™m sure equally embarrassed that they were staying there too. Suggest you avoid!

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful”
Reviews.Author: seanppk
Reviews.Content: For some reason reasonably priced hotels seem to be few and far between at this time of year in Amsterdam, which drove us to the Hem Hotel instead of the comparatively heavenly Blue Tower at Bos En Lommerplein. Next time I think I'll take a sleeping bag and sleep rough - at least I wouldn't have to fork out 300EURO for three nights in a hole like this. Let's not beat about the bush and list the qualities of this place: 1. Had no record of a pre-paid booking with bookings.nl and were trying to get us to pay again. Nice. 2. Rooms were extremely badly kitted out, no hot drink making facilities, not even towel rails - nothing that could be removed from the room. Tatty interior made the health hazard of my student digs seem like the Barcelona Pavilion. Classy. 3. Housekeeping involved pulling duvet over the bed - sheet beneath remains untouched and untucked revealing bare matress. Mmmm. 4. Gave up queueing to check out after 20 mins - threw key on reception desk and left. How difficult can it be... 5. Quite quiet. Thankfully. 6. There's more but I'm getting depressed writing this - you get the picture. To be avoided at all cost - even if you're desperate.

Reviews.Title: “Priceless!”
Reviews.Author: jo-mandy
Reviews.Content: I had been a bit concerned because this was listed as a budget hotel and I was travelling with my parents and didn't want to end up somewhere too seedy. Actually, I was very pleasantly surprised; the location was quiet and attractive and although the hotel wasn't much to look at it had its own well-kept garden and terrace. The rooms were clean and cosy, and were very quiet, which meant a great night's sleep. The breakfast was exceptional and with the tram stop only 5 minutes away with a direct route into the city centre, transport was not an issue - it was really convenient. (I suggest buying a travel card at the airport purely for convenience and as a means of avoiding hop on hop off bus trips which are expensive). On the second night things took a turn for the worse. We decided to eat in the restaurant (it had been great the night previously). The chef was completely stoned and as a result the whole experience was very Fawlty Towers. My sister had a tuna salad, which was tinned tuna which had not only not been drained- it could've been still swimming - but came additionally with the lid of the anchovy can - was this for decorative purposes or an aditional mineral supplement? My sandwich was dropped mid-delivery; the chef didn't notice and he proceded to man-handle the piece still on the plate, questioning whether I would like this exchanged! It was just so funny I thought we might die laughing. There is no kettle in the room and prices for a drink including tea and coffee start at 3 Euros, which is rather expensive if you are a huge coffee drinker like myself. However, I would definitely recommend this hotel - just check who's doing the cooking if you eat in the restaurant or stock up at breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “no happy”
Reviews.Author: emmajade7
Reviews.Content: not a great location...in amsterdam only book the best. this place was full of tour group young people. smoking everywhere. smelt in room couldnt have window open. asked for extra pillow told "you've got one havent you?". really bad reception service. Breakfast fantastic. not ideal for middle age travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: faiweelolli
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked as a cheap 2 night trip with my partner for my birthday. This was my first time in Amsterdam. The hotel location was fine - a 5 minute walk to the tram stop and then the trams drop you off in the centre of Amsterdam and the same back. However I did forget that the cars drive on a different side and was nearly killed so be safe! Also keep an eye out for cyclists, they're everywhere! Our stay included breakfast - total holiday cost was Â£105 (not including transfers) which isn't bad at all for flights, hotel and breakfast. The breakfast included scrambled egg, bacon, cold meats such as ham, salami etc, and cheeses, rolls, croissants, fruit salad and cereal. Also included was tea, coffee and juice. Always seemed to be a decent amount out and didn't run out. The hotel rooms were adequate, nothing special, bathroom wasn't as nice as I'd hoped - toilet handle broken but they were suitable enough. The part of the hotel we were in was quite cold, however there was heating in the room which could be controlled by us so that was fine. The rooms were clean and tidy and had a television. The staff were quite helpful and friendly. The reception area was attractive and the hotel has a little garden. The hotel has a snack bar which is pretty pricey as you'd expect from a hotel - I'd suggest taking your own snacks and bringing drinks back as the snack bar is a bit of a rip off. Overall I wasn't disappointed for what I paid and would recommend for a budget holiday. A fabulous hotel I would recommend, for around the same cost, is called Museum Square Hotel. Staff could not do more to help, rooms were absolutely lovely, location was good and I would love to return. Look for my review.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brova
Reviews.Content: I was at Hem hotel from 30th of March till 1st of April. We were accomodated in the hotel (Ham has also a hostel in the yard). We've had a quad room. It was spaceous, also very clean. The breakfast was excellent!!! The best I've ever been. And the price was great. The Hotel is near the tram station. Just take tram no.2 and you can be in the center for 20 min. I really reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “not as bad as thought”
Reviews.Author: Charlie201036
Reviews.Content: We stay in a quad room, myself and my two young children (3 and 5) there were literally 4 single beds but we were happy with that. It was nothing special but clean and otherwise fine. TV little english but we didnt have much time to watch it anyway. Prehaps the most dissapointing was that the hotel is a long journey from the centre of amsterdam, meaning alot of tram rides (because of the kids) which at first was expensive until we found out about the strip tickets (22.50 for about 40 strips for an adult (uses about three per ride depending on zone) and 5 euro for childs one. We got charged for the youngest child on the first 2 trams rides when he should have been free. Otherwise had a very enjoyable stay. Plenty to do with the children but if we had stayed any longer than the 5 days we would have had trouble finding things to do. Madam Tussaudes is a waste of money by the way, NEMO brilliant for kids (and adults) we spent a full day in it and well worth the money. Henikian brewery good also and the zoo, spend hours in that too. If you go to the lovers boats, they will take you by canal boat to the zoo, you go around the zoo, then the boat will pick you up after at a suited time and show you around the canals for only an extra 10euro more than the zoo ticket, so much cheaper than if you were to do them seperate.

Reviews.Title: “still fuming here”
Reviews.Author: nocomo
Reviews.Content: went a couple of months ago and i'm still fuming about it. awful staff, got there late, sent to a wing of the hotel with no heating in the corridors. no matter, put the heater in the room on i thought. couldn't have been more wrong. the control for the heater was obviously goosed, taped up and everything played with it for a bit trying to get heat. nothing. asked in reception what the score was they told me ' just leave it runing for 20 mins and it'll work' by a really patronising man. i'm ready for bed at this point so have to hope it does kick in after 20. it doesn't. also the duvets on the bed are wafer thin. Next night had a standalone heater in the room (which blew the fuses if combined with more than one light / television) and blankets. it was cheap and you get what you pay for but warmth should be a given, location is further from the centre than expected (one change on the train). i now hate amsterdam because of this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Breakfast & Golf!”
Reviews.Author: dl97
Reviews.Content: We are pleased to say that the hotel exceeded our expectations particularly the breakfast. The choice available was excellent and it really was a great way to start the morning! The service was good and everyone we spoke to were polite and spoke good english. We were suprised at the layout on the 1st floor which reminded us of Pitch & Putt Golf but once inside our room there were no complaints. The room itself was spacious and clean, with all facilities working. We did not have any problems with the local area although we did not travel around at night, It takes about 5 minutes to walk to tram station and then a further 10 minutes to get into the centre of Amsterdam. The Dutch public transport and the longest we waited for a tram was about 5-10 minutes. We ate at the hotel 1 night and the food was good we did feel it was too expensive though. Lastly It is a good idea to buy an I Amsterdam card as this saved us a lot of money and gave us ideas of where to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely confortable, nice restaurant and good prices!”
Reviews.Author: arietebio
Reviews.Content: The service was efficient, the room was clean and had a nice size. The restaurant had great dishes. The hotel is a little bit far from downtown, but it is very easy to get there and to Schipol.

Reviews.Title: “Cannabis Cup”
Reviews.Author: delicate420
Reviews.Content: Located really close to tram line 2 which runs all throughout the city, very convenient location, friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “couldn't be more wrong”
Reviews.Author: andandgaenor
Reviews.Content: read some of the reveiws and was horrified...went with another couple and was very very pleased.staff pleasant and food good.......ok room could be warmer but it was 2 degrees outside in the day........will go again.. p.s. watch the taxi fares....you should pay no more than 24 euro from airport and the tram is up the road for about 3 euro to centre

Reviews.Title: “Never Again...”
Reviews.Author: LillyRoseLiverpool
Reviews.Content: I was led to beleive that the hotel was near the centre, although it wasn't too far away it was a few train stops away, (to my dislike the trains are rather expensive.) When we managed to find the correct stop, it was a lengthy, unsafe and very dark walk to the hotel, which was very difficuilt to find. It was situated in a high crime estate. The following day we left the centre extra early so we wouldn't have to walk through at night. Now, to expalin the good points, the restuarant was okay, the food was tasty, it was quiet and open until 1am. However, our room was freezing, the air-con, although saying on the machine it was working, was letting out cold air eventhough we set it to high. Our double bed was made up of a single bed and a camping bed. The part where it joined in the middle kept making my bed slip away. Therefore, due to this and the fact that it was very very cold, we slept on one single bed with both quilts. I can't say the staff were too friendly, and the our view was of the centre of the hotel, where there is a large whole. We could hear foot steps down along the hallway, and don't get me started on the school children running up and down there in the early hours. To end, I will never stay here again and I do not reccomend this to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Seemed fine at first...”
Reviews.Author: trish_dadish
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of the reviews, and am one of those people who take the negative comments with a grain of salt. I am inclined to think those who write bad reviews were just having a bad day, are overly picky, etc. But I am going to have to say this hotel left a lot to be desired. I will say it is in a great location. Tram 2 is a quick walk away, and takes you right past Leidesplein and Museumplein, and right up past Dam square to Central Station. They have a parking lot if you are driving, which is convenient. The breakfast was good, it was a large room (no bumping elbows with strangers while eating) and they kept all the food well stocked. There is a restaurant there which we didn't use, and a bar...which leads me to the bad part of my review. We arrived on a Friday afternoon, went out to for some sightseeing and food, and got back around midnight. We were all exhausted, and ready for bed. Sleep was not to be had because there was rediculously loud music coming from below us...at first we thought it was the room below us. My husband went down to the lobby to complain about the guest, and heard the music coming from the hotel bar. The people at the front desk offered little help, other then to say the music would be turned off at 1 am...when the bar closed. No offers to turn it down then...apparently they were more worried about the people in the bar than the hotel customers. After 1, when the music was still blaring away, he went down again to see what was going on (it was 1:30), and the guy at the desk said they were waiting for the people to finish their drinks...!!!. We were not the only people complaining about the loud music, and they were still more worried about the customers in the bar than the people trying to sleep. It wouldn't have been hard to just turn it down, they could still finish their drinks. It was flabbergasting. The next night, we came back to the hotel expecting the same racket, but the lobby was silent. Excited to get a good nights sleep, we headed to our rooms....where the heaters were ice cold. They were not working at all...even though the night before they were working just fine. Our friends called to complain, and they brought up a beat up space heater with a missing leg an hour later. I don't know why the heater was not working, when it was fine the night before. Also, the people at the desk seemed unhelpful, like they would rather chit chat with each other than help anyone. Overall, I would not recommend this hotel. We have stayed at hotels in the same price range with not as many problems. Try it for yourself, but be warned you may be in for a bad time.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: arrestea
Reviews.Content: Strengths--the hotel was far from the city center, but with the trams running as often as they are it was no problem, and in fact it affords one the opportunity to see some non-touristy parts of the city. [I considered that a positive, although some travelers may want a closer location to downtown]. In addition, the hotel is only one tram stop away from a busy square, and is a shorter journey to the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh museum than one would have to travel coming from downtown. The room was clean and tidy. Weaknesses--the temperature in the room was very cold; I don't know if the radiator was working, they claimed it was. I could barely sleep for the cold. I had a first floor room and on my last day there I could hear the thumping footsteps of the people above; needless to say, I got no sleep on that day either. The internet in the hotel is a ripoff (5 euros for 45 minutes; you could get 1 hour of usage for 2 euros at any of the internet cafes downtown.) I wouldn't stay here again; the drawbacks outweighed the positives.

Reviews.Title: “IN NEED OF SOME TLC”
Reviews.Author: NOMADS1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with friends 22/01/10 for one night only during a visit to Amsterdam for my wife's Birthday. The biggest let down to this hotel is probably its location. Glad we were a group of 4 because the walk from the main tram line to the hotel (about 5 mins) would be rather scary if you were a lone traveller. The hotel is bizarrely located behind a fire station in the middle of low rise flats forming a housing estate. However, once there form your own opinion. We arrived early and were told we could not check in until 2.00 pm. We knew this was standard terms but wanted to offload our luggage. We were advised that they had a luggage room close by to reception and were given a key code to the lock. However, the room was open and the lock didn't even work. Rather apprehensively we left our luggage there but removed all valuables. If anyone had wanted they could have gone in the room. (not good)!! After a short trip into town we returned to the hotel to find our luggage ok. Pheeeew!!! What a relief. Advise would be if you arrived in Amsterdam early like us to leave your luggage at the central station left luggage (7 euro's 45 cents) for 24 hour period. (far more secure) Then retrieve your luggage catch tram 2 outside station and off to hotel. The tram system is excellent. 7 euro for 24 hour pass gets you unlimited travel on public transport. Obtain tickets from central station. Back at the hotel once checked in - which was done politely and swiftly we were pleasantly surprised with our room. Clean, comfortable , nice bathroom, warm, large TV. and comfy bed, what more could you ask for? Just little things wrong - but nothing too drastic. Examples, no sink plug, only one light working above bathroom mirror - none of this spoilt our stay but it wouldn't take much to put right. The breakfast was excellent. with as much as you desire buffet. All in all good hotel wouldn't take much to make it great.....

Reviews.Title: “How shocked was I!!”
Reviews.Author: nancemcd
Reviews.Content: Having read reviews on this hotel I really wondered what to expect......I should'nt have worried it was great, room really spacious toilet and shower very clean, We had a meal one night in resturant it was delicious and what a plate full we got, as for breakfast it was brill really loved the bacon. Stayed in main building cant comment on annex.

Reviews.Title: “i enjoy it...”
Reviews.Author: spicyposh
Reviews.Content: is nice hotel in quiet location, clean rooms, ooooo my God breakfast was super, fresh bread or rolls everything was smelling very nice i didn t know what 2 pick up first, me and my boyfriend really like it coz we could se different side amsterdam and all travelling to town or ajax arena and airport was really fun, i felt like been in new york:-)people are friendly, only sometimes looks like they work couple hours extra and you can feel they are little bit stressy but they always helped. Is busy hotel as well different faces every hour and and out of room are airfreshess and more people don t like it is smell like apples in cold room but was o.k for me. If i will go back to amsterdam again will be same hotel to go hotel hem. Really enjoy it, go for it

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel for Price....”
Reviews.Author: samreece36
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from 2 nights at HEM hotel and had a great stay. I almost cancelled after reading some negative reviews but i am very satisfied that i decided to go ahead. We booked a "super saver" room and expected to be in the annex but was in the main hotel and first impressions were very good. There was nothing I could complain about, the rooms were very clean and more than adequate for our needs. The hotel is well maintained and no smells which other reviewers complained about. A special thank you must be made to the receptionist (sorry don't know her name) who was always more than helpful and we had the impression she would go out of her way to help. I did not eat or drink at the hotel so cannot comment. The only downside to the hotel is that it is a little out of the way but is really easy to find. I was very happy to take the journey to get this quality of hotel for the price. Overall very satisfied with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Be aware if you stay in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jipp111
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok compared to the price level. Service was not good, but the breakfast was great. However, someone broke into our room while we were having breakfast and stole quite a lot of money and our phones, which we had left in our room. The staff did not seem to be interested in what had happened. I will never go to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet receptionists”
Reviews.Author: zhurav
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, with sweet receptionists and good prices. We have spent 5 days in Hem and one thing we didn't like - bar prices. But pizza was unexepctedly fine.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: shuranet
Reviews.Content: good cost-quality value.good rooms,breakfast,not far from the center-tram.ask rooms with opposite side of highway.

Reviews.Title: “great honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: craigybell
Reviews.Content: stayed at the hem on our honeymoon and becauce we were on honeymoon we were upgraded after proving we were just married the room was superb jacuzzi big big balcony so if ur like us u can have a smoke on the balcony the hotel irself is non-smoking but the balcony came in handy the jacuzzi well what can i say about the jacuzzi after a long days walking around amsterdam/rotterdam theres nothing like coming in having a hot jacuzzi and chilling with a fat green 1 but if the smoke is not ur thing well this hotel will suit as i said its non-smoking food was superb staff were excellent nothing was ever a problem for them location is only a 10 min tram ride from the city centre with a bus/tram stop only a mins waqlk away and also the metro is only just along the road i would recommend room 402 with the big balcony if u like a smoke

Reviews.Title: “cant wait to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: spambo79
Reviews.Content: me and my girlfriend really enjoyed our stay at the hem hotel our room was nice and the hotel itself is decent ,i recommend the pizza lovely when got the munchies. the snack bar was open till 430am happy days. i liked the pond outside watching the fish with the fattest reefa ever walking round the tranquil gardens with my joint taking in the scenery while my girl was lying down in the bed bombed eating dutch cakes watching television this is a decent hotel that i will be going back to in the near future!!!! 8/10

Reviews.Title: “Very basic but cheap and clean”
Reviews.Author: nickster99
Reviews.Content: **Review by 34yo Australian male** Stayed here for a weekend in November. My room was in the annex part. The room was fairly small with 2 single beds and a tv and a chair. The bathroom was ok, but plenty of hot water. The room had heating which worked all night (it was quite a cold weekend). On first arriving in the annex part, the whole place smelt of marijuana, but hey, it's Amsterdam and you smell that a lot everywhere. I could have paid an additional 20EURO per night to upgrade to the main building, but couldn't be bothered. The room was fine. If you want luxury hotel appointments, then obviously don't stay here. But if you want a room which is clean and comfortable and cheap, then the HEM is great! The reception service was very friendly. Wireless internet is 10EURO for 24 hours. It's a 7-8 minute walk to the nearest tram stop, and then about 20 minutes into Amsterdam Centraal. So very convenient. The trams run until just after midnight then there is an all night bus service at about 30 minute intervals.

Reviews.Title: “Don't judge a book by it's cover”
Reviews.Author: r1skbreak3r
Reviews.Content: First impressions weren't that great - the area isn't the best and the exterior isn't anything to shout about. The hotel lobby was OK, but there was a slight musty smell around the place. On trying to check-in, we were told that we would have to wait till 2pm but could leave our luggage in the baggage room and were given a code for the lock - the room itself was like a spare room, looking old and tired, and doesn't give a good first impression - especially when I tried to exit the room and noticed that the lock on the door doesn't actually lock!! On returning for check-in, we were allocated a ground floor room and the walk through the cold, ugly corridor to get to it wasn't filling us with much hope of a decent room. However we were very pleasantly surprised when we opened the door, as the room was nicely decorated, clean, and quite pleasant. There was a decent sized TV, a useful tourist guide/book, but no tea/coffee facilities. The bathroom was clean with lots of hot water and a decent shower, although the towel rail/hooks could've done with tightening/replacing. The food at the hotel is excellent, much better than what we expected and reasonably priced. We ate there twice in the evenings, and can recommend the schnitzel and the steak! Breakfast was also great, lots of variety and decent food, plus tea, coffee & juices. There are a couple of supermarkets nearby plus other shops. The tram stop is about 5 mins walk and it takes about 15 mins to get into the city centre. Trams run till midnight-ish so getting back shouldn't be a problem. Overall we had a great stay and would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in the annex!!”
Reviews.Author: PortsmouthMike
Reviews.Content: We were booked in the 2 star annex part of this hotel but on arrival felt that the accomodation was inhabitable. There was a terrible sewage stench all around the building and inside the rooms was unbearable. Also the decor was dated, to say the least, and in need of repair (broken light fitting, etc). When we complained at the reception the staff member tried to initially fob us off and offered us another room which was even worse! He then offered to call out the maintenance team but at the same time said that he knew about the problems and that there was nothibng they could do about it. We stuck to our guns and carried on complaining until we got a free upgrade to the 3 star accomodation in the main building which was quite comfortable. It is a shame that this hotel comtinues to sell rooms in this annex facility because it lets the whole facility down.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly”
Reviews.Author: CharmNZ
Reviews.Content: The hotel its self was a little smelly. The breakfast was good, lots to eat a good range of food. I thought the location wasn't that great but they do give you a business card with the address and tram number to catch. I don't think I would stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly Good Hotel... Theiving cleaning staff.”
Reviews.Author: rachelem89
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hem between 11/10/09 and 15/10/09. We were a little dubious prior to arriving after reading some nightmare reviews from people on trip advisor. We phoned the hotel prior to arrival to make it quite clear we would not be staying in the 'annexe' accomodation (recommend doing this!). We were allocated room 120 on the first floor. On arrival at the hotel (We hired a car) we parked up and went into reception, which looked very nice, all clean with a nice little snack bar off to one side. The lady on reception was very welcoming and helpful. On arrival in our room, the toilet flush was broken. My partner went down to reception to ask about repair. After an hour or so, a member of staff turned up (unsure of name, but he was tall with dark skin and short hair) he took one look and said it was fine (it wouldnt even flush!) we found him to be quite rude and unwilling to help, and asked to either have the toilet fixed or move rooms. After a bit of making it quite clear we were not happy, we were alloacted to another room, which was lovely and clean, and all in working order. However, in both rooms we had some mouldy mildew around the bathroom, due to a lack of extraction fan for the shower. The shower though was wonderful, lots of hot clean water and a nice strong blast after a cold day!!! On our first night we ate in the hotel. We both had a panini with a portion of chips each, which was fantastic, really tasty and not bad value at all, I think it came to about 20 euros for both of us including a drink each. The menu was good, with a fair bit of choice at a somewhat reasonable price compared to some of the restaurants in the city centre. We also had the breakfast every morning, which was lovely, nice and hot with a lot of choice - cant complain about the breakfast and bar staff, all very nice. We didnt use the little snack bar. There is a Lidl next to the hotel just under the bridge, which sells drinks and biscuity cakey things as well as fruit extremely cheap - perfect if youre off out for the day as drinks can cost upwards of 3-4 euros a time in the centre. The one thing that really disappointed us was that we had money go missing from the room during the day. My partner regularly travels abroad with work, and likes to leave a couple of euros (or equivalant) on the floor to see if they are taken or put on the side by honest staff. Unfortunately in the hem hotel, the money was taken, and I had some of my make up products and perfume used whilst we were out during the day. This is something we will be writing to the hem hotel about, as it is totally unacceptable. The location of the hotel wasnt too bad, the tram station was about 5 minutes walk. Once you get the hang of how to use the tram system, its really good. Its about a 15-20 minute ride to centraal station / dam square. Loads to do and see in the city centre, only thing id say to avoid is the extra cold ice bar, its a waste of money - very expensive for not a lot!!! The heineken experience is fanatastic, and a visit to ann franks house & a boat cruise were good too. Be careful of using the small pizza shops just outisde the red light district - there are no prices and the turkish owners make their prices up as they go along - there is one next to chikaaas that has prices which serves lovely snacks. I recommed trying Vlaamse Frites too!!!! Overall a good cheap and cheerful hotel - just dont leave anything out on display - lock EVERYTHING in your suitcase - toiletries included.

Reviews.Title: “A learning experience”
Reviews.Author: kathieGstar
Reviews.Content: I don't normally stay in 3 star hotels. This one was such a good deal with parking and breakfast included so we decided to give it a try - i would rather save $ on the hotel and have more money to go shopping LOL. I will never attempt a 3 star again. The service, lobby, breakfast, food, location were all okay, but the room itself was disgusting. From the photos the rooms looked decent, but I concluded that this was because they were recently "renovated" by adding new furniture. The bed was disgusting... sheets had stains and hairs on them. Bathroom reaked of bleach... at least I knew it was clean. The first night i covered the pillow with a tshirt and slept in my clothes and the second night i stole 4 clean sheets from the maids cart and attempted to make up my own bed. The value was great. If you are a cleanliness freak like myself I don't recommend the hotel though. The neighborhood is kinda sketchy.. but the location is relatively close to centrum. We walked to centrum in about 30 minutes.. it was a nice walk... got to see parts of Amsterdam that are not "tourist" parts from this walk. We cabbed it back to the hotel from the red light district and it think it was about 15-20 Euro... Please be aware that there's no stores etc near the hotel and they charge like 3 or 3.5 Euro for a small bottle of water!!!!! I was outraged by this, but bought it anyway.... make sure to bring your own!!!

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: ichlieberwth
Reviews.Content: very bad, although it is not cheap. The bathroom is much to small and dirty, we did not have a bath, because it looks too bad. never again!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: slipultura
Reviews.Content: Staff were extremely friendly, the room was comfortable and the price was perfect. Overall a good experience. Food served until 4 or 5 in the morning proved very useful. Returning on the 24th of this month, absolutely cant wait.

Reviews.Title: “Ruined our vacation”
Reviews.Author: mehent
Reviews.Content: The room we got was the most horrible i have ever seen. It was in a separate building and really small and dirty, lamps were broken and it smelled so bad i got a headache. We went back to the reception and had to pay extra to get a better room from the main building. The staff in the bar was wery rude when we tryed to spend the drink vouchers we were given. Me and my sister felt they treated older people better and didn't care about young customers. The hotel is also really far from the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: MillarsSelkirk
Reviews.Content: Travelled with my mum, sister and niece. After reading some previous reviews we were apprehensive about the HEM hotel. We were very happy with this 3 star hotel. We had 2 twin rooms between the 4 of us, both had plenty room, coimfy beds and very clean. Lots of hot water for shower. Rooms cleaned every day. We only spoke to staff who were working on the reception, everyone pleasant and polite. No problem to leave your luggage if you arrive before your room is ready, you can also leave your luggage at the hotel after you check out. Breakfast was really good with a very good selection. Hotel on the outskirts of main Amsterdam. Not a problem though as the tram stop is only a few minutes away. Number 2 tram takes you back and forward to the middle of Amsterdam. Bought 3 day passes for 15 euros at Central Station, these covered trams, trains and buses. If you want to stay at a hotel for a reasonable price, we would recommend the HEM hotel. Word of warning, there is an annexe beside the hotel, this building looks very unpleasant, if booking make sure your room is not in the annexe. All in all we were more than happy.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend it, especially not for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: sturmflut
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the HEM hotel for seven nights (saturday to saturday) and payed about 70 euros/night for a double room with breakfast and a 72 hour public transport ticket. Pro: - Nothing. Not even cheap. Neutral: - Breakfast, nothing fancy but does the job. Cons: - The room was not cleaned. They basically just make the bed and replace the towels in the bathroom, but as you can see on the pictures the bathroom is filthy. - Furniture in the bathroom was broken, see the attached photo.
