The light bulbs would flicker at random, I suspect the wiring is broken too. - The hotel uses a system where you leave your room key at the reception when you leave the building and get a "keycard" (a hand-written piece of paper) you later show to get the room key back. This system is obviously flawed as you could simply change the writing on the card or steal a blank card and fill it out. The staff works in three shifts so nobody knows if a keycard is legitimate. In the end the staff failed at their own system and would hand out the wrong key on multiple occasions, mostly because they couldn't read what their colleague wrote or they would interchange the digits and e.g. hand out room key 223 when you had room 323. - If you plan to rely on public transport for sightseeing choose a different hotel. HEM is located 10 minutes from the next stop and that one is only connected to a single tram line and a night bus. The tram line is number 2, one of the busiest lines (connects central station to the city center, the entertainment area and museums), and therefore quite unreliable most of the time. A single trip from HEM to the city center or the central station takes at least 30 minutes (the tram ride from the stop to central station alone takes 22 minutes according to the plan). Your public transport tickets will not be valid for the night bus, so be careful if you plan to return late or have to leave early. - Internet Access is extremely expensive, the "cheapest" offer being 35 euros for a week. - HEM "polished" their offer by excluding the city tax and including a 72 hour public transport ticket they didn't have. As an excuse the reception gave us the 30 euros for the ticket in cash but we had to return all the way to the central station to buy the ticket and lost a lot of time. - The hotel has only one elevator for "normal" customers - the second one only goes to the fourth floor. At our last day the elevator broke down and was not fixed, forcing us to carry our luggage over three stories the next day. - If you don't mind paying 11 euro for a simple pizza you can eat at the restaurant. - HEM built a second building that's connected to the main building via stairs and bridges. Ways around the buildings can be quite long depending on which room you got. I suspect that HEM is simply overloaded during the summer months and quality might be better the rest of the year, but mosst issues apply all year.

Reviews.Title: “better than the price suggested!”
Reviews.Author: chicken36
Reviews.Content: Wasn't expecting much and true it's tatty in parts but the room for 3 was big and clean. Reception bit gloomy but helpful. Trams very easy, accessible and cheap if you buy a ticket to cover several days. Can store luggage before room available. Fine for group stay.

Reviews.Title: “cheap and good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: travelingnorwegian
Reviews.Content: a 10-15 min tram ride outside city center, but i liked it. probably not the most central place in amsterdam, but it was clean and comfy place to stay. shops and reataurants nearby. tram stop was 4 min walk from hotel. i would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Beatman91
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 6 days. Room was nice but the shower flooded the bathroom so we opted for the sink most of the time. We asked for a non smoking but got a smoking one. We put a "Do not disturb sign" on the door and we were woken up and told that we have to let them clean. The staff where really short and rude except for one young girl in the bar. We needed a doctor but no one in the hotel had a clue and was willing to help. Location is one train and one metro stop from the airport. Its an hour walk from the center or 20 min cycle. Tram is only around the corner so if your happy with that its only 10 min away. Also there is a main motorway right in front of it, so noise can be an issue. I won't stay there again but that's only because the staff are really rude.

Reviews.Title: “There are better options...”
Reviews.Author: My_great_odyssey
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as part of a flight and Hotel package and should have paid more attention to the reviews. First, the 3-star rating is beyond optimistic. The Hotel is very basic, but that is no excuse for the lack of cleanliness. The bathroom had mould in the grouting between the tiles, which is just not acceptable. The shower overflowed after 2 minutes of use due to blocked plumbing. The carpets were dirty and the beds were well past retirement. The location is, well, terrible. It's a 7 minute walk to the tram stop and then another 20 minutes to town. I would recommend you stay in the city and either pay extra for a clean hotel or to pay the same and stay at a clean backpackers hostel.

Reviews.Title: “basic”
Reviews.Author: lovejumping
Reviews.Content: very much bargain basement material and in a very bad location, i was in the so called annexe which is basically a few portacabins to the side of the hotel however,it is an alternative if you want to save a bit of cash on the last night and dont want to stay in a hostel, for that reason alone i would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel- Just don't stay in the annex”
Reviews.Author: keli1991
Reviews.Content: When me and some friends arrived at this hotel we were supposed to be staying in the Annex building, luckily we decided to upgrade which was 20 euros per night- well worth the money. The hotel itself is lovely, the rooms were very clean and comfortable although the view from our window wasn't very nice. We spent most nights eating in the bar/resturant as the food was amazing, although it was very expensive. The Napoli Pannini's are the best thing on the menu although alcohol from the bar is also expensive, the same as the rest of the city. The staff were also very nice and spoke very good English, they did not hesitate to help us when we needed help. The only bad point about the hotel is the location as it is a half an hour tram journey. Being in a small group of girls, this made it difficult to come home late at night because the walk from the tram stop wasn't very nice, and we attracted lots of unwanted attention. Despite this, I would definatley reccommend this hotel and I would definatley go back, just with a few more people.

Reviews.Title: “Miles to far out!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kebabking08
Reviews.Content: The hotel is to a good standard but is miles to far out to be able to do alot in amsterdam with out spending alot of money we had to get taxi's every where as the tram's had either stopped running or there was a diversion so we didnt have a clue where we was going....but the hotel is not a bad place to stay if you no where your going....only part of the hotel has been re-vamped...and i would defo stay in the re-vamped hotel part,altough a nice hotel i would say that the re-vamp has been done on the cheap at tad as there are things that should of been done and havent.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms, but some minor repairs needed”
Reviews.Author: Bikyee
Reviews.Content: I traveled with a group of 8 people so booked 2 quad rooms which consisted of 4 single beds. The rooms were quite large so you didn't feel you were bumping into each other all the time. The housekeeping of the rooms was questionable because on the 2nd day, I noticed the bin had not been emptied (even though it was full) and they forgot to leave us a bath mat. The bathroom tap was a bit faulty too because it sprayed water onto the mirror. The location of the hotel was on the outskirts of Amsterdam, but the tram stop is about 5 mins walk away. There was also shops near the tram stop. The ride to Central Station is probably 15-20 mins and it goes past all the major tourist sights first - Rijksmuseum, Leidsplein, Dam Square. If you have a car, the car park charge is â‚¬12.50 a day and if you want to use the wifi it's â‚¬10 a day.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay in the 2 star option.”
Reviews.Author: travellingchillie
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as we got a good â€œ2 nights for the price of one dealâ€� on the 2* room. When we checked in at the lobby, they informed us that our room was in the â€œlittle building opposite the lobby and if you want to upgrade to the main building, itâ€™ll cost â‚¬20â€�. We went across and it seemed to be a portable building where each step creaked. We were on the second floor (there were only 2 floors). To get to our room, we had to walk along a corridor which had plants growing through the open windows. The room itself was small. The bathroom was tiny and rather disgusting. To sit on the toilet, we had to sit sideways as the distance between the commode and the wall was not enough, and I'm not a very tall person. Plus the toilet lid would not stay up. The shower had ants crawling out of the drain and some growth that I really didnâ€™t want to look too closely at. It didnâ€™t drain too well either. Definitely wore slippers when having a shower. The twin beds were fine though and the television was small but adequate with BBC and CNN in English. The hotel isnâ€™t that close to the city centre but there's a tram close by that takes about Â½ hour to get there. Note it goes through 2 zones so is a bit more expensive. So, not the most convenient location, but not too bad. On the second night, the room had been made up but there was a nasty smell coming from the toilet so the door had to be kept closed during the night. Also, only one bath towel had been left for us. We had to go and get the second towel from the main building.

Reviews.Title: “clean hotel and rooms, friendly staff, quiet location. Good value”
Reviews.Author: smudge073
Reviews.Content: i have just got back from a weekend in Amsterdam and after reading the reviews of this hotel before i went, i was wondering what we had let ourselves in for. However, it was a lovely hotel to stay in, the rooms were clean and spacious and the staff were very friendly and helpful. It is outside the city and means a tram ride into the main part, but that was not difficult and the trams are a fantastic service....better than the buses in britain!! plus, it is all part of the experience to explore around and whenever we appeared lost, someone was always willing to help us with directions. We bought a travelcard to cover the metro, trams and buses and it was definitely worth the money, unlimited use on the days that we went and we took that advantage to the limit! The only downer i would say is that the breakfast was a bit on the expensive side, the hotel wanted 14 euros for a buffet style breakfast which i think would have mainly been pastries etc, but we just headed into town and had a lovely breakfast at a different coffee shop each day for a far cheaper price. I did find that quite a few things in amsterdam are not cheap, but that has alot to do with the euro against the pound. not a good exchange rate at the moment and that does make the difference when you are buying. But this hotel was one of the cheapest that we looked at and i was very impressed with the value for money that we got in this.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price - Terrible Location”
Reviews.Author: jennam21
Reviews.Content: Lobby to the hotel is very clean and inviting. Most people at the front desk spoke English fairly well (like everyone else in Amsterdam). They do not, however, know much the area--so don't expect to get any directions from them whatsoever. For the most part, however, desk staff seemed polite and professional. The room was TINY: just enough room for two twin beds, but we did have the smallest room on the floor according to the map on the back of the door. The bathroom was about the same size as the room it seemed. For as much space as it had, though, it certainly had a lot of void area. There was only a shower, and the mirror in front of the sink was way too high to see in (but I'm pretty short). The location was not ideal. All of the main attractions were pretty far away -- the Van Gogh and Rijksmuseum were both about 2 miles away, and Dam Square and the Anne Frank House even farther. We walked the distance several times but it was pretty tiring. There is, however, a tram stop (#2) at Westlandgracht stop, which was about 4 blocks away that connects to most of the attractions and Amsterdam Centraal Station. This gets a little expensive, though, because it is about 2 euro or more a person each ride (we were budget travelers). You can buy a Strippenkaart, however, which is a bus pass sort of thing, at kiosks, which I think is about 7 euro. There aren't really any restaurants or markets anywhere close to the hotel. There is, however, a cafe downstairs that has pretty good food (but is rather pricey - 6 to 8 euro for just a sandwich). There is also a computer downstairs that you can use for internet, but it is pricey too at 2.50 euro for 15 minutes, or 5 euro for 45 minutes. Overall, it was definitely not a perk-filled hotel, but I would recommend it for budget travelers that don't mind being a little bit out of the way to save some money.

Reviews.Title: “miles from anywhere and make sure you dont get the cheap rooms!”
Reviews.Author: bunny_piggy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner and two friends in may. we booked via expedia and booked he cheapest twin rooms.they didnt tell us at the time that these rooms were not in the main hotel but in a portacabin next to the hotel. the hotel itself was fine - not much room in restaurant / bar but other than that ok. if you were in the main hotel it would have been very nice but as we were in the cheap rooms they were disgusing and i wouldnt recomend them to anyone. they were virtually a portacbin with a bathroom which was nearly impossible to use due to the way it was laid out - you coudnt sit on the toilet without sitting sideways for example There was a tv in the room and two twin beds fixed to the wall. if you are expecting this quality then they were fine and suited their purpose - sleeping! also the portacabin was adjacent to the main moteorway so not very peaceful therefore we recommend you check when booking so you know which rooms you will be allocated, distance wise it was about 40 mins walk to main town or about 5 miins walk to the tram stop. took about 15 mins on the tram to get to the centre of town.. i wouldnt recommend this hotel for new visitors to amsterdam as it tkes ages to get your bearings and is a bit of a palava to get back to the hotel each night which ruined it a bit. overall - a budget hotel too far out of the city.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel of 2 halves - read before you visit!”
Reviews.Author: NeedsMoreHolidays
Reviews.Content: Well, we read a lot of mixed reviews about HEM prior to arrival, and are very glad we did. The hotel has an Annex aswell as a main building, and there is a significant difference between the two. It seems if you book through Expedia, you will be booked into the Annex, which as of May 09 has not been rennovated for some years. We vemailed the hotel prior and arranged to upgrade to the main building, throughout are stay when in the reception area we overheard many guests asking to move,the charge was 20 euros per night.The room in the main building was nice but basic, no kettle, small en-suite, no balcony, but good as a base for exploring. The tram stop is a 2 minute walk, and the surrounding area looks a little rough, but we saw no trouble at all. Take the tram number 2 into the main city centre, a 2 or 3 day tram pass from Central Station is well worth the money if you want to see everything.All in all it was a lovely break, however, if we had not emailed prior (they respond quickly highly reccomend) and arranged an upgrade in advance, we may have had a much different experience!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay in the annex!!!”
Reviews.Author: photogirlkt
Reviews.Content: My friend booked this hotel as part of a ferry trip for her 21st birthday. There were 12 of us and on arriving in the city we got in three taxis to get to the hotel, bad idea! From central station we were charged between 24 and 31 Euros for each taxi, and the drivers must have seen us coming as they took us a very long away around!! On arrival at the hotel we were excited as the lobby etc looked beautiful, then we were given our room keys and went over to the annex..AKA the shed. The corridors smelt of pee, the beds were hard and the bed linen not at all nice. The pillows seemed old and worn. There was paint peeling off the walls. The bathroom was a complete joke. Even as a 5ft 7 fairly slim woman, I could not fit onto the toilet and excuse my details but had to sit SIDEWAYS to use it!! The shower was dirty and the bathroom smelt. We put up with it for the one night as we were mostly out partying but I would not recommend more than one night here. Most of us were too scared to use the showers though I did, it was a struggle to fit due to how the showerhead is positioned. When people walked in the other rooms or shut doors, all could be heard. I'm not sure exactly how much we paid for this hotel but I think it was around 50 pounds per person... sharing a twin room, not exactly cheap!!! Just checked the website for the hotel and it is very misleading!!

Reviews.Title: “Nastiest hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: badgercadger
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hem while making our way through Europe on the cheap. He booked this place without looking at any reviews, and did we ever suffer for it. First, it is a good distance from the city center. We arrived after the trams stopped running for the night and had to take a taxi, which cost about 25 euros. Second, this was--by far--the dirtiest hotel we stayed in during our month long trip. I'm not sure if the main building has nicer rooms, but the room we stayed in was in a separate building, which was old and smelly. Despite "no smoking" signs posted everywhere, the place reeked of smoke--of the cigarette and hash varieties. The beds were gross and the showers even grosser, with mold and mildew growing everywhere. The whole place just gave me the feeling that I should not touch anything. I'll put it this way: When we checked out, my husband told the girl at the counter that he thought she should know that the rooms were dirty. Her response was "REALLY dirty?" as if to say that a nominal amount of funk is to be expected at the Hem. For a good deal I can put up with old buildings, paltry amenities and grouchy employees...but filth I cannot abide. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone for any reason.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Mickylcy
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel a nice place and the staff were very helpful. The hotel was easy to find, just go to the information centre when you get to Central Station and then ask the tram driver of the no 2 tram and they say when you get there. The area is safe and there are shops locally, supermarket, food shop, post office etc. The room was clean, warm and the beds very nice and soft, tv was very basic but there is a radio within the tv. Once you find your feet it's easy to get in to town. I emailed the hotel before we travelled just to make sure we did not get a room in the annex, the rooms on the 4th floor are very nice. If you dont want the chambermaid to enter your room, make sure you put the" do not disturb " sign on the door and just leave it there during your stay. The hotel charges a tax on arrival we paid 7E but we then over heard other guest's being charged 3.50E !!!. The drinks and food are very expensive and they charge for, the safe 4E a day, pool table 2E each game, breakfast, got up too late, and if you want to smoke in your room they charge 10E a day, even though it's a no smoking hotel, if you're on the right floor, smoke out the window , overall our stay was very nice at the hotel but also very expensive, not just the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Thieving Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Cupes68
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Hem is a lovely place to stay, clean, tidy nice sized rooms. A liitle out of the centre but only a tram ride from the centre. Just 1 little problem. The Cleaners are Thieving b@stards and the guy on reception didnt want to know about the crime!! My advice, by all means use the hotel but also lock away your money or even better carry it with you at all times!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough Motel in a rough area”
Reviews.Author: Tomo_Berkshire
Reviews.Content: The room was satisfying but the bathroom tiny and there were no ironing boards available. In my opinion the place should be rather called a Motel than Hotel and as such it was overpriced (140 Euros p/n). To get to town centre it takes approximately 15 minutes on a tram. The hotel wasn't bad but I wouldnâ€™t stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For.........”
Reviews.Author: Ruthless7545
Reviews.Content: Yes, the hotel is cheap but, they charge for everything you might use, T.V. Internet,Telephone. My room didn't have a hairdryer but my son's did. Bring your own soap because they don't have any in the bathrooms.Also,my shower was open to the rest of the bathroom so the floor was continually wet. Good news,the water in the shower was hot. The restaurant service was poor and the food not much better. I do believe the walls were cardboard because every time a door closed I heard it along with voices from any nearby rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Not all bad...”
Reviews.Author: clairebearh
Reviews.Content: Firstly, some of the opinions here are WAY to harsh! Fair enough, we were lucky enough not to be staying in the annex which did look a bit grim but this hotel was perfectly tasteful. It was clean, warm, safe and secure. The hotel itself is slighty out of the way but nothing a 15 min tram ride couldn't solve. (Take the number 2 to New sloten from central tram station) Once there, we were able to stow our luggage away until check-in and after checking out prior to our late-night flight. The hotel boasts a bar with pool table, large reception/lounge room, large breakfast room, mini snack bar, glass elevator and two small terraces outside the hotel. Our room comprised of double/twin beds, reasonable sized bath/shower room and offered free air con/heating and t.v. Also spacious warderobe and room service. There were also helpful guides/brochures provided in our room which helped greatly while planning our activities and excursions as well as providing information about getting around the city and facts about the city. Breakfast was served 7 till 10am and was varied widely from meats and cheeses, to cereals, cooked breakfasts and fruits/yoghurts all of which was a high standard. We found the staff to be very helpful, informative and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DeanoM
Reviews.Content: Firstly, whatever everyone has written about this hotel, is complete rubbish!!! Yes the hotel is set in the ghetto, surounded by dingy looking flats and hooded youths on the street corners. But it is a completely safe area. I have just come back for the HEM hotel after a weekend with friends. The hotel is clean, tidy, well kept and secure. the staff are friendly, helpful and will give you all the information you need about Amsterdam and the surrounding area's. We came back to the hotel at around 4am via the night bus. Tha bus/tram stop is about 10minute walk from the hotel. Yes you do have to walk through the ghetto, but it's completely safe and there was no trouble at all. The room's of the hotel were clean and the lobby was tidy. There was 4 of us and it cost 17 euro's each for the room with breakfast. That is very cheap for the standard of the hotel, considering hostel's are nearly the same price. Overall ignore the other comments and see for yourself, and you will realise what rubbish the other comments are. thank you

Reviews.Title: “Could you get any worse?!!?!?”
Reviews.Author: AustTraveller001
Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel at all cost!! From the moment we walked into this hotel it was hell. Like other postings, we were initially placed in the annex. The annex reflects a poorly run backpacker joint and had rotting trimmings along the corridor and mouldy carpet. The room was absolutely freezing as the only heating was from a mini two bar heater. The bathroom was grotty and we were too afraid to use the shower. After enquiring about the heating in our room, we were moved to another room which was not much better. Since our room was cold we thought we would warm up with dinner in the attached restaurant. We ordered the daily cream of mushroom soup however after waiting ages, we were presented with a luke warm slop resembling minestrone soup. We were initally booked in for two nights however decided to check out to move to a more decent, centrally located hotel. This hotel is not worth the visit and will ruin your stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “HEM = Horrible Emotional Metaphor”
Reviews.Author: andrewkatsaris
Reviews.Content: First off, when you book a package and the airfare comes with a room at the HEM Amsterdam, run the other way. Don't even think about staying here, especially if you get stuffed in the annex. My two friends and I went on business to Amsterdam and were fooled by the marketing photos of the HEM. We thought we'd be getting a tastefully decorated room in a nice 3-star hotel. What we found on arrival, however, was a mess. The rooms were TINY (smaller than even a small stateroom on cruise ship), smelly (cannabis, tobacco, and sewage), and disgusting. The bathrooms were HORRID. The shower stall was filthy, you couldn't sit properly on the toilet, and there was really no place to stow your shaving kit. The beds were singles and very small. The linens were gross and I believe bedbugs or fleas had already taken up residence there before we arrived. We left the HEM after only one night, preferring instead to pay mega bucks to stay at the lavish Krasnapolsky on Dam Square. In short, avoid the HEM like the plague (unless you're a low-rent traveler with no taste whatsoever).

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay In Annex Section”
Reviews.Author: dinkiedoo4
Reviews.Content: booked 3 nights stay at hem hotel through travel republic, after reading other peoples reviews made sure we where not in annex section in hotel but travel republic put us in annex when we arrived and they said they didn't, i advise that if you book with a travel company actually call up Hem hotel to check because this is what they told us we 'should' have done. The 'annex' was not even part of the hotel it is like a caravan opposite hotel that stunk of beer, bo and cannabis. It had 2 single beds which you couldn't move and which where made out of mdf and the bathroom you couldn't sit on toilet the space was so small and the sink and shower where filthy and the beds where absolutley covered with pee stains. There was beer behind the bed and just horrible. We paid for a upgrade and moved to the main hotel and didn't feel like gipsys anymore, the main hotel we had no problems all was very nice and very clean. Non of the rooms in Hem hotel actually have double beds they are 2 singles pushed together. The location of this hotel is quite far from central amsterdam 15-20mins tram ride, would be worth the extra money to actually stay closer to the center because travel costs add up. ANywhere between leidsplien and central amserdam i would reccommend staying because thats all in walking distance and very nice area. I will upload pictures of annex later, really must avoid staying there, oh, and the curtain had a very bad case of mould :(

Reviews.Title: “Hem Hotel - great place!”
Reviews.Author: seth_carnill
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the reviews about this hotel I was slightly worried about staying in this hotel. All my worries vanished though as I entered the hotel. The hotel really is a good quality 3* hotel, located in the western part of Amsterdam and has loads of rooms (more than 200 I believe). Itâ€™s easily reachable by pretty much any type of public transport and the tram stop is a 2 minute walk away from the hotel. I realize now why certain people complained. A small part of the hotel which is located outside the main building is called â€˜Annexâ€™ and has about 20 rooms. This part of the hotel is indeed outdated and not as nice as the main building. Make sure you get a room in the main building and I guarantee you, you will not regret. I was there with my fiancÃ©e and she loved every minute of it. Make sure you get up in time to have their breakfast, itâ€™s yummy!

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: FyingKiwi
Reviews.Content: In all of my extensive travelling through all of Europe, this has to be the second worst Hotel i have stayed at. Only the great breakfast saved it from the wooden spoon award. The pictures you see on the web page are not necessarily what you get. Having booked months in advance (and prepaid) for a double room, I was looking forward to this being a highlight of our European tour. What we got was two single beds (attached to the walls either side of a very small room. Atop of which were mattresses even smaller than the base and an ensuite so small, you had to sit sideways on the toilet. The building itself looked like the staff quarters and had no lift (unlike what was stated in their advertising). The plumbing leaked, soaking the carpet and internet access was provided at a considerable cost. The staff was both rude and very unhelpful. If you still wish to stay there, then get a guarantee to have provided what they say they have. It is a long way from being a three star hotel. There are much better deals in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at the Annexe section”
Reviews.Author: TrueToTravel
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent booked this hotel....thank goodness it was only for one night! We requested a double room, we got two twin beds, in the annexe section of this hotel the "economic part" as they called it, but the price we paid was not economical for what we got. The main hotel had breakfast the next morning and looked much nicer then the place we stayed. The bathroom was awful, the entrance to the annexe section was open all night and we were on ground level. I didnt feel safe but nothing happened nor did it look like it was in a rough area, so that was good. It's also far from downtown. Although the tram is very close by and a nice ride into the main part of the city, we would have much preferred to have been closer. We are recommending to our travel agent to NOT recommend this hotel - well the annexe - to her clients.

Reviews.Title: “basic, but good”
Reviews.Author: Fitchy_gent
Reviews.Content: we've stayed here 2 nights. To be honest, there are a lot of negative reviews about this hotel ... but it's not that bad at all. When you book, please ask for a renovated room in the main building. These rooms look new and have the comfort you need. I've stayed a few times in Amsterdam, and this hotel was not so bad at all (if you come by car of course / secured hotel parking). We've paid 59 euro per person (twin rooms for single use), per night (breakfast included). Breakfast is good, and above standards of what you should normally get in amsterdam. Hotel is mainly used by tourists and groups ....

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: likeroamin
Reviews.Content: On a recent family holiday we had the luck to stay at this hotel. We booked the hotel over the internet - it was cheap so i did not expect much. We had our car and so needed a hotel with secure parking, which this hotel has for a very reasonable price. When i arrived i was very impressed by the twin room that i was sharing with my sister in the main building. It was large, the decor was contemporary and in good condition and was very comfortable. It took about an hour to walk to the centre, which i enjoyed. You go through the Fondl Park which is lovely. There is public transport for non walkers, we did use it once due to too much fine food!

Reviews.Title: “Beware - do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: Karavotsakisma
Reviews.Content: I cannot comment on the rooms in the main building as I was put into the annexe by Expedia.co.uk and what a horrendous place it was. It is nothing more than a wooden pre-fab building rather like the portacabins you see at building sites. The rooms are disgusting in every sense. They stink of smoke despite no smoking laws in the Netherlands. I stayed one night only and will be complaining to Expedia. This 'annexe' should be condemned. Despite all the other similarly dreadful reviews, this place still hasn't been pulled down and is still recommended by Expedia.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of research is all it takes!”
Reviews.Author: travelwise46
Reviews.Content: Okay - first bit of advice is make sure you are booked into the hotel proper and not the annex. The latter seems to have been built in response to the demand for accomodation for stag/hen parties and the annex is designed to house, to put it bluntly, groups of drunken Brits. Be especially careful if you are part of a large group as this will be the default accomodation allocated. Some reviewers have complained tha it takes a long time to get served here. It takes a long time to get served in Amsterdam full stop. Other complaints are that the only way to get back from central Amsterdam at night is to get a taxi. Not so - the nightbus 358 runs at 30 minute intervals and stops at the same place as the tram' If you are not booked in for breakfast and you're happy with bread/croissant and cheese turn right under the underpass and you will come to an Albert Hein supermarket, a Lidl discount stor and a delfland (pastry) bakery. The area looks a bit concrete and intimidating but don't worry - we found it perfectly safe. The Hrm hotel is easily the best we have stayed at in Amsterdam and the commute really is worth it to be out of the noise of the cantre.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible smell of mold, this hotel is a health risk”
Reviews.Author: peetas
Reviews.Content: Our room (141) was saturated with a strong smell of mold coming from the old bathroom. The room was not very clean either, everything felt a bit sticky. I am not very picky when it comes to cleanines, I often stay in cheap hostels, but this smell was nothing I have seen before, just unbearable. The window could not be opened and the airco+bathroom ventilator were too weak to reduce the smell. The receptionist was refusing to change our room or todo anything about it, although there were many free rooms. She would only change the room if we would pay extra. The smell was making me and my girlfriend sick. In the morning we did not even feel like having a breakfast in that place, just to get out of there, fast.

Reviews.Title: “bit dire”
Reviews.Author: che_che84
Reviews.Content: The main problem for me was the location.... so far out of the centre it wasnt funny! Had to cross busy motor way and walk through housing scheme to get to hotel... Hotel itself was a-ok... but the shower.. my god worse than anything i had seen. breakfAST however was GOOD!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Shower Withour Flip-Flops”
Reviews.Author: BamBamTexas
Reviews.Content: To say that this hotel is a disgusting, filthy mess would be an understatement. This room was so dirty that the hotel staff had to come to the room twice to pour straight disinfectant into the shower drain and toilet to eliminate the odor of raw sewage. The rooms were filthy and there was trash under the beds from prior guests. The shower walls were encrusted in mold. The staff was dismissive and nonresponsive, and when the front desk clerk made and error, the senior manager (a) would not rectify it, and (b) thought it appropriate to aggressively reprimand his worker in front of other staff and hotel guests. There is no security in the hotel which was obvious as kids ran the halls and pulled fire alarms during the night. Without exception, this is not a place for families. This hotel is run down not only in appearance, but in the attitudes of the staff. At one point, my family was actually scared and wanting to change hotels. I am a frequent traveler (150 nights a year on the road) and this was by far the worst hotel I've ever seen. Apparently, you do get what you pay for, but I thought a clean room and polite staff were included for $165 a night.

Reviews.Title: “laughable”
Reviews.Author: ashleybrereton
Reviews.Content: I don't even know how they can call this place a Hotel, the pictures on the website look nice, thats because theyve made the front of the hotel look reasonable for pictures. The inside was pretty much a converted prison, our window looked onto other rooms, and there was a lovely pipe coming out of our room which u could see going into a drain. We stayed in a 3 bedroom room, which to be honest was exactly the size of a twin room but with an extra bed squeezed in. the maid service was poor, one of the maids put a "do not disturb" sign on our door so she didnt have to clean our room. It's about 20 mins by tram ride to the city centre, which for the price you will pay is ridiculous. Don't forget to take into account local tax which is an extra 5% for the rooms which they dont tell u about until you are there. not really sure why there is city tax as its based right on the edge of amsterdam. The staff in the hotel bar also try to act stupid and charge u extra for drinks hoping that there is confusion with the new currency. the bathrooms are a disgrace too do not stay at this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Was not bad, they fixed the problem right away!”
Reviews.Author: Michiberlin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the (Annexe) which is old and NOT like the HEM Hotel main Hotel. It was cheaper. I got to the room and the bath stunk like the pipes needed some cleaning or something. I asked them to move me and they did. Other than that I had no problems. I dont know how it would have been IF there were no rooms available. The beds were pretty comfortable and the sheets were clean. Take some flip flops with you for showering because you may not like the showers. I would also lock my Luggage, you never know. I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: littledancer
Reviews.Content: Was a little worried about staying here due to some reviews and as we didn't plan on spending much time at hotel other than to sleep after a busy day of museum visits expected it to be naff, so imagine our surprise to be given such a great spacious triple room at a bargain price of Â£200 for 4 nights!! (booked through Hotels.com) Hotel was very clean, rooms were cleaned daily along with sets of fresh towels, staff were very helpful, good selection of meals/snacks and a great outdoor seating area where you can relax with a glass of wine, smoke or beer. The only thing I would recommend is that when you place a booking insist on staying in the main building and NOT the annexe as so many people seem to have problems with this building and they do seem to put stags/hens etc in here so it's more like a hostel, depends if this is the type of holiday you are after? We travelled as a family so our room was perfect and quiet so great sleep after a busy day, also had fab remote control air conditioning..........perfect! Trams are fantastic and 5 mins walk from hotel, I would defo stay here again. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here unless you like Hostels”
Reviews.Author: SandraB
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I arrived in Amsterdam on Monday Night. Check in was ok. However, I had made reservations and pre-paid the stay (3 days). My reservations were in the ANNEX. This is nothing but a Hostel with an individual bathroom. There were 2 beds, but it was HORRIBLE!! There was mold in the bathrooms; the floor of my room was wet. My daughter did not sleep at all. She said she could hear rats in the walls AND the people next door having sex. We had to pay 20 EURO per room for the next 2 nights. Because it made my daughter sick, she could not enjoy the visit. They then put us on the 4th floor that had a tiny, slow elevator that was rated for 5 people... but I am sure they would sufficate if all 5 were in the Lift. The only thing I can say about the main part of the hotel was that the rooms were larger, the bathrooms were larger, and easier to use. However, the Internet was almost USELESS!! I paid 10 EURO for 24 hours and spent 6 of them trying to just download my mail... Let's say that when I come back to Amsterdam again, I do not plan on staying in this Hotel. In fact, I would suggest that no American stays here. The cost for washing your clothes is out of sght!! 4 Euro for a T-shirt, 3 Euro for a pair of panties, etc!!! Good Luck if you ever stay here. When I read the ratings, I did not think it could be THAT bad, but it was!!! NO, NO, NO to HEM!! Blue Eagle

Reviews.Title: “What's the problem”
Reviews.Author: wysebird
Reviews.Content: I was dreading staying at the hotel after reading the reviews, and found it to be rather nice actually. The room was clean, the bed was clean and really comfortable. The staff were friendly and polite and someone was there over the 24 hours to get you a coffee in the middle of the night. They booked us a taxi, gave information on trams. The food was really nice. There are tatty flats alongside, but you can sit in the hotel grounds and relax; the flats are out of sight. The door to the room was a bit loose, but no one broke in and no one stole from us. The tram is not far and takes you into the centre of Amsterdam. I would definitely stay again. p.s. If you are approached by a taxi driver from the airport, don't take it and find your own, or use the hotel shuttle - got ripped off by one of those but nothing to do with the hotel. Nice place and I recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Hell hotel - the annex "camp" is a shame!”
Reviews.Author: QUALIGUIDES
Reviews.Content: This place is definitely not a 3 star hotel and as a tour guide with a 20 year + experience in the field of tourism, I was personally insulted and ashamed when I saw the rooms our guests were allocated in this hotel! I was there with a group of 10 american guests. We were allocated rooms in the "annex" building. Not only were the rooms dusty, small and smelly, but they were located in some sort of â€œcampâ€� that is typically used to temporarily shelter workers on a construction site (see attached pictures and zoom in for details!) We were then moved to the main building where rooms were much nicer. However the carpets were stained, the bathrooms smelly, some windows were broken and would not open properly, some phones did not work, and the elevator was out of order the day we checked in (4th floor). My room was so smoky that I could not sleep without leaving all windows wide open all night and I had to sleep with a pullover on. There were not even paper place mates on the breakfast tables and absolutely no set up at all. Each individual had to gather his own cup, spoon, paper napkin, and plate. The staff at front desk was friendly and very polite, and seemed quite embarrassed about the situation. However I was told that as an â€œexpediaâ€� customer this is what we could expect, considering the low budget we paid for a hotel room in Amsterdam! I am going to inform colleagues in the business about this and post comments on the internet. All of us in hospitality and tourism business are committed to providing good services and products in respect of customers and this hotel certainly fails in many ways.

Reviews.Title: “My Worst Hotel Experience in Europe”
Reviews.Author: bitterwater
Reviews.Content: I don't think I've ever been more disappointed with a hotel stay in my life. I'm not really picky about hotels and after traveling Europe the past 3 months, I've seen a little bit of everything. The HEM hotel was the most expensive and dirtiest place I've stayed thus far. We reserved a room in the annex building separate from the main hotel and were given the option to upgrade for an extra 20â‚¬. The annex room was similar to a trailer and the cleanliness of the bathroom was questionable. We had no choice but to upgrade. Our upgraded room was better, but when we opened the bathroom door we were faced with a shower that looked like it hadn't been thoroughly cleaned in a very long time. This is the first time I've stayed in a hotel in Europe and been afraid to sit on the toilet. Since we were there for only 1 night, we decided not to take showers and wait to bathe at our next stop. Another first! Other little irritants were: the lamp in our room was broken, the elevator was broken, and there was one community ironing board for each floor. Good thing I gave up ironing when I moved here! One last thing, check out time is 11am and since we thought it was noon we were late and were given 15 min to get out! Way to give us advance notice upon checking in. :)

Reviews.Title: “Good price, but only stay if you are willing to take the tram to town every day”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirrrl
Reviews.Content: I travelled here with a friend from college in June 2006. We stayed several days, we did not pick the location a travel agent did. Upon arrival we were offered a room upgrade for more money. We declined as the room was already paid for, we could not afford that. So we stayed in a smaller motel looking building next to the hotel. When we got to the room we found two small beds and a window that opened and did not lock. I did not feel comfortable with this, so we were given a room on the second floor. I would not have stayed on the first floor. Biggest problem is that this hotel is far from the city center. You must take the tram to town every day. I would honestly reccomend you stay closer to city center. But it is a good price and decent room. If that is enough for you and you dont mind the tram ride evey day, stay at the HEM!

Reviews.Title: “hotel ok annexe dreadful”
Reviews.Author: redsteveb
Reviews.Content: i have just had my stag do in amsterdam and got stuck in this hotel by a dodgy/underhand stag party specialist. this hotel is a long way out of the centre of amsterdam in a residential area. the hotel room we stayed in was spacious and comfortable. the rooms in the annexe are tiny and the bathrooms (if you can call them that) are dreadful. you can't sit on the toilet forwards only sideways. i had a problem regarding my wallet, it went missing from buying a drink in reception early in the morning to getting up in the morning. the guys on reception were very unhelpful. made me think they knew more than they were letting on (lost over Â£200). they gave me a map and said i had to get a tram to a station off the map and just sort of go to the right some distance to find the nearest police station. real helpful. a couple of the rooms in the annexe had the doors kicked open on the first night but fortunately had nothing of value in there. the cost of taxi's to and from dam square ranged from 10 euro's to about 30 euro's and the tram takes about 20 minutes. if i had a choice i wouldn't stay at this hotel, and wouldn't recommend it to anyone who wanted a hotel in the centre of amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Ruined our holiday”
Reviews.Author: cliffounitedkingdom
Reviews.Content: we were disgusted by the room that we had paid for, it was tiny, the smell was horrendous,the window didnt open, the light was not even that, we didnt get bath towels, the excuse of a matress is not even worth mentioning, i would not even expect my dog to sleep in that bedding and stench. we were told the upgrade would cost Â£25 per night when we confirmed the upgrade they would only accept an extra Â£75 per night on top of what we originally paid. The receptionists were very rude and not at all helpfull. the food and bev service was exceptionally slow. and too expensive. we decided to cut our trip short and were not refunded on the payments we made for the room. when infact it does say on the website if you cancel 24hours before you will be refunded, NOT TRUE.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel for good price”
Reviews.Author: MariaVK
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for six nights in the middle of March this year. I really liked it. The price is reasonable, solid breakfast, good location (each time travelling by tram you see lots of dear tiny houses, as well as the main sights) .

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: sjrobertson
Reviews.Content: We were not expecting much on arrival, due to the hotel being so cheap, but we were pleasantly surprised! Big spacious rooms that were nice with a modern feel to it. Big TV, ensuite shower. We didn't realise that Breakfast was included in our deal, which was a buffet in the morning containing scrambled and boiled eggs, beans and bacon, cereals, toast, selection of cheeses and rolls as well as tea, coffee and orange juice. The tram Westenberg or something like that is the nearest stop about 3-5 mins walk from the hotel, be careful of the area it was a little council estate like, not so bad, but be street wise. Tram takes about 20 mins to get into Centraal Station.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: Seductive
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for Valentines and it was perfect for it. Well I would just like to say I dont know what people are complaining about because according to me this hotel its just right for a 3*. This is a really nice hotel, staff were friendly, great service, the breakfast was lovely!!! Clean towels every day, room was a good size aswell, the only little problem was with the room, it had a faint black stain on the bathroom floor, but i didnt let that ruin my holiday!!!! Its just a short walk from 2 tram stops and a short walk from a metro station. It takes about 15 mins total to get to Centraal station by tram, but you do not realise the time as theres so much to see when going through the city. My partner and I got a 96 hour ticket each that was valid for the Metro/Tram/Train, they were 18 euros each which is a bargain! At the end of the holiday we thought we didnt want to carry our bags around Amsterdam so they held them in a secure luggage room and when we needed to get back to the airport we ordered a taxi which is a fixed rate of 23 euros, which isnt too bad, and took us straight to the correct check in departure area. Overall this hotel is brilliant, and Amsterdam is the best ever!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: kaznjue
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and found everything to be more than acceptable for the cheap price. The staff were friendly, the room clean and the breakfast more than adequate. Would not recommend to non smokers (although that is to change in July) or to anyone wanting to stay out after midnight as you might as well pay .the extra to be central as pay for taxis. All in all excellent value for money. Amsterdam itself is another matter a total rip off and wont be returning in a hurry.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs, theft and smelly rooms”
Reviews.Author: Kinselladk
Reviews.Content: We travelled as a group of 28 people and several of us experienced bed bugs, rooms that smelled badly of smoke, hairballs in the towels and no willingness to change the conditions. It was not possible to get non- smoking room for all as we had requested. From the locked bagage storage money were stolen. We had to eat the hotels as we also had meetings there. The food was expensive and tasteless, the vegetables were defrosted before being served. Some rooms faced an indoor court yard with the only air coming from an AC. The hotel is not centrally located, so in the evening you should take a cab as the neighborhood is not the best.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect setting for a horror movie”
Reviews.Author: AlexxR
Reviews.Content: School let out in Munich so I thought Iâ€™d pop over Amsterdam for a few days. The HEM was advertised as a cheap three star hotel, which would have been perfect if I didnâ€™t have to spend so much on taxis to bring me home every night. At 23EU from the city center, it really starts to hurt after three nights. Especially for my friend who spent 35EU, since taxis in Amsterdam aren't regulated and it's easy for first-timers to get duped. To echo the other reviews, the location is a problem. If you want to check out the nightlife in the city Iâ€™m pretty sure youâ€™ll get back late in the evening. Getting off the tram and facing the 5-10 minute walk of dark, sketchy isolation caused by the surrounding construction didnâ€™t really strike me as a good idea, especially since it made an excellent opening scene for a zombie movie. So for the most part I took a taxi at night and the tram in the morning. The money I spent on taxis wouldâ€™ve been better spent at a better hotel closer to the city center. The staff was nice. I wouldnâ€™t call them friendly, but they were informative and very straightforward. You have the option of an all-you-can-eat breakfast for 9,50EU (normally 14,50), which is kind of a scam if you donâ€™t eat a lot; if you get up too early to venture out into the city, you might feel forced to succumb. If I were you, buy groceries in the city and eat them in the morning, but if you eat a lot the food is great. The lift only works for two floors (the top and bottom), which wouldnâ€™t have been a problem if I didnâ€™t feel like the cable was going to snap any second. The second time I used the stairs, which wouldnâ€™t have been a problem if I didnâ€™t feel like the steps were going to fall through. My room was clean and decent, though I donâ€™t really understand what the architect had in mind. I could only see the top half of my face in the bathroom mirror but everything else seemed to be all right. Would recommend to people who are searching for a hotel... indoors. For those with slightly higher standards, look for a better hotel in the center of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “dreadful, awful hotel”
Reviews.Author: bertieahern
Reviews.Content: Stay away from this hotel it is awful, dreadful, and unsafe. It is in a rundown area of tower blocks on one side and a motorway on the other, but this is the least of its problems. After we left we discovered they overcharged us without our consent and we are unable to get our money back -so far. One of the staff was in our room for an hour using the pay tv while we were out - they insisted we pay for this until we found a receipt with the time on it to prove it was a staff member!!! The male receptionist was aggressive angry and frankly intimidating. We were woken twice at 5 and 6am by drunken guests in the corridors. The room carpet was filthy with dried bits of what we hope was just food in a number of areas. Do yourself a favour, do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel I have ever been staying during my trips in the 15 years”
Reviews.Author: David_Latterman
Reviews.Content: I can not belive the Hotel with this kind of service can survive in Europe . No clean tower changed after room clean finished . Order a Pizza and sandwich in the only Bar of the hotel, you need to wait for an hour to get the meal. And you can not find anything to eat outside near the hotel. Every thing of service need to be charged.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: flanners
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel having read the basics, what a terrible mistake. The so called cafeteria is like a static "hot dog" stand, the cosy bar is likesomething from a Charles Dickens scene and the rooms are clean but belong in an operating theatre they are so clinical. Upon arrival we had to walk through a council estate, seedy to say the least, plus it is a long way out from Amsterdam Centre. The cafeteria left a lot to be desired, dirty, little variety and really sun standard. Reception is hidden behind a lift shaft, the lift has no window, is old, claustrophobic, dirty and absolutely tiny. We were met by a load of scruffy youths sitting around in their jackets (it was so cold in the hotel) puffing on cigarettes in the smokey filthy atmosphere that was reception. It really was like a holding centre for asylum seekers, that is the best way to describe it. It was not cheap either, over a hundred euros for a double for one night, outrageous. Looking into the bar behind reception we seen more youths hanging around the smoke filled area looking quite menacing, all vying for position on the bald felted pool table, that really says it all about this hovel. We complained but it feel on deaf ears, needless to say no rebate was offered. We left and went straight back into Amsterdam central and got a really nice 4 star hotel, and it only cost 20 euros more than this place. The hotel is substandard, the area is very sleezy, do yourself a real favour, pass on this one, no matter what the rate.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've ever had in 10 countries of traveling”
Reviews.Author: chinaHawaii
Reviews.Content: Keep looking, you can do way better than this!!! First of all, it's way out of the city center so it takes forever to get there. That didn't bother me too much as it gave us a chance to see more of Amsterdam. When we booked our room we were assured we would have a free breakfast and a hair dryer in our room. Neither of these were honored, even after I showed the rude desk clerk the written proof. They put us in the "Annex", which I called MOLD HELL because there was mold all over the walls and in the shower. I refused to take a shower at all-the shower also had no shower curtain when we checked in. There were cigarette burns on the curtains and no locks on the windows, so we were afraid to leave our stuff in our room. Also, there are no decent restaurants in the neighborhood at night that were open, so we had no dinner one night. The only good thing about it is that is was quiet and they have a nice outdoor drinking area. This is by far the worst hotel I've ever stayed at in 10 countries of traveling and I really don't expect that much. All I ask for is a safe and clean room-we requested a different room with no results. VERY DISAPPOINTING-Luckily, I loved Amsterdam so much it didn't ruin our impression of this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Wicked! Perfect! Cool!”
Reviews.Author: sorcererofangels
Reviews.Content: Many things have been said about The Hem and we were a bit dubious before we arrived. Our fears were quickly put to rest. The room was modern, comfortable and clean and everything was in working order. The food was good, The staff really helpful and the city center was just a quick tram ride or half hour walk away. The Dutch are amazing People and the hotel was great! Thank you Hem!

Reviews.Title: “faulty towers!!”
Reviews.Author: fifipalm
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 3 nights.We booked a triple room and found when we got there we only had 2 beds.This was solved pretty quick but it was very small for a triple.There was no facillities like you would expect from a hotel ie. hairdryer, kettle and we had no internet as advertised also it cost an additional 10 euros for a plug adaptor.Rooms are kept clean but are very basic nice decor though.You can get food untill 11pm which is very well priced and very good value.There was a mess up at reception when ordering are bus back to the airport staff wrte down wrong time and the chap we spoke to , to sort out the problem was very rude and unhelpfull.A problem for a few staff here they are very rude and hostile.Tip-do not help yourself to drinks from fridge as stated or you are at risk of getting your fingers slammed in it from a rude female member of staff.overall not bad but not recommended for easily offended people or those who wish to dry their hair !!

Reviews.Title: “too far out”
Reviews.Author: betshean
Reviews.Content: although the room (twin single) was excellent , i would have expected a kettle, with tea/coffee provided in the room considering it was i think a 3 star hotel. The location was not good as it was about 15 minutes away by tram to city centre, so not good if theres only you as it costs at least 20euros by cab, and not a very safe looking location at night, as its surrounded by what lookes like estates. was happy with the fact that they cooked my friend and i a pizza after 10pm at night when we got there though.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel , stayed in the annexe”
Reviews.Author: SnoopyFan53
Reviews.Content: My friend and I have just come back from a weekend in the Hem hotel Ansterdam. We stayed in the annexe which is cheaper than the main hotel, It was absolutely fine, clean, basic, and a good base to see Amsterdam. Some people were complaining about the annexe but I dont know what they expected for the price! The rooms are very small, with the smallest bathroom I have ever seen, but we had booked a room each so it wasnt a problem, I think it would have been more problematic if we had shared. The breakfast was excellent, we werent expecting much so we were very happy with that. Our only problem with the room/hotel was that there was an unpleasant smell coming from the toilets in the en-suite bathrooms, it was probably the drains. But with the lid down and the door shut it didnt make the room smell. The hotel is a little way out from the centre but the number 2 tram is very close by and runs regularly. We never waited more than 5 minutes or so, and the journey into town takes 10-15 mins and costs 2.40 for a single ticket. I would recommend buying a day/ weekend pass, or a strip ticket, to save money. The taxi from the airport cost us 40 euros which we felt was far too high but we had no choice as we arrived too late at night for the Connexxion hotel shuttle bus which does stop at the Hem. However, returning to the airport we booked a taxi via the hotel reception, they have a deal with a local taxi firm at 23 euros fixed price, and it was mercedes and a very helpful and polite driver. I dont know if they can also arrange pick up from the airport but it would be worth finding out. Overall, if you want a cheap base for going out and exploring the city, this hotel, or the annexe, is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: SDias
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam is a lovely place but can be quite expensive. My sister and I found this hotel at â‚¬60/night for the two of us which is cheaper than most places. It was clean, the sheets were good quality and on our last night we got upgraded to the penthouse, with a roof top terrace! It isn't close to the city centre but we enjoyed the walk and explored the neighbourhood. There was a very good deli nearby and we stopped to have lunch at a local restaurant which was cheaper than some places in the city centre and had great character. Taking the tram was only 10mins.

Reviews.Title: “Large Rooms”
Reviews.Author: arunmathew12345
Reviews.Content: 12 Sept 2007 Large Room with heating, good daily house keeping, excellent staff, good restaurant. Toilet needs some modernisation, very dim lights in the room. Taxi from Amsterdam Central Station is nearly 25 euros. Tram No 2 takes you to Westlandgracht stop. A 5 min walk from this stop to the hotel. Tram pass (valid for 24 hours on trams and buses) costs 6.50 Euros, would be a good idea to get one. Cycles could be hired, I wouldve hired one if it was fitted with a motor. Residents prefer bicycle and there are more than a million cycles there. Tram 2 serves between Amsterdam Central Station to Neiu Sloten. Starting from Westlandgracht (stop nearest to HEM), it stops at Rijks Museum, Leidseplein (very good entertainment spot, nt to be missed), Koningsplein (flower market), Dam Square (Amsterdam Redlight). On the overall this is a good hotel if you prefer to use public transport (tram), else go for something in Leidseplein or nearer to the station.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Public Transport”
Reviews.Author: OutwardBound505
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on the outskirts of the ring, but was only a 5 minute walk to a tram station and then about a 15 minute ride to the city center. It was definitely worth it for the great deal and really wasn't a hassle at all. It was actually nice to be in the midst of the action and then take a short tram ride into the quiet little area the hotel was in. The rooms were big and decorated well (down comforters, TV, A/C). The area felt safe at pretty much all hours and I would definitely stay again. There's a lobby bar and place to get some food, but they close pretty early. If you like late night food/drinks, I would pick something up before heading back to the hotel. There's some great munchy food that a lot of the late night vendors would warm up and package in tinfoil for our commute back. I booked this hotel on Easytobook.com. I've also had a lot of good luck with European hotel deals on Bookings.com.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fluffy1976
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little out of the way but it is about a 5 minute walk from Westlandgracht tram stop so not too bad. The hotel itself was busy but surprisingly quiet considering I was there on a warm august weekend. The rooms are clean and tidy, the bathrooms small but clean and functional. The staff are friendly and will answer any question that you have. Area the hotel is in doesn't seem that great but nobody bothered with us during our stay. I would fully recommend this hotel to anyone who is after a clean, basic hotel as a base to explore Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonWiseOwl
Reviews.Content: I booked this Hotel for my Hen weekend and looking at the reviews my heart sank! However I decided to go anyway and I bought sheets with me just and cleaning fluids just in case it was really bad. When i got to the hotel i was very impressed the reception looked very clean and the staff were very friendly. I received the keys to my room after admiring the glass lift and I could not believe how nice the room was! 3 - 4 star quality by English standards! We stayed on the 3rd floor and everying was clean. Bedding was changed daily and despite paying 'peanuts' (not a lot) we also had breakfast included. Every morning we could eat as much as we like - And we did. It just goes to show you cant believe everything you read AND everyones experience is different!

Reviews.Title: “HEM was quiet and convenient”
Reviews.Author: jenny002
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at HEM Hotel for a week. I was a little afraid after reading other reviews but I had very good service and a pleasant stay. It is a five minute tram ride from the city center. Once you figure out where the tram is and that you must take the number 2 tram to the city center, the HEM hotel is extremely convenient. The Tram route number two can take you to the city center with all the museums and all the way up to Central station. It is actually in a residential area so it is quiet at night and it is nice retreat from the all day buzz of the tourist crazy center. There are several interesting tv channels and internet. You can eat late at night. In the morning I walked to neighboring grocery stores and paid local prices instead of the inflated prices for tourists int he city center. There are bakeries, food and clothing stores a block away. The hotel room was very clean and the closest American equivalent is the Red Roof Inn, not fancy but is was clean and comfortable. The room had some ammenities like free shampoo and a hair dryer. Typical of European hotels there is no iron provided.

Reviews.Title: “Fawlty Towers Nearly killed my wife”
Reviews.Author: quinnhoggo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night with my wife and two young children as it was twenty minutes from the airport and we were flying home the next day to Ireland. I booked it online and was just looking for something cheap for one night so 79 euro suited. My first impressions of the area were not good, the hotel was situated in a ghetto area surrounded by high rise flats and some undesirable locals as we found on a trip to the nearest shops. The man at reception who checked us in was friendly and wished us a pleasant stay. The room was basic as expected with 3 star hotel, within minutes of entering the room the children hopped upon the beds and my wife decided to open the window to let some air in, what she wasn't expecting was the complete window panel 6ft by 4ft to come crashing in on top of her, luckily whatever way it landed she avoided serious injury and thankfully the children had been sitting on the beds at the time as the 2 year old would most certainly have been seriously injured. I lifted the complete window frame off her then went to reception to complain, they apologised and moved us to the room next door but didn't seem to appreciate how serious the incident was. We were just glad to get our heads down after a lot of travelling. The next morning we found that the hot water wasn't working in the shower which was disappointing, however the real surprise came after checking out whilst awaiting the shuttle bus to the airport. We were standing in the lobby and were approached by a man who informed us he was the Duty or General manager of the hotel. I was expecting him to state he was going to offer a full refund after our near death experience, but instead he started to accuse us of breaking the window, my wife became very upset at this and had to walk away, but he kept insisting that nothing like this had ever happened in the hotel and we must be at fault, I explained he was very lucky that no-one was killed as result of this faulty window and that we hardly even complained about the matter. He still insisted on laying the blame with us and I had to walk away myself as I could not believe his ignorance. I will never stay at this hotel again and would not recommend it to anyone even for one night!!! NQuinn (N Ireland)

Reviews.Title: “Potential for Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: DCanada
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the HEM for one night with my girlfriend on a transfer flight from Amsterdam. My initial impressions were that the place was somewhat dodgy. We were in the main building, not the annex, but it wasn't very nice. Furnishings in the lobby and hallways were worn and drab, and nothing seemed as though it had been thoroughly cleaned. The staff were not very forthcoming with details during check-in and they required an inordinate amount of personal information to register, which I did not feel entirely comfortable providing. You pay upfront for your stay, but I was checking my credit statement online for days afterwards to make sure that I hadn't been hit with any unexpected charges -- I guess that best describes what kind of place I thought it to be. To be fair, there were none. The room itself left a similar impression. The overhead light didn't work, and though the bathroom wasn't filthy there was some hair and dust to indicate that it hadn't been cleaned well. The furnishings and carpet were similar to the lobby, and the bed coverings were somewhat worn and unappealing. The actual bed was two single mattresses pushed together, which is fairly common in lower-end European hotels but the room had been advertised as a double. As to location and security; the hotel is not as short a journey from the center as it portends on its website, though the tram is just a 5 minute walk from the front door. It took about 20 minutes to get to the center, and the trams run frequently enough that it isn't a huge inconvenience. The neighborhood you must go through to get from the tram stop to the hotel isn't the nicest though; we were accosted rather aggressively for money by a disheveled-looking local while returning from drinks at the end of the night. Inside, the hotel requires that you leave your key at the desk when leaving, which might have caused some consternation if we had any valuables with us. As others have mentioned, the door locks are flimsy as well, and there are no safes or secure areas to store items while gone. In summary, the hotel was not to the standard that I expected, though it probably reflects the price more realistically than I had hoped. It wasn't a bad place to crash for an inexpensive night between flights, but it's also definitely not the 3 star hotel it is portrayed as on the internet, and it's not a place I'd stay at if I were to return for a longer visit.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good..”
Reviews.Author: europeanvistor
Reviews.Content: The portacabin accommodation was very disappointing and overheated. It was noisey and far out of town - although the tram service was quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Hem - not as bad as some reviews said”
Reviews.Author: karagor
Reviews.Content: On arriving at the Hem, yes it is a bit far out of the city, but tram no2 is just around the corner, the hotel looked a bit run down, but the gardens was just having a makeover, (some new plants put in), the hotel staff was very friendly and as we were early and the room wasnt ready, we were shown where the bar was and had a couple of drinks, we were given our key to our room 1/2 hour early and was overjoyed to see the room was clean tidy, didnt smell and looked overall pleasing as did most of the hotel, the annex looked a bit rough, but we were in the main hotel, the breakfast as most reviews say was great and plentiful. we found all the staff very helpful and pleasant and would definately stop there again. Very good value for money, - pay the extra and have the breakfast!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Trev and Wendys Adventure at the Hem”
Reviews.Author: trevorwendy
Reviews.Content: After seeing the bad reviews we were very scared but when we arrived we were greated by a very good looking obese receptionist who was very friendly. We were in the cheapy rooms in the portakabin oppisite. The room was very warm and the beds were very comnfortable which took our minds of the stains on the walls and the bad paint jobs. The shower did look like a tap but was ok once you had got over your 3rd degree burns. The gardens in the grounds were lovely just liek the ground force team had been in. The surrounding area was lovely with high quality luxury apartments all around we felt like we were back at home on our luxury Manchester ouncil estate. The only negative to our stay was the toilet it looked like it bleonged in a hospital

Reviews.Title: “Downs... then gradual ups”
Reviews.Author: DreDog187
Reviews.Content: Ok! We got of the plane and got a taxi from a service provided by the Schipol airport. Hotel was quite a distance from the airport... charged 38 euro! (only on the return journey back to the airport did we find out we had been robbed)... do not pay more that 25 euro! We arrived at the hotel at 1:15pm and check in was not until after 2pm! The guy behind the desk told us that we could either leave our bags behind the desk and check in later or pay 20 euro to get a room immediately... I paid the money reluctantly. Got to the room and didnt really like what I saw. It was this dim room with a window that did not open with a view of what can only be described as a prison outside... first impressions were terrible to say the least. We were excited to get into the city to partake in the activities that are only available in a place like amsterdam. So, we left are bags in the room and bailed. When we got back we discovered that the room we were given was not a smoking room as requested... we really required a night cap... That wasnt the only difficulty we faced. We were both tired and wanted to sleep and there was what sounded like a party going on around us! I was pi*sed... so I went to reception and rather bluntly requested a new, smoking room with a functioning window, as I literally could not breathe with the heat in the original room. This is were the HEM Hotel came through for us and gave us this really nice room on the 2nd floor, that was quiet and looked like the rooms photographed on their site... it had proper ventilation and was smoking... so i got my night cap! We ate toasties from the bar (very good!) and we came to the joint decision that we were not shelling out 12 euro for TV! It was a staggering 2.50 euro for a drink from the machine... nearly whited! Overall... kinda far out of the city... You get what you pay for... its cheap but if you dont master the tram system, taxi's will definitely make up the difference in price with say a 4 star hotel in Dam square! My only advice is consider paying that lil bit more for a hotel closer to everything... thats what I'll be doing on my next visit to possibly one of my fabourite cities on earth!

Reviews.Title: “Recommend to others”
Reviews.Author: BARUSHKA
Reviews.Content: We have read all these reviewes and we were little bit nervous. We booked "standard room" that was very nice and clean. Daily cleaning included. As was said before check the prices on diff websites. We had some difficulties to find this hotel... so for another visiters-go by tram to station "Delflandlaan" from that point should be easy to get to hotel. Connection (tram no.2) takes about 20minutes to reach the center. We would go there again. We were surprised for charging the internet connections and some pay-TV channels...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - a little too far from centre though”
Reviews.Author: WestMidTravellers
Reviews.Content: First impressions of hotel were 'oh my god' due to location but wasn't as bad as first thought. Hotel staff really friendly and helpful, room spacious (although view from our window was a little like prison landings!). Glass walled shower different from what we're used to - no secrets in there!! No tea or coffee facilities in room which was a bit of a let down (I thought that was standard wherever you went). A little too far from centre, although trams run regularly and are fairly cheap and easy to work out. For a cheap stay - great, although next time we would stay closer to the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Please read!! It's a nice place.”
Reviews.Author: Dez_999
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 2 night stay in the HEM Hotel Amsterdam. Reading through previous reviews before our trip made me quite nervous as there was a rather large group of us booked in! However on arrival we were pleasantly surprised. There are 2 separate parts of the hotel, the main complex & the 'annex'. From what we experienced, the couples and families are placed in the main complex, and the single sex groups, rooms being shared and single occupancies in the 'annex'. The reception and bar/restaurant area were modern and nicely decorated. The prices at the bar however were rather high (5 Euros per pint = approx Â£3.50!). Our room was clean, tidy and nicely decorated. I'm led to believe from others on our trip that the annex is not so nice so make sure you specify when you book where you want to stay. it's true what people are saying about differing prices depending on where you book.. we booked our room via BMIbaby together with our flight, in total it cost Â£80 each including our return flights & 2 nights B&B. However others on our trip were paying Â£40+ per night without breakfast! (which is, by the way, very nice and unlimited! :-D) As for the tram ride and distance from town, not a problem at all! The tram stop is maximum of 3 or 4 minutes away from the hotel (turn left out of reception, left at the gate, left at the fire station and at the end of that road just to the right is the tram stop) and the tram ride is very pleasant. Approx 10-15minutes ride to 'Liedseplein' which is the busiest area for resaurants and bars and another 5-10mins to Dam Square, the Red Light District & Central Station. It is possible to purchase a 24 hour unlimited tram ticket for just under 7 Euros from reception at the hotel... yes the trams do stop at midnight but are replaced by buses throughout the night (which is included on your ticket).
