Overall we didn't have any problems with the hotel and would not hesitate booking there again if we returned to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “dont bother”
Reviews.Author: lollib
Reviews.Content: we booked this through a website which had 3 diff listings under the Hem but didnt explain the diff, all descriptions were the same, turns out though 2 of the were in a portacabin affair, which smells bad and looks worse!! we complained at reception but were told as the booking confirmed we were in the Annex we would have to pay for an upgrade....which we did. the upgraded room had 2 single beds pushed together and 2 single duvets!! not what you would expect from a double for a romantic weekend! with a stain on the sheets!!! apart from that reception staff were friendly enough but if you want to explore yet be able to back to hotel to get changed to go out for dinner...its way too far our 20-25 mins on the trams!!! if you are looking at this hotel i wouldnt bother!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ok - Wouldnt go there again though !!”
Reviews.Author: shelbel
Reviews.Content: We booked the flight and hotel through via the internet. All I can say is be careful when doing so!!! We booked Hem Economical and our friends booked Hem Annex. If you book rooms via these 2 titles, you will be sure to be staying in a seperate block to the hotel which has had several bad comments. Both us and our friends changed rooms but had to pay an extra 15euros a night to stay in decent accomodation (classed as Hem Hotel), luckily our friends spared us the experience by telling us the original room was disgusting, so we changed, paid the extra and went to a nice room straight away!!! Breakfast is ok, bacon looks painfully thin anaemic and crinkled and the baked beans sauce taste's like bolognaise (not want you want first thing in the morning). The rest of food is adequate !! Only drank in hotel bar once as too expensive. 3 large beers and Vodka & coke 20 euro's ouch !!!! Went round to Lidl's (shopping complex round the corner from hotel) and bought a few alchohol supplies and left in room for late night drinks after catching last tram back to hotel. From central station to Westerlandgracht stop, it takes roughly 20 minutes, then a further 10 min walk to hotel from tram stop. Hi-lights of our city break were having an argentine steak at one of the rancho's restuarants - very nice and visiting the ice bar where you can experience the Xtracold Ice Bar at a cost of 15euros to be in a room at temp -8c for 30-45 mins. An experience to say the least. We also went on a canal cruise which was good. It worked out better for us to purchase a 72 hour tram ticket rather than the amsterdam card as we only went in 1 museum which was the Van Gough, and personally after spending an hour and half in that one, i didnt particluarly want to go to another - sorry to museum lovers, not my cup of tea! We would go to Amsterdam again, but to stay alot closer to the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable place to lay your head”
Reviews.Author: jynsbn
Reviews.Content: This hotel offered very different rates on different websites. Make sure you shop around for the best price. We picked this hotel for the rate. A lot of the other reviews are critical so we had low expectations. I would equate the hotel to a Motel 6 or Red Roof Inn. The rooms were clean, but everything else was in poor condition. All room furnishings were about what you would expect at a cheap roadside motel, but that is what we paid for. Breakfast was not very good and had a â€œhostelâ€� feel and smell. The overall service was okay, not great, but okay. Everyone spoke enough English to get by. They do not have laundry machines, which we thought they had after looking at their website that specified both â€œvalet/dry cleaningâ€� and â€œlaundry facilities/servicesâ€�. There was no safe in the room and they did not have any safes that could fit laptops and in a sparse room it was hard to hide our valuables. The door had a very simple and weak lock. They asked that you leave your key at the desk when out, which only made us feel more insecure. We did not have any problems, though. Make sure that you book a â€œStandardâ€� room as across from the main entrance there was something that resembled two mobile homes stacked on top of each other â€“ this must be the small/bad rooms people wrote about. The hotel says that all of their rooms are renovated, but they really just spent $20 on some accent fabrics and pillows. The bed was firm, which I liked, but my fiancÃ© did not Very little English TV programming. We paid an extra 12.5 Euros (US$17) per day for a pay channel package that offered occasional English TV and two frozen porn channels. A WiFi signal was available for 10 Euros (US$13) per day, but was so slow and weak that I could not check my email. The hotel service directory said that they did not allow drugs in the hotel, but our hallway smelled of pot all of the time. Remember, soft drugs (pot, hash & mushrooms) are tolerated, but not technically legal! They really are a 5 minute walk from a tram/street car stop that made getting to the good stuff really easy (about a 10 minute street car ride). The street cars had a conductor (besides the driver) to sell you tickets and accepted bills as large as 50 Euros that made things really easy. The closest stop to the hotel was â€œ2 zonesâ€� or 2.40 Euros per trip. Your ticket is valid on all public transportation lines for an hour. The hotel was about a 15 minute drive from the airport (driving really fast) and cost us about 30 Euros. When we returned to the airport, the hotel arranged a cab for us that was only 25 Euros and the driver gave us a full receipt that included his name; very professional. Overall the hotel was what we paid for and not as bad as some of the reviews stated. We will probably stay in a nicer hotel in the future should the greenback ever regain its strength.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: Watachan
Reviews.Content: Don't even think about using this hotel. I got a room in the prefab just accross the hotel main building and the room was dirty and terribly stinky. The staff was nice enough to give me another, but still, the bathroom was so small that It was impossible to seat. The shower, if you can call it a shower, was dirty, clogged and was just an immitation of a shower head in a hose pipe. Amsterdam is an amazing place, but after a day in the city center, I'm sure you will need a good hotel room to recharge your energy for the next day. At least a decent shower...

Reviews.Title: “The best anyone could expect”
Reviews.Author: ramunele
Reviews.Content: We visited Amsterdam just for a weekend and were looking for a simple and cheep hotel for the overnight with a simple location - not to get lost. Hem Inn made our visit overwhelming, really!!! We've heard about some cheep hotels in the city and new, what we could expect, but it was really the best surprise - when we got to our room, we even wondered, if there was no mistake that we were accomodated in such a nice room. Then the breakfast... We were full of it for the whole day :) The location - very simple: a bit out of those noisy streets, you need only one tram (No2) for the day and one bus for a night time; then it's on the half way to the Riksmuseum and Van Gog Museum - this way you get there first in the morning and do not need to say in long lines to get in. I'll certainly stay there the next time and would recommend it for everyone, whose looking for nice budget class hotel and pleasent memorries for a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “A truly dire hotel”
Reviews.Author: R1chard
Reviews.Content: The staff were pleasant enough but the hotel is drab, overpriced and frankly appalling value for money. I was given a room on the fourth floor. The view from the window was a wall although I could just see the adjacent motorway if I craned my neck. The light switch and a power point were broken and there seemed to be badly concealed cables all over the place. The bathorrom, however, was fine and completely out of keeping with the room. The lift was broken and only went to the fouth floor (lucky me) with the other floor's buttons being blanked out with black gaffer tape. The inside of the lift had obscene graffitti on the walls. The carpet as you left the lift was badly stained - presumably some mishap with the coke vending machine. The hotel asks you to leave your key at reception when you go out but if you happen to come back when there's two or three people checking in then you can be waiting 5 minutes or so to retrieve your key as the staff won't interupt what they're doing just so you can have the convenience of going back to your room. I didn't risk eating in the hotels "brasserie" - it looked too uninviting - and neither was I prepared to stump up 12 euros for breakfast. They also charge 10 euros a day to park you car which is frankly outrageous. There's very little activity in the area - a small shopping centre which has only two restaurants, one Chinese and one French (at least it had a French name). Both are excellent especially the French one but there's just no other choice within walking distance. If you decide to stay at this hotel then don't say I didn't warn you.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect way to experience Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Michael&Miko
Reviews.Content: If you get a renovated room, this place fits all your needs. We stayed for 2 nights at HEM Hotel in April 2006 and enjoyed the experience thoroughly. The hotel is a 20 minute Tram ride into the downtown core but the Tram stop is a 2 minute walk from the hotel. This was my second time in Amsterdam and I found that the Tram ride and seeing more than the tourist core of Amsterdam was definitely a unique experience. Our room was newly renovated with modern amenities, renovated bathroom and large windows that opened. This hotel is easily accessible from the airport and is located in a somewhat residential area which is a nice walk and is close to a grocery store. The hotel staff was not very friendly and the hotel bar/lobby was nothing special. This is a simple hotel but does not deserve the criticism that it has received on tripadvisor. This was the first hotel of over 40 hotels I have stayed in on my six months of traveling around the world, and it is definitely a pleasant place to rest. With that said, I would not pay more that 65 Euros for this place. Michael - Toronto, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Simply the worst!”
Reviews.Author: eggestad
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have stayed at - at least for the last 12-15 years. I will never ever stay here again. I would discourage anyone who is remotely thinking of staying there. Nothing was what you would anticipate in a hotel advertising as 3 star. If they have 1 (one) star, I think that is also pushing it! Safety, cleanliness...anything. And value for money? Heck no! I paid EUR 150 per night (during a convention time, but still). I would say that at EUR 10 it is an acceptable deal. I would rather rent a car and sleep in it than staying here ever again!

Reviews.Title: “Make the Most of It...”
Reviews.Author: jg325
Reviews.Content: Didn't really know what to expect because I had read differing reviews, but I was pretty satisfied with the hotel. First of all, how the hotel looks or how the bar was really didn't matter to me because you're supposed to spend your time.....in Amsterdam. The rooms themselves were nothing special, just regular and I don't remember having any problems with the beds or bathrooms. One ghetto thing about the htel was that you had to go pay for a key for the TV....kind of a bummer. But the best reason to stay in the hotel is definitely the location. If there's one thing I would suggest, it would be WALK AMSTERDAM!!! The hotel itself is near the city center..."forcing" you to walk the city.....which is beautiful!!! I was there in early March and there was fresh snow on the ground. Even in the cold, it was surely my most worthwhile time in my trip to Europe (over Paris and Luxembourg). The hotel is really close to Tram 2 (one of the trams that goes everywhere, including Centraal Station) if you decide not to walk back. So, I would say that this is an average hotel. Really cheap...so it's not going to be the best thing ever....but the location bumps the overall experience up, for me.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid...”
Reviews.Author: Buzz_7
Reviews.Content: Hem Hotel is dire. Stayed as part of group of 10 and got put in the pre-fab rooms across the yard from the Hotel; *Hotwater failed twice *Windows did not open *Bathroom tiny, not possible to sit on loo *Fittings and furnishings very worn and bad condition *Facilities very limited

Reviews.Title: “hem hotel”
Reviews.Author: dizzy021
Reviews.Content: Well staff were quit e welcoming and room was clean.But after along happy day spent touring we decided to have a drink in hotel bar. There was only five of us in the bar , within twenty or so mins my handbag had been taken.Told to go to main desk and then taxi to police station parhaps not such a good idea should have search bar area longer but was in shock.Do you know how really annoying it is to try phone numbers-fill in forms with out my reading glasses which were in my bag. Ruined my stay as I keep looking for the 'ONE` with my bag and girlie bits.One Thing I do Know is no one really cared that it was stolen so don't leave anything you value from yoursight

Reviews.Title: “HEM Hotel 3* More like one and a half”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my Cousin stayed at This hotel for a conference in amsterdam Well first impressions were what a DUMP we read that this was 3* it was no better than a youth Hostel Reminds me of a dormatary in a School. The Service was awful had to wait four hours for our room to be ready and as we were tired from travelling we didnt feel like wondering around amsterdam till it was ready so we waited in the lobby purchasing 24 hour internet access @ 10 euros not bad i suppose THE ROOM well wouldnt call it a room 1 would call it a Rabbit Hutch it was so small and the single beds lmao they were tiny and im not a big fella the Tv well forget that no programmes on it at all in english or subtitled The Bathroom(where's the Bath) It was so small and was just a shower ,toilet(which was filthy)and a sink When we took a shower it flooded the floor BUT the shower was Powerful nearly took my cousins skin off the first time he used it there were no toiletries supplied (soap,shampoo)glad we took our own. Security TAKE ANYTHING VALUBLE WITH YOU (this is the best advice i can give you) its an old Hotel and people can see if your out just by looking to see if your key is behind the reception desk we took some pictures of the veiw from our room we thought we had to throw the beds out when we finished with the room take a look. The Bar The bar is ok the BARMAN WAS REALY NICE the pool table had seen better days and the electronic dartboard was on the blink. The area surrounding the hotel was well a little run down with loads of demolition work going on. There is a parade of shops with a couple of restraunts(we didnt try them overpriced)the Shopkeeper in the newsagents was helpful and polite and there was a Lidl supermarket there lol Transportation The tram stop is a 10 minute walk from the hotel and for 2.40 euro each way you can get to centrall station. OVERALL Cheapish would we go back MMMMM have to think about it as it was being redecorated as we were there Shop around to see if you can get a better hotel as we wouldnt recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rach994
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a short break in Amsterdam staying in the HEM Hotel. I had read some of the previous reviews and was really surprised by the rooms when i got there. I stayed in the main building and had no complaints about the service or rooms. If you are looking for a cheap hotel out of the city centre then the HEM is good. The only down side would be the shower, went everywhere but on you. And the bar area closed most nights at 9 which we found out on the first night so just stayed in the city longer The trams come and go about every 10 mins to the city centre and cost less than 2 euros, and they continue until about half 12 at night. They are only a short walk from the hoel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Clearful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend in amsterdam and stayed in the HEM Hotel. For the price it was good. Arrived to the hotel at 11.30 and was informed that although some rooms were ready we had to pay an additional â‚¬20 to go to the room before 2.30pm which is a very stange because the room was already ready and clean. Outside the hotel is the two star accommodation. We were told that was where we were staying but I had read reviews on that and decided we did not want to stay there so for few extra euros we were upgraded to the three star which is the main hotel bulding. Found the stay to be very pleasent. No real complaints. In a good location some shops near by and only 15mins for the centre of it all on the tram #2.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you get a refurbished room”
Reviews.Author: Token07
Reviews.Content: Just back from a weekend here. A basic budget hotel - but only if you get the right room. We were part of a large group and others had better rooms that meet the basic budget standard - our first room failed miserably but we were moved when we complained. They are refurbishing rooms and those in the atrium area seem OK. Some tips - most bathrooms result in flooded floors, although some with shower doors (most have curtains) are OK. DO NOT accept a keycard - ensure it is a key, the keycards always give problems and the room either doesn't lock or you struggle to gain access. Older rooms have a non-smoking sticker (usually stuck on over another sticker) but stink of smoke - so I guess these were previous smoking rooms. Look for a radiator not the unreliable "air conditioning unit". I think 3 stars is over generous but found staff pleasant. Night staff badly handled a false fire alarm and next day the alarms on that floor just dangled from the wall - so safe??

Reviews.Title: “Hate it... Un-safe”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is Horrible. What they show you online is not what oyu get. When we arrived they were two buldings one looks like a trailor and the other really nice. Only to find out they had put us in the trailor. It is not worth the money. Go else where!

Reviews.Title: “In 3 words...Don't Do it.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: To Start: 1) The sheets are less comfortable than sandpaper. 2) Many people had complained of lost items in their hotel room. The cleaning staff steal from the rooms, and the management takes zero responsibility for them. The management has suboptimal customer service training. 3) It's a 20 Euro cab ride back from the centre of town, or a 20 min tram ride. I'd rather spend the extra $ on a better hotel, or a worse hotel and a good dinner instead. 4) I requested a smoking room that they did not provide. 5) I even left a day early, and paid for the night I didn't use - it just wasn't worth it. 6) The soda machine constantly ate my friend's coins. 7) The window's didn't open in my room. No fresh air. Recommendation: Stay in a hotel/hostel in the city - for Amsterdam, it isn't worth staying so far out - and Don't stay at the HEM.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful!!”
Reviews.Author: sabri_peru
Reviews.Content: I wasn't allowed to check in because they were cleaning the room, when I finally got in.. there were yellow stains in the blankets and lots of hair in the floor of the bathroom. Not only that, the last day someone got in my room and stole something from me. The answer I received after my complain was every guest is supposed to take care of their belongings Can you believe it???

Reviews.Title: “OK...but be careful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well, I was aware that the hotel falls into a category refered as "budget hotels". Bearing this in mind, one can say that the hotel fulfilled my expectations. A tram stations is 5min walking distance form the hotel, and the tram No.2 will take you to the city centre within 25min. I found that acceptable considering the price (50e pp incl. breakfast). A room was fairly good (minor problems with shower), hotel stuff not most pleasent one, breakfast was good. The biggest problem which made me to drop a review for the hotel was that my brand new mobile-phone was stolen from the room. Before we went to the city centre in the morning I left the phone in the room because I wanted to spend a quiet and releaxed day with my girlfriend and when we came back I relized that someone has nicked the phone from the room. I tried to report theft to hotel management but they couldn't care less. That was a very frustrating eperience and it never happened to me before in any hotel in any country before. Anyhow, if you are willing to risk with your valuables, HEM hotel in Amsterdam may be a good choice for a weekend in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Not brilliant”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my business colleagues and I to stay in during an exhibition at the RAI, as not many hotels were available. Everyone thought it was very basic and no-one would choose to stay again. It wasn't even cheap as during exhibitions the price of all hotel rooms increases significantly. A number of us had the same problem as another reviewer of the bathroom flooding when we took a shower. The rooms were also very hot. Wireless access is a lot cheaper than other hotels though.

Reviews.Title: “Fine as long as you're prepared for travelling”
Reviews.Author: EveryAnywhere
Reviews.Content: Booked with expedia so all money was paid upfront. Arrived at Schipol airport at 7.35pm and got a connexions minibus direct to the hotel for 11 Euros (did not want to walk around with luggage looking for public transport routes) - they drop off to hotels on demand, luckily the HEM was the first on the route this time. The hotel is 30mins tram journey to the Centre - #2 leaves from Westlengracht stop. The last tram back is 12.15 from Centraal station so do plan for this else you're relying on nightbuses - 351. Spent 3 nights there and concluded we need to brush up on orienteering skills : got disorentated every night, the worst being the first night where we got off a nightbus in the middle of nowhere. This delayed getting back to the hotel by 50 mins on the first night but got the delay down to 15 mins by the 3rd night. The real problem is many of the roads look like one another. If you can take around a small map of the locality this might help if you take the wrong turn. The rooms were quite small and basic i.e enough room for the beds and little else but were in a good state of repair. The bathroom area was v. small but was clean and well presented. Went for a short break so little time was spent in the room - it was purely a place to sleep and wash. Got a taste for the ham and cheese toasties for breakfast at the hotel(3 Euros). Despite other reviews read before going, found the staff approachable and informative esp. the eastern lady serving at the bar. Did agree that 4 Euros per night for a safety box was a bit much but generally found amsterdam to be quite expensive though it's a beautiful canal strewn city.

Reviews.Title: “Warning!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This Hotel obviusly has a scam going on. We got our room in some barracks beside the hotel building. And the barracks was old, and not temporary. It is much else to write about this hotel, but this sums up our advice to you: use your money elswhere.
